description:
If you are looking for a great cheesesteak look no further in the Cheese Steak Shop on Divisadero.  I've been coming to this place for year i've been coming to this place for years, and I have yet to be let down. The people here are some of the most genuine people you'll ever meet here and San Francisco. 

The food here is absolutely amazing and is made to order, and the food is not that pricey at all! They also have this really cool loyalty program that will get you free food. So once again if you're looking for a good place to eat, and in the mood for some Philly,  this is where you want to go!
author: Bre'an H.

description:
As a native Philadelphian I am always wary of cheesesteaks outside of the Philly area. Today was my first time visiting the CSS. There were two signs that indicated this may not be a bad experience. First, I saw they used Amoroso rolls. That's half the battle with making a good cheesesteak. The second sign was hearing the sounds of the cook actually chopping the steak. 

I ordered the classic. It's was a pleasure to eat. While it's not as good as my favorite spot back home, this place absolutely does justice to the art of making a cheesesteak. It's pretty comparable to most places in Philly if I'm being honest. 

Definitely will be back when I have that urge for a taste of home!!!!
author: Shannon G.

description:
This place has been around forever as a staple for cheese steak lovers in San Francisco for good reason!

I came here with my dad like a decade ago and it's still just as I remember it. It's definitely an older casual, fast-food style place with no frills. There are a few locations around the Bay Area, though this is the only one in SF. 

My favorite is the Motown Philly--the combination of mushrooms, provolone cheese, and the steak for me is a home-run. The bread is nicely soft and chewy making it easier to manage eating. Loved that my friend got the sweet peppers on the side; they were pretty similar in taste to pickles to cut through the richness.

What's also nice is that they have a couple sides to choose from: onion rings, curly fries, sweet potato fries....have each person in your party get a different one so you can steal each other's! hehe. 

I'm not around this area much but if you happen to be craving a philly cheesesteak around here, it's the place to go!
author: Clarissa C.

description:
What makes this place stand out from the others... I'd have to say the sweet peppers... insert drool! You have your savory meats, gooey cheese and a hint of heat and sweetness from the peppers. I love that they have steak fries too! Steak fries are my fav fries and best shape for fries IMO. I just noticed they had sweet potato fries too. Too many options. 

 Service can be a little slow but I saw there was an option to place an order online which I might try next time to beat the lunch rush. Signage is terrible as its a yellow awning that reads "may become habit forming". Which I feel is just terrible signage. 

Parking is tough but there is plenty of seating here
author: Lindsay C.

description: Today I was Xtra hungry so I ordered the " King of Philly" which is a large with double meat and cheese for about $2.00 more than a regular large. So good- and they remembered my hot peppers  and service seemed smoother today-so they get their 5 stars back.YUM
author: Matthew S.

description:
I had a medium sub at about 1pm and I was full for HOURS like I didn't eat again until the next morning. These are huge and worth every. Single. Bite. Yum. 

Okay so the service, I came in for the first time and the very nice women at the counter was beyond helpful! She convinced me to try the garlic philly and take out the peppers because your girl hates spice, super grateful. 

We got the corn nuts and fries per the kind lady's recommendation and they were soooo good! Heart eyes and drooling over the memory, it cures the homesickness for this southern bell. 

All I'm saying is this, if you are sober this place is great, if you looking drunk munchies that will cure even the most enthusiastic drinker, this place the holy grail! It's cheesy, it's greasy, it's so flavorful, it's worth it.
author: Nicole K.

description:
Quick and cheap. This is a great spot to drop into for a quick lunch. There a nice amount of seating so you don't have to rush out. The parking on Divisadero is not that great so walk over if you're in the neighborhood. 

I just love these cheesy gooey cheesesteaks. 

I ordered a regular philly cheese steak $8.59 
Small curly fries $2.19

These cheesesteaks are some of the best I've found. I haven't been lucky enough to stumble upon a better option. I love the simplicity. Their menu does include other items but I prefer the plain and simple cheesesteak; meat, cheese, onions and peppers. Pure perfection. The steak was cooked nicely and seasoned well. Never disappointed when I come here. 

The fries were just that. Fries. Nothing to brag about. Complimented my meal well.
author: Ty S.

description: This place changed :( they don't even cook the peppers with the sandwich , they literally put cold peppers on it !!! New menu and everything. Not the same place I remember going to all my life
author: China D.

description: I love this place! It's so nice to be able to still get a yummy cheap meal here in SF. The atmosphere is casual and simple. Food is the best! I really like the rolls they use for their cheesesteaks and I can never pass up their curly fries. Yum
author: Angela A.

description: Warning: may be habit forming is right! This place is fire! For the price and what you get... amazing! They just changed up the menu and I can't remember the name of what I got, but I got a Large sandwich with mushroom and spinach with provolone cheese and curly fries. No condiments or peppers. The ordering process is easy. 5 step: which kind of sandwich, protein (chicken or steak), size, cheese (provolone or Swiss? I think), and condiments (grilled onions, peppers, etc). The other picture is a half sandwich. This place also has the sweetest people working here. I must come back for the sweet potato fries!
author: Caitlyn S.

description: If you're a Philly native and either traveling out here for business or stuck out here for work, the cheese steaks here are as close as you'll get to the real thing. (Each California franchise functions as sort of a "mini-shrine" to the cheese steak concept; walls are adorned with photos of Philly-area cheese steak "temples.") Although the quality of the actual sandwich can vary from franchise op to franchise op in the SF Bay Area, the store at Divis gets it right every time, regardless of whether you're sans or pro-pepper. Healthy sandwich sizes plus great-tasting steak fries. Homesickness-soothing Tastykakes top off the meal.
author: Laurie S.

description:
Not a true Philly cheese steak - not even a whiz option, but decent for an imitation. Meat is also on the dry side
-Philly native
author: Eric S.

description:
Everyone seems to have good things to say about this place but it felt very mediocre to me. I ordered a medium Philly cheese steak with curly fries. The steak was a bit dry, didn't like how the cheese was gooey instead of stringy. The peppers added a good touch of spice and sweetness. Bread was fine but looks quite unappealing. Curly fries were a bonus. 

Food takes a good 15 mins to come out. The interior feels very rundown and rustic, more like an old Subway or Burger King. Prices and portion are good and they do a stamp card if you find yourself coming here 10 times. 

Food: 3/5
Value: 3.5/5
Service: 3/5
Overall: 3.25/5
author: Brian G.

description:
What makes a Philly Steak Philly? The Amoroso roll. That (to me) qualifies these steaks as authentic. But that's the extent of it. The difference between a decent philly steak and a great one is that the great one is served on an Amoroso roll baked THAT MORNING. That, of course, is impossible in San Francisco. But even overlooking that, this steak would rate as below average in Philadelphia.

That said, it's a fine sandwich and the menu has some neat options. It gets the job done and it's still better than any other imitation philly steak. Service was a bit slow because they were taking care of a bunch of delivery orders when I came in. Store could use a bit of a refresh. If I was from around here, I might eat here every once in a while.
author: Rich F.

description: Just ordered and this is what I got.  Ever since new ownership and the new digital menu board, I guess cost cutting went up.  A small sandwich was still a whole sandwich back in the day, now they call it a half, which it is literally.  I don't even want to start on the portion of fries they gave me, just take a look at the photo BEFORE I even touched anything in the basket.  I'm punching myself for leaving a tip in advance of receiving my order.  Your cheesesteaks are still good, but you need to step up your game.  Well, at least your portions.
author: Woojoo C.

description:
I called in and placed an order for pickup last night (7/26/18) When I walked in, there was 1 person in line. The lady at the register clearly made eye contact with me and gave me grin.. while waiting for the customer to decide what he wants; somebody walks in the restaurant and walks straight to the register (cuts me and the man in front of me)! I assumed he just needed condiments or napkins or something.. But instead , the lady at the register greets this "cutter",  "hi, you have a phone order?"???

Umm I do too!! 

I'm not just standing here for fun!
So I just walked out.. take that 12 inch sandwich and shove it!! I'm not paying for this BS service!
author: Michael G.

description:
Been here multiple times at a different location in the East Bay and they never disappointed! Went to this location and was not disappointed either, until i ordered via Doordash. My King of Philly? Well, a subway sandwich is thicker than what I had received, and my sides that I ordered weren't even close to what I wanted. 

Best to go in and order when you're in the area I guess...
author: Angel F.

description: Great greesie philly cheese. Best around. Parking can be difficult at times, but worth the hassle and wait. It's a philly cheese steak, so yeah its greesie but in a good way. Very tasty and they have many selections and options.
author: Andrew M.

description: Well where to begin... the bread was cold, the peppers were cold. I had to wait 40 mins to get a sandwich. The staff don't care and are old and slow. Had to ask them for my sandwich and if it was done.
author: Amine M.

description:
Basic sandwich shop but with excellent cheese steaks! Fast and friendly staff that get you fed quickly and on your way at lunchtime. Close to UCSF and Kaiser on Divisadero. 
Yes they could be habit forming as the sign says.
author: Bruce B.

description:
It's a chain.
This version is true to form.
Good cheese steak sandwich, heavy on the grease (it just pours out when you pick it up) and light on the cheese (and it's not cheese wiz).

I'm very sad that corn fritters have been removed from the stores (but not yet from the menus). I actually like them better than the sandwiches. And you can get cheesesteak a lot of places, but not the fritters.

They were quite busy when I went, but the line to order at least felt longer than the wait for food afterword. Staff at ordering and pickup were friendly.

Except for the lack of fritters. I'm happy to recommend this place.
author: R H.

description: I'm writing this from the restaurant, where I'm waiting for a sandwich that was supposed to be ready over half an hour ago. Two of us are missing work because they lied to us about when our food would be ready. Can't review the food because I *still* don't have it.
author: Aidan G.

description:
I believe this is the original location of what became a huge chain. They make a good cheesesteak and I say that having lived in Philadelphia for four years. 

This particular location has better quality than some others like let's say Livermore or Hayward. Maybe better than pleasanton. 

The line does move a little slow when you are ordering which really can matter at times. I did once leave here to go to the athletic club down the street for that reason.

Otherwise it's a good spot and usually you can get parking which is a plus.
author: David A.

description:
First off, the place can't make a decent philly to save their lives, a child could do better. Secondly how does a place specializing in philly cheese steaks run out of ingredients for their speciality menu item. 

My tip to the owner(s), learn to make a proper philly and fire your manager who is so incompetent that they ran out of ingredients before noon. While you are at it replace the "cooks" who don't know what they are doing. You and your bottom line will thank me in the end.
author: Brendan M.

description:
It's been YEARS since I last visited this shop.  So long ago, that they now have a digital menu instead of a printed one on the wall. 
The day I visited, they were out of medium & large rolls. Leaving the only option to a small. 
But making lemonade out of lemons, I ordered two small sandwiches, knowing I could have a nice lunch the next day. 
The person who helped me was very apologetic for the roll issue, & was very friendly. 
I seem to remember there being more bacon in the steak I ordered in the past, but it was still delicious. 
Parking is Hell.  Just so you know this in advance. 
Other than that, go for a great sandwich. 
Apparently Robin Williams used to frequent this joint years ago.  The signed poster on the wall is proof enough for me.
author: Reed S.

description: Meh... the chicken cheese steak was minced chicken- not horrible, but not what I was expecting. I ordered from Eat24 and they didn't get my order right (not only my instructions for things like "raw onions"), but seemed like an almost entirely different sandwich (no lettuce, had peppers,etc). Either way, was fine, the bread saved them, but will stick to busters from now on.
author: CJ T.

description: Stopped by here after Toe-Asis for a bite to eat. I got the chicken philly and my friend got the philly hoggie. We both got the small meal with steak fries and a drink. Great meal overall! The food came up quick and the fries were hot & crispy. The chicken philly was good - the chicken might have been slightly on the drier side but with the cheese, peppers and onions, it tasted really great. Would go again!
author: Alexa S.

description: What a disappointment this place is now! Went there for the first time in a long time and it used to be great. Now that they went corporate sandwiches are small, and the meat is not that great with hardly any cheese on it. Disgraceful to call this place a cheesesteak sandwich store. People in South Philly or laughing their ass off if they see this place. The only thing habit-forming about this place is if you're sadistic and you like to get burned!
author: Marcello R.

description: This cheese steak has and always will be the best thing you can put in your mouth. lol
author: Corey P.

description: The best cheesesteaks in San Francisco,  I gave been going here for years and when I am on that side of town I always get the spinach cheesesteak with garlic. Oh my goodness the bomb!
author: Prima M.

description: Over priced paid for a large cheese steak and got a 6 inch sandwich asked if that was a large the cashier said yes.  Don't think I will be back to the shop.
author: Rickey Y.

description: The service here is terrible. Was in the area which I grew up in and figured I would call to order onion rings. Arrived approximately ten minutes later. As I stood in line behind a long winded customer who shot the shit at the cash register, finally after eight minutes I was next. Remember, I'm here for a pick up that was called in. When my turn came, someone who already placed an order gets the attention and again I'm waiting. Then I'm told they would be right with me. After yet another seven minute wait, I tell him I'm here for my order that was called in. He then walks over to the fryer and discovers two orders of onion rings. One is burned. The other is mine, but the female cook who just returned back from her lunch and who's now making the sandwiches says to him, "don't take my order." Huh? It was my order she claimed. He then opens a bag of onion rings and throws them in the fryer. I asked if that's my order you just threw in. He says yes and tells me it will be quick. No thank you. I walked out. This isn't their first time messing up my order. Won't be going back ever. Don't waste your time with bad service. They know me well, I grew up eating the food here.
author: Terrence P.

description: Walked in this place today super hungry because I missed breakfast. There was about six customers in the whole place. I asked the guy to make mushrooms well done on my sandwich he told me he's too busy for that and if I can hurry up my order it also took 25 minutes for one sandwich and when he called my number I asked him is it too busy or are the employees to slow. I sat down ready to eat and my bread and meat were less than room temperature. The chicken tenders I ordered were half cooked. If you want to eat a good Philly cheesesteak go over to a place called busters. It's  so far the best cheesesteak I've had and they actually care about your custom orders. The Philly cheesesteak shop was good in the mid to late 2000s but since they pay minimum-wage I guess there workers could care less about the food.
author: Adam B.

description: I'm so disappointed. I ordered a veggie sandwich on Uber eats and asked for no mayonnaise.  Eggs make me sick to my stomach which is why I asked for no mayonnaise and my sandwich was completely drenched in it.  Uber is refusing to refund me, yet I had to throw the sandwich away because it wasn't salvageable.  I was left hungry and completely unsatisfied.
author: Vanessa H.

description:
Service was great the cashier took my order helped navigat the menue and offered house specials nit what exoected from a littke dive shop. 

Location: in busy San Fransico, small and not veryclean mist tables could use a quick wipe down other than that the place seemed pretty clean. 

Food: ordered the philly cheesteak with hot peppers and onion rings a yelp favorite for good reasons. Food was great a must try. 

Overall: Good prices, realy good food and great service; could be a little cleaner but overall great experince I would deffinantly come back 4.5 stars.
author: Raymond A.

description: They make good steak sandwich's had mushroom and hot & sweet peppers cheese fries are ok not the cleanest looking place service was good thy have old candlestick park baseball seat there cool...
author: Frankie L.

description:
My goodness, I have dreams about The Cheese Steak Shop! 

I used to work nearby, so it was a bit more convenient. Now it's completely out of the way for me, so I try to make plans nearby as an excuse to drop in and grab some tastiness from this spot! They also have a punch card! 

They've got plenty of great options if you're looking to expand past the "traditional" cheese steak. You can have chicken or beef. I always opt for beef, of course. Sweet peppers, hot peppers and grilled onions. Your choice! Melty, cheesy goodness mixed in and you've got the greasy sandwich that makes you feel warm inside. You even have the option to add more meat (extra cost) or just get the "King of Philly" which is the medium sized cheese steak with extra meat and extra cheese. 

There's nothing fancy about this place, so you know you're going to get some good food! Parking isn't too bad during certain parts of the day, but it's near one of UCSF's campuses so it can get busy.
author: Aaron Y.

description: Loyal customer for years, new owner removed my favorite item, the corn fritters. won't ever be back. Way to ruin it.
author: Kyle S.

description: All the melted cheese and delicious steak. Whole garlic cloves added. Curly fries, crispy on the outside, but not all the way through.
author: Nick L.

description: One of the best cheesesteaks in the city, hands down. The interior is a bit torn down and rustic, which might be unappealing to some. I come for the food, so that doesn't really bother me. I actually think it's pretty cool.
author: Majid A.

description: One of the best cheese steak sandwiches I have tried. It's an old place, but that is one of things I liked, it gives charm to it.
author: Igor S.

description: I've been looking for a good sandwich shop in the City and I think I found one. The decorations are a little dated, but that doesn't take away from the food. I've been here three times and have gotten the spinach, green chili, and original steak sandwiches, all of which have been great! My favorite was the spinach. I'd recommend asking for light jalapeños, just cause there was a lot on mine the last time and it was kind of unbearable, but I easily picked some off and enjoyed the rest of my meal. For a reasonable price (less than 10), I'd highly recommend hitting this place up.
author: Juan T.

description: This place is my shrine, I go here regularly to cleanse my soul of sins. nough said
author: Dmitry B.

description: Used to have the best cheesesteaks in town! Changed owners, it's not the same cheesesteak that I grew up with. RIP Double Stamp Tuesdays.
author: Justine L.

description:
This place is legit. Not the best cheesesteak I've ever had, but I don't have much to compare it to in SF. The employees are also always super nice. 
I recommend the King of Philly. It's a little pricier but has the right amount of meat and cheese.
author: Brendan B.

description:
Busy lunch Tuesday...Bridget the manager was great as she was very friendly and accommodating despite the long line. 

Awesome service in one of the best cheesesteaks in San Francisco!!
author: PM S.

description: Been going here since I was a kid and it's still my favorite cheesesteak spot in the city. Always hits the spot
author: Jasmine E.

description: Bridget is an angel and hooked us up with extra meat after an Eagles win. 5 stars for service and sandwiches.
author: Madi K.

description: I use to love this place !  They had the best cheesesteaks in San Francisco. Tonight when I walked into Cheesesteak there was only one person there. Bad sigh. The place use to be  crowded almost all the time. Phone orders were always at least a 30 minute wait. I had a bad feeling......they told me the previous owner sold the place and that they are the new owners.  Another bad sigh. They changed the menu. No more 15 inch cheesesteaks. Another bad sigh. No more Italian Hoagies. What  ? Another bad sigh. I should have left right then. I had the cheesesteak king size with onions,  peppers, and provolone cheese. It was awful. No flavor and dry as heck. The previous owners cheesesteaks were delicious and went down like  butter. This place went from being the best cheesesteaks in San Francisco to the worse cheesesteaks in San Francisco.
author: Stash P.

description: OMG. The cheese steaks here are unbelievable.  Hands down, the best cheese steak in the city.  I have a number of cheese steaks over the years and the one's here are above par.  They're a guilty pleasure b/c the steaks are a bit greasy. Luckily, I don't live next to this shop.  The fries are good here as well but I do wish I get a little more fries with my order.  FYI, they do have dessert I learned, it's a few different flavors of Tasty Cakes.  If you are in a cheesesteak mood I would definitely recommend this place. My only tip for you is call in your order b/c this place is constantly busy especially for lunch and they are a little slow getting out the orders.  So call ahead and save some time.
author: Mike S.

description: I've been coming here since they first opened back in the early 1980s, but learned on my most recent visit (7/9/18) that their new idiot owner will be eliminating hoagies from the menu. S.F. desperately needs a Jersey Mike's franchise, now more than ever!
author: Pizza X.

description: Disgusting. We got a zesty veg sandwich to go. It was just soggy and gross. I think the peppers saved an otherwise useless sandwich. Maybe we were at fault for ordering vegetarian. But don't put it in you menu if you don't wanna make it right
author: Ashmita V.

description: BEST. CHEESESTEAK. EVER. Well maybe just the best in SF. Everything in the cheesesteak was so fresh and just mouth watering. I'm addicted!
author: Jojo M.

description:
Update: it was so good, it was worth the wait I detailed below. Will be returning!

Original:

Terrible wait times. 

People coming in ordering after me were getting their orders before me. Took no less than 20 minutes with only 5 customers in the restauran

Will not be returning.
author: Dominic P.

description: Always good. Very consistent. They are quick. Nothing fancy but when you crave that cheesesteak...this is the place to go!
author: Melinda L.

description: This is my son's fave cheese steak place. He always orders a King if Philly. I, on the other hand, am indifferent because their meat and veggies have no flavor nor seasoning. Love the fries, but I would come here for the fries if I have the craving. Employees are nice and pleasant people. Theyre always friendly every time we get a chance to grab a bite to eat here.
author: Ítala P.

description:
Awesome Postmates transaction. Fast!

Delicious onion rings held their crunch in transit! Hallelujah. 

But the sandwich was not much thicker then a couple of flautas put together. That I couldn't enjoy more delicious chicken and cheez whiz was the biggest disappointment. Well, that and the fact that I felt ripped off because of the Postmates convenience charge. I didn't even get to enjoy the splurge.
author: Jeremy D.

description:
The Cheese Steak Shop has the best cheese steak I have ever had. It's the kind of food that if you eat it once, you will crave it often. 

The shop works as a fast-food place in which you place your order at the cashier and wait for your name to be called to get your delicious food. 

My recommendation is to get the "Guylic" Cheese Steak with all the topping (onions, green peppers, and red peppers), with a side of steak fries. The cheesesteak is juicy, tasty, and very well seasoned. It's a party for your taste buds. The cheese is really good and the beef is just perfect, all that enveloped by a soft bun. 

They have amazing sides, so if you come with someone else, try as many as you can.

Portions are super big. They have a loyalty stamp card. Remember to bring it. Tuesdays and Sundays you get double stamps. They also have other deals in other days of the week. 

Lunch hour is bit full here. The wait is not super long and it is really worth it.
author: Andréia S.

description:
"CAUTION: MIGHT BE HABIT FORMING!"

I read the sign outside as I walked in for the first time, I thought to myself what that sign meant.

ATMOSPHERE:
This is one of the hole-in-the-wall restaurants that I have passed by numerous times and not once did I notice them in the Divisadero! The interior was a bit tiny and could probably fit about 20 people. I could tell it's maintained a bit and that this place has been around for a while.

FOOD:
I ordered the 7" Philly cheese steak with "guylic" chips. I also requested hot peppers in my chees steak. At first, I was confused what "guylic" was but it turned to be "garlic" with an accent. Note that the chips I ordered were literally chips and not french fries!

The Philly cheese steak was literally the best Philly cheese steak I've ever had! The meat mixed with the cheese and hot peppers complemented each other so well that the flavors were wrestling in my mouth! Not only was the Philly cheese steak amazing, but also their chips! It came out hot, fresh, and crispy. The seasoning on top was icing on the cake!

CUSTOMER SERVICE:
There wasn't a lot of interaction with the employees because they're too busy making the best Philly cheese steak in the world, but the cashier was friendly to me and even gave me a rewards card.

After devouring everything, I slowly left the restaurant stuffed.

Now I know why they had a caution sign because I've been craving it every day after I had it...

NOTE: I'm actually planning to go there already. I committed to it.
author: Aj C.

description:
Phenomenal!  Came here on the recommendation of a friend who's been coming for years and I was NOT disappointed. 

He ordered a 15 inch deluxe cheesesteak with almost everything in the kitchen on it. 2 people could easily share it. 

I got a 10 inch regular philly with onions and peppers and was sent to heaven. Easily the best cheesesteak outside of actual philly. And super cheap! Have to limit myself to maybe once a month now.
author: Michael P.

description:
The cheesesteaks are great but the guy running the orders in the front is too slow! Seriously two guys ordering took 10 min each! 

Terrible service, I am born and raised in SF and these damn immigrants are working for these food services and jamming up the lines.

I will come back only when you improve the speed of your line!
author: Raymond A.

description:
Ever since I moved here, I've been searching for for that perfect Philly cheesesteak.  And after 13 long years, I believe I've found it.   Tis thee, Cheese Steak Shop, tis thee..

Check it: my band of brothers went on an epic quest a couple weeks ago: 3 cheesesteaks in 1 day, all to decide upon the best one in the Bay.  We had scoring sheets and everything, super legit shit.  

We started with Jersey Joe's in San Carlos, then here, and finished at Phat Philly's.  The other places had bigger portions and nicer presentation but The Shop won hands down in terms of that authentic East Coast flavor, son! Amoroso rolls, check.  Gooey molten cheese & steak, check.  No frills, just flava, check.

Don't mess around with that spinach & steak nonsense,  order the King Philly and load that boy up with hot sauce (DC-style) and you'll be in heaven.  My mouth is watering as I write this.  Habit-forming, indeed.   Well played, Cheese Steak Shop, well played..
author: Saminda W.

description: Been coming to this place for years. My mom always used to bring home a hoagie for me and that's what I still get. Sometimes I mess with the different fried sides but it's all about that cheese steak or hoagie.
author: Randy B.

description: I had the cheese steak w/ provolone, spinach, mushroom, and grilled onions. It definitely hit the spot. Good quality meat and bread. Of course it doesn't live up to something like Jim's in Philly, but it's the best I've had in SF so far
author: Michael S.

description: This is ridiculous! We ordered two normal cheeseteaks for lunch, and theres as much meat as an Oscar Mayer hotdog on this over-steamed bread. Super frustrated that it arrived cold, and then to see this. Unacceptable.
author: Sean H.

description:
If I could give zero stars I would.... first 25 mins for a large straight forward cheese steak, ok didn't look busy but things happen. Finally got my steak and with peppers, so excited! 

When I sat down and looked at it one half of my steak was all peppers with a sprinkling on meat! The other have was fine. So I went back to the counter... " hey man can I get some meat on this side?" Answer for the kid behind the counter " we portion our meat so everyone gets the same amount."  I than said does this look the same" pointing  to the normal half. Answer there's meat on there! WTF!!! I had been coming here for a very long time long before the first dot.com crash.... never going back. You should try Jay's Steak don't make the same mistake I did!
author: James K.

description: Generous portions of finely chopped meat. Great curly fries. Best in the city. The medium is about 10 inches and very filling. To go or eat in this place is always delicious. Also don't forget your stamp card!
author: Kelly D.

description: Ordered online for pick up. They forgot 50% of my order and then seemed put out that I asked for my all of my items in original order (that I already pre paid for online). Food seems good, but hard to get what you ordered. It also smells like urine in this place... ewe.
author: Brooke S.

description: The room is evocative of the DMV toward the end of the month, but the cheesesteaks evoke Pat's or Geno's.
author: West R.

description:
I'm willing to try the Cheese Steak Shop again, but my first trip here was just average. The meat in my cheesesteak was not as flavorful as I would have wanted and the green peppers were heavily greasy. The fries are thick cut which are good if you like steak fries, but I definitely prefer crispy. I got the garlic fries and I felt like the garlic was not cooked well with with the fries, more thrown on top. Pros: service was quick, relatively inexpensive, and comes with a frequent customer card.

Their slogan is "habit forming." I can't say that after this visit as I was mostly unimpressed, but as mentioned, I'm willing to give it another taste.
author: Will H.

description: As an east coast girl I wanted to say ... ok, but this place is great. Excellent,fresh, hot, good ingredients!!!
author: Lesa J.

description:
I'm in so much trouble. The Cheese Steak Shop is way too close to my apartment and very serves addictive food. Too many sub/sandwich shops have too much bread for the content, but these cheesesteak sandwiches are a perfect balance.

The bread is delicious, the meat, cheese, peppers, and onions are amazing. I didn't have any fries, but I did have one and a half sandwiches. See, I just ordered a medium and my wife got a steak salad. Then she decided that my sandwich looked too good and had me get a small so she could have half. Even though I was pleasantly full from my medium, I devoured the other half of the small.

The spicy peppers have a great kick and the sweet peppers have great flavor. I didn't try the fries, but they looked good as well. Next time (and there will be a next time), I'll have to save room for them.

This is not a fancy place, but there is plenty of seating. The staff is quite friendly and the food is prepared with care. If you like cheesesteak sandwiches, I highly recommend this place.
author: Kevin H.

description: This place has never failed to disappoint me. Sure the inside and atmosphere can feel old and rundown, but the food is to die for. I. LOVE. THIS. PLACE.
author: Matthew A.

description:
Best cheesesteak I've found in SF so far. I'm not sure how "authentic" it is in relation to Philly, but it's the closest I've found in SF.

It seems like the "King of Philly" may be the way to go (more meat and cheese). May be habit forming.
author: Zoran L.

description: Today I got the Philly Guylic which was great! The customer service is good as always and the establishment is clean and well maintained.
author: Nae F.

description: Probably the best Philly Cheesesteak in San Francisco. Generous on all ingredients and prepared in traditional style.
author: Michael S.

description: As a San Francisco native, I can say without fail that The Cheese Steak Shop has the best philly cheese steaks in the city. The food is excellent, but the service could be better. The line is pretty long and they could use more people working in the front to take orders.
author: Isabelle G.

description: Grabbed lunch here today. My mom really likes this place as a San Francisco native she's been coming to eat here for 20 years. We were very disappointed by the customer service we experienced today. While my mom was eating her food she noticed there were bones in her sandwich. She called up to let them know there were bones in her sandwich, she was calling them more as a heads up not to complain as like I said before she's been coming here for 20 years so she wants to see the business thrive. Instead of saying thank you for the heads up or even sorry she got a rude response saying we don't have bones in our meat. Well clearly they do. Today they have lost a long time customer.
author: tatiana f.

description: Fabulous Cheesesteak.  I use one word to spell Cheesesteak, not two like their name.  Have spelled it this way since living in Philly pre-'75.  Went to their first original shop on Divisadero in SF before they moved up the street to this location!  Late '70's?  Fresh raw onions & mushrooms as well as wonderful garlicky roasted garlic cloves.  Although pre-roasted, they're soft & delicious.  Amoroso rolls from Philly & they sell a few varieties of TastyKake.  For those who believe they're using less meat, see my pic!  My 10" steak couldn't have been better.  Like that they do not heat the roll on the grill as this takes away from its cheweyness, not that there's such a word,!
author: Joshua C.

description:
Best place to get a cheese steak this side of South Philly. At this location you get all the vibe and attitude.  

Make sure you pick up a frequency card.  You might think you'll never go back, but as their slogan says, Caution, may be habit forming.  Want a healthy alternative?  They do have Chicken and Vegetable alternatives.  

This is not a Wit Wiz type of place.  Standard sandwich asks if you want peppers, onions, and cheese.  Small is 7" and large is 10"

A good recommendation is to put them on auto-dial.  Phone orders allow for you to skip the line when you arrive.

This place has been savior for many late nights at the adjacent UCSF clinic while waiting for loved ones.  There are many other locations in the Bay Area.  I've only been to the other one in Berkeley
author: Erik H.

description: It's a great cheese steak. No frills, great food and great people. You want good food without all the unnecessary accompanying fluff, come here. Legitimately good steaks.
author: Shaun P.

description:
Used to be good, not great, but good.  I could always forgive the general uncleanliness and disorder of this joint.  Even the sterile cold environment could be forgiven (it's not 5 star dinning).  However, I was driving by the other day and haven't been in years, so I stopped in.  Staff were friendly enough, at least they were not SF rude.  Got a simple cheese steak.  As some of my fellow yelpers mentioned; where's the meat???!!!!  It was all peppers and a light drizzle of meat.  Additionally, WHERE IS THE CHEESE?????  It's a -CHEESE STEAK!!!  When I brought this to the attention of the "manager", I received what appears to be their standard line - "the meat is proportioned for every sandwich".  Proportioned to feed a mouse.  When I asked about the cheese, well, I received some whacked out line, we melt the cheese into the bread????!!!  WHAT?  Cheese steak should be dripping with ooozzzie Velvita nasty yellow cheese and over flowing with meat and peppers.  

This place like so many has turned into another clip joint that serves a substandard product for a lot of money (relatively).  But alas they will survive on one time customers, people who go once every 2 years or drunks so bombed they could be eating their own foot and it wouldn't matter.  

Drag, used to be good, now - don't bother unless you don't want a cheese steak.
author: Rusty G.

description:
One of my favorite places to eat in San Francisco!

I've bee going here for months now and they're consistent with what they're selling. I usually order the medium Philly Cheese Steak with twister fries or garlic chips and it compliments each other so well. Since I love spicy, I also ask for extra hot peppers.

The space is tight and there's only like 8-10 tables but I've never had a problem. Staff is pretty friendly too!
author: Rick O.

description: Truly the best Philly cheese steak without being in Philly . Great place a must try . !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Alex S.

description: My favorite place to grab a chicken hoagie. It's the bread that makes it all work together. Add some sweet peppers and curly fries and you are good to go! Parking can be tough. Can't wait to come back
author: Pravin L.

description: Get the king steak philly 10" with everything.  I've never eaten a better philly anywhere else and I've tried.  They are consistent too.  Same satisfying sandwich every single time.  I've never tried anything else on the menu and I rarely ever eat in.
author: Albert A.

description: Best cheesesteak ever! Places is super old but food is awesome. And the people are friendly! Is the original real deal!
author: Michele T.

description:
Number one priority for a cheesesteak place - make delicious cheeseteak! And man, does this place deliver. I got the "guylic" cheesteak with mushrooms, and it exploded with delicious flavors. The garlic isn't overwhelming, despite the name, and the peppers were cooked just right so the flavor was present but not overwhelming.

The prices are pretty good for this neighborhood, too! You can get a full lunch for ~$7. It's only when you add sides that things get expensive. 

My only complaint is that they really bombed the fried zucchini. I love fried zucchini, and to have it be disappointing is a little bit heartbreaking...or at least enough to take one star off the review. 

I'll definitely be back!
author: Chris S.

description:
MY CREDIT CARD INFORMATION WAS POSSIBLY STOLEN AT THIS LOCATION.
I was visiting SF and ate at the Cheese Steak Shop on Divisadero St Nov. 24, 2015, and I used a credit card to pay for my lunch.   It was the only credit card purchase I made in SF.  Starting Nov. 25 I had multiple fraudulent charges on my credit card in SF totaling almost $1000.  While I do not know for certain, I speculate my credit card information was stolen at this location.  I never had any fraudulent charges before in my lifetime. If you eat there, I strongly suggest you pay cash.
author: Diane D.

description: incredibly solid experience. friendly staff, quality sandwiches. i do wish cheez whiz was on the menu, so i'll still have to give buster's a slight edge over this place for authenticity. that said, both places are worth 5 stars for what they offer and the cheese steak shop is still great. this place also has the absolute best onion rings i've found anywhere on the west coast - it's worth coming here just for those.
author: Lars A.

description:
I absolutely love this place!

It is a place I always visit while I am in San Francisco.  It is just around the corner from my friends apartment.

I like to order the "Classic" steak philly, with everything (grilled onions, hot and sweet peppers and mushrooms).  So delicious, made fresh and piping hot!  Their fries are good as well.

The staff is always friendly.  We usually call in our order so it is ready to pick up when we walk over.  I've noticed that things take a bit long if you just walk in and order, but it's not big deal.

This isn't a place I would say to go out of your way for, but if you are hungry and in the area - check it out!
author: Teri W.

description: Best cheese steaks in SF hands down. Always worth the trip . King of Philly is the perfect size.
author: Oscar A.

description: Delicious, great veggie options, great snacks, and all the friedness you could want. Love the chicken option!
author: Ari O.

description:
Wow. Really really good. Absolutely habit forming.

Excellent quality meat and I LOVE the sweet peppers ( I think they are pickled but not sure). Even the bread is fresh, sweet and good, and offers a contrast in this land of sour dough.

Recently they repainted the interior, long overdue, but do not let the dining room dissuade you. By all means get the frequent buyer card.

What size is right, 10 inch or 14 inch?Does not matter as you will eat it all in either case.

And you will enter Zen. mmmmm!
author: E F.

description:
I have been to Philly so many times and used to get cheese steak all the time.
I really liked their classic one. Good amount of cheese and peppers!
I would go back if I am in the area :)
author: C M.

description: * LOVE this place!! Can't go wrong with the King of Philly - double meat and double cheese goodness
author: Cassandra T.

description: If you're craving a cheese-steak, this place works. It's got a good neighborhood vibe, but the meat to bun ratio is way off. If you get toppings inside, it's a good ratio...but arguably not a cheese-steak then.
author: R S.

description: I'm more at 3.5 stars than 3 but definitely not 4 because of how skimpy they've gotten with everything.  Been coming here for years and it's just not the same.  They want to give you less but charge you more (cmon guys).  Also, after spending about $40 I asked for some ranch an they want to charge me 50 cents....really?  But back to the cheesesteaks... just scroll through the pics and you can see some disappointing portions.  I ordered  the King of Philly (10" extra meat and cheese) and my girl got a regular 10" and I couldn't see a difference.  I had to ask which was which lol!   So now I order a King of Philly with extra meat lol (sad but true).  But overall the cheesesteaks here are very tasty.  If you have a big appetite like me and want a filling cheesesteak just order the King of Philly with extra meat (about $12.50).
author: Mike V.

description:
It was just ok, a bit disappointed. I have yet to find that ultimate Cheesteak. I am truely at a lost for words - neither in a good way or bad. Just not much to say about the place. 
1/2 of the king philly
garlic, cheese, and mushroom philly
sides: onion rings, curly fries, d/f mushrooms
2 IBC rootbeer

Everything sounds so good on the menu, but once awaiting that first bite I was disappointed. Nothing stood out for me. It just tasted like a great steaks philly from the mall.
author: Mary Ann B.

description:
Truly an original! The best Philly cheesesteak shop in town. In fact there's only four of them in all of California. Total dive with photos of Philly cheesesteak shops all over Philadelphia. And if you get yourself a punch card you get a free 7 inch after 10 purchases.. Or you can go on (I believe) Tuesdays when its 2 for 1. 
In fact they have specials throughout the week
author: Erin L.

description:
After having many real Philly cheesesteaks, I have to say that I'm pleasantly surprised with how awesome this one was!

The price is super reasonable, the place is a little "dive-y" (kind of like philly), but the sandwich was spot on!

I tried one of my friends guylick chips and they were to die for! 


Don't miss out SF! Be a fat kid and get this sandwich NOW!
author: Mike K.

description:
Are you looking for a new zip addiction? Every time I come into the city a cheesesteak here fixes everything. The owners are awesome, I wish they would hire people willing to stay open till 9:10 pm instead of on time. They don't understand some of us have real problems. I will try and get there at 8:58 because I know I won't stop wanting a cheesesteak once the thought crosses my mind. 
              You have to be hard working to burn this kind of love. If the cut is 9pm I will work hard to make the cut but if you "stop taking walk ins" and lock the doors at 8:58pm I will wish you stayed open later or my iPhone wouldn't lie to me about the time.
author: Sass O.

description:
In an era where local establishments are disappearing about as quickly as the city forgoes its building height limits, this San Francisco cheese steak joint still represents the 415 with a little pinch of Philly. The sandwiches are worth 2-3 trips around the block in search of parking. Better yet bike, walk or MUNI there. The understated facade on the Divis corridor doesn't do the delicious product justice, but that's easily overlooked for the moderate price of cheesy-steak goodness. 

SHWINGS: One of the Beat cheese steaks in the city.

DINGS: Habit forming as advertised.
author: Johnny C.

description:
I was originally just going to write an opinion on this place, but after a little thought and a little food I figured that a response to the one and two star reviews would be more useful.

To be fair, this review is based on a morning visit, well before the lunch rush, which may explain some of the discrepancies. Anyhoo, here goes:

1.) "This place is gross and dirty!"

First off, it's not actually that dirty. It may become dirty when it fills up with people, but right now all the tables are clean and it's about as tidy as a place like this can be.

Second off... Where the hell have you people been getting your cheesesteaks? The shop is supposed to be old and dingy. That's how you know the food is good! If you want more sparkle in your atmosphere, you may want to consider a sushi bar.

2.) "The staff are unprofessional!"

My experience here may differ because I beat the rush, but I can't see a source for complaint here. The woman behind the register was sweet and polite. The gentleman behind the grill was a little gruff, but not rude. 

3.) "There's no cheese!"

Now to be honest I agreed with this one at first, but upon closer inspection it turns out that there actually is cheese on the sandwich... It's just fused to the bread so it looks like mayo. Not exactly a defense, but at least there's an explanation.

4.) "It's too expensive!"

Uhhhh... Again I find myself asking, where the hell have you people been eating?! This is San Francisco, guys. Everything is expensive here these days, and that includes lunch. I got a small sandwich, an order of chips, and a drink for about $9. That's not expensive for SF, unless you use McDonalds as a standard... And if that's your metric, for the love of all that is holy, WHY ARE YOU ON YELP?!

***

That said, one thing I will agree with is that for a cheesesteak my sandwich was pretty barren. The fillings were tasty, but there was almost no cheese and... How can I put this delicately? My hands are clean right now. I can type on my smartphone and the screen isn't going berserk. That's not usually the case after I've consumed a cheesesteak. Normally there's grease, onions, cheese residue, and bits of meat all over the place. If I'm not making a mess, my instinct is to think that there's not enough stuff in the sandwich.

 Apparently the sandwiches were not always barren here, so I'm guessing they've cut back on their fixin's as an alternative to raising prices. It seems to be working out for them and I'm actually pretty satisfied (if a little bewildered), so Idunno... Maybe if you want an extra messy cheesesteak you can just ask for extra stuff and pay a little more? That could work.
author: Kathleen P.

description: Rip-off! That is the word these guys have become. They have lost customers with their slow service and now they have cut the meat on sandwiches by at least 50%. A Taco Bell taco has more meat than their 10" steak. The pics here are for a 15". It was like eating meat flavored bread. Pathetic.
author: Zach A.

description:
Nothing special. An average cheesesteak (by Phila. standards). I think some pepper was accidentally poured on mine because it was spicy and it shouldn't have been. American or provolone cheese. Traditional Cheese Whiz was not an option. Authentic Philadelphia style roll. 

Steak fries were kind of tasteless. Had to put ketchup on them to give them any taste. 

Free refills on soft drinks. 

Appreciate the tribute on the walls with pictures of the great cheesesteak places such as Pat's, Gino'a and Jim's Steaks, all in South Philly. 

Like that they take all credit cards.

Next time I will go elsewhere. Glad I have cheesesteak options (alternatives) in San Francisco.
author: Steven G.

description:
Good solid cheesesteak at a solid price. 
The lite spinach/mushroom 10" was the right price with the right amount of meat/veggies. 
Too much is not necessarily good and too little is always a problem. 

I do have these guys at the top of my cheesteak spots in the City.
author: Chris L.

description: If I could give no stars I would. First I got a large steak wit 2oz of meat so they re made it. Then they made the wrong sandwich again. The the grill guy Ruben begins cursing at the staff and manager saying how much he don't give a fuck!!!  I own a restaurant. He should not be working there. Very, very unprofessional and I will NEVER go back, I will also tell everyone I know to stay clear of the place!! Very disappointed and a very disrespectful situation!!!!
author: Maurice J.

description: This place has gone downhill. Practically no meat in the sandwich and the meat was so tough that I had to spit most of it out. Such a shame. Used to be my favorite spot.
author: reza n.

description:
While Phat Philly in the Mission is the best cheesesteak in town - this is in my neighborhood and a "go-to" if I have a craving for cheesy/steaky goodness. Nope....there is not an ounce of healthiness here..but sometimes you just need one.

I believe Tuesday/Sunday are double stamp days and Wednesday is 1/2 price sides (Monday is double coupon day - and Right now the Safeway on Fillmore has $2.50 of of a 10" coupon on the back of their receipts - so that would be $5 off $8 sandwich - Now I haven't tried that coupon on a Monday so that may not work since it is such a steep discount, but if it does - that's a steal) 

I do love their steak fries ordered well done...I am not usually a fan of steak fries - but these are good. They recently introduced some new sides like home made potato chips and garlic fires - but I have not tried them.
author: Amy W.

description:
Really great sandwich. I got a 15" cheese and mushroom with added pepperoni. and a side of large curly fries.

The sandwich was truly monstrous and I had no intention of eating it all in one sitting. People made comments about it as I walked down the street with it. I cut it in half. The sandwich was delicious, good bread, quality meat, decent portion, and the fries are also really good.

I will return!
author: Jordan C.

description:
PROS: Food was excellent and served quickly...CONS: the ambiance is definitely lacking!

Overall: Will continue to dine at this establishment because I had an overall pleasant experience. 

Thanks Cheese Steak Shop staff!
author: Staci S.

description:
after a night of partying.... this is exactly what my body needed! Soo good...! I want one now...

Onion rings SLAMMING!
author: Corey G.

description:
I laughed to myself, a little, when I saw 4 stars average for this particular shop.

Usually another co-worker volunteers to pick up the food for us from here. This time I got to experience it myself.

-The atmosphere is not the greatest (smells - not sure if it was coming from the bathroom but it certainly wasn't the cheese steaks / some employees fooling around while I am placing my order - it's great that they have fun but maybe a little too much. I mean, it is a business after all and focus should be on the customer)

-Line forms fairly quick, especially during the lunch hours so don't expect to be in and out (25min in my experience)

-During the rush it seemed like there wasn't much communication and a few staff members, 1 of whom I'd think was the manager, kept on with their conversation instead of lending a hand to help move the traffic.

-Going back to the last comment - the 2 staff that were chatting while the store was slammed finally stopped whatever they were discussing when they saw an attractive woman in line / kicked out the cashier that was sweating while taking orders over the counter and the phone so they could assist her... whatever, but as a bystander it just looks bad. (unprofessional/perverted/no team-morale) 

-Food rocks, no doubt about it and probably is the only thing that keeps people coming back.

2 stars is a fare rating - 1 for the food, 1 for the overworked staff

Improvements: 

1. clean up the place (I did notice the scorecard with the '90' on it - definitely isn't)
2. hire more competent staff / educate on customer perception
3. put in a better/more efficient process for those rush-hours (will lose a ton of money by not doing so)
4. possibly remodel the floor plan? (longshot - but it is fairly tight in there, between the cashier, the soda dispenser and the pick up window not any wiggle room especially during the rush hour so you just keep bumping into people.
author: Honest G.

description:
This is a great Philly Cheese Steak place and I am so thankful it is in my neighborhood.

First off I love everyone that works here...they are always so nice and friendly.
Second I love the people that eat here...I have met many very nice people whilst dining.

If you can, go on Wednesday because all sides are half off...the curly fries, onion rings and steak cut fries are really, really good. 

I usually get the 10" cheese steak with peppers (and of course fries and onion rings) and it is always delicious...a sure thing.

The Free soda refills are always a plus.

I am getting hungry writing this review so I gotta go now!

Ps don't forget to get a loyalty card for a free cheese steak sandwich.
author: Cat A.

description:
I come here often and I enjoy their cheese steaks a lot. Always delicious and fast!


I'm giving 3 stars because I don't understand why it's always so dirty inside. Not just the dining area but even the kitchen is really messy. It always seems to be busy so I don't see why their staff can't clean up a little to make it more appealing. Atleast wipe down the tables and remove trash.
author: Nicole V.

description: Love their sandwiches! Our favorite is the King of Philly. Our go to take out restaurant when we don't feel like making dinner :) love their sweet and spicy peppers. Don't have anything negative to say about this spot!
author: Precilla L.

description: Best cheesesteak I have ever had and I lived in Philadelphia for five years.
author: Gloria J.

description: Delicious hoagie! Dale was such a nice guy. Talking with him you could see where the Fonz got his coolness from. :) definitely come here again when in town.
author: Sarah A.

description:
I wondered if I was alone in thinking "things ain't what they used to be" here.  From the reviews, apparently not.  I am fine with the no frills service and decor -- I find the staff perfectly agreeable.  I got a sub that seemed light on the meat, cheese and sauce, although there were a ton of peppers.

This place isn't too pricy, but I still felt that they were skimping unnecessarily.
author: Steve S.

description:
I ordered their traditional Philly Cheese Steak, king size, with Jalapeño and extra jalapeño on the side. I love it spicy. Here's the problem, where's my cheese? Isn't this a Philly "CHEESE" steak? And where's my jalapeño? I wanted my sandwich SPICY! Seriously?! Well.. I ordered for pick up...so...Next time, oh wait, there won't be a next time. No flavor what so ever.

I used to come here back in the day...meaning over 7 years ago, and they used to be bomb! What happened guys? Get it together!
author: Rose L.

description: When I'm the only person in line, stand there for a minute and then get blown off so that someone else's order can be taken, you lose me as a customer.
author: Jim H.

description: Been going here for decades...to be succinct, the shit will have you twinkling your toes:)
author: Al T.

description:
Dear San Franciscans,

My coworkers have ranted and raved about this place to me and have been telling me to try it for the longest time since I am from Philly and they know I pretty much wont eat a cheese steak anywhere else BUT PHILLY... despite the fact that I have lived in SF for almost 7 years...

I was born and raised in Philly....(insert  Fresh Prince of Bel Air theme song here)... I know what an awesome cheese steak is supposed to taste like.. Call me a cheese steak snob, I've been THIS resistant, for this VERY reason.

But that day... I was willing to give it a chance. I mean how baaaad could it get? Boy was I wrong...

But my boss had owed me lunch and was craving a cheesesteak and asked if I wanted to try it. I had this look on my face while he tried to call the place to place an onder.. I was standing next to him and he said they told him to hold on... and he gave up after being on hold for almost 5 minutes. Hung up and asked me to call.... and the samething happened. After that, I should've taken that sign and gotten the heck out of dodge... 

So I googled them and found out that they take online orders, so I went ahead and made an order online. 4 sandwiches in total, and told them I wanted BBQ sauce on the side since we had ordered a bunch of curly fries... I printed out the order and gave it to my coworker who was going to pick up the orders.... Now imagine if I didnt print out the order for my coworker... when he had gotten there, they claimed that we had only ordered 3 sandwiches... if the total was $40ish at about $10 each, how is it that I ONLY ordered THREE and NOT FOUR? 

Okay fine. People make mistakes.... they made the 4th one. Problem fixed.

My coworker came back and told me that my sandwich, that I had asked for BBQ sauce on the side, MAY have the BBQ on the INSIDE of my sandwich since there isnt a side of BBQ sauce in the bag... I opened my sandwich, and there it was.. BBQ INSIDE my cheesesteak UGHHH.

Ok now.. when you have a area on your online ordering system that says "special requests" and you dont fulfill such requests, what is exactly the point of having it on there? 

I open up my sandwich... and there is no cheese at all. Yep. They gave me a cheese steak, with NO cheese. When I ate it, it was like biting into shreds of cardboard and with half the amount of meat that I would normally get if I were to have gotten one from my hometown. 

Please San Francisco and do yourselves the favor and don't think this is what a real cheese-steak is supposed to taste like. 

Just run... far far away from here fellow San Franciscans. The cheesesteaks here are NOT worth it.

Love,
A Disappointed Philadelphian
author: Julie T.

description: The cheesesteaks here are absolutely fantastic. I've had some good ones in San Francisco, and I put this place no lower than top 2, with a legitimate claim for the #1 spot. I'm not from Philly so I won't claim to be an expert, but I know a delicious sandwich, and theirs certainly fit that mold and then some.
author: Matt V.

description: Food was alright But be prepared to wait... and wait.... for your food. I waited about 30 mins and there wasn't even a long line of people. Definitely not a quick order place!
author: Brad A.

description: Caution: may bE habit forming.  This is so true.  Caution: this review may gross you out.  Also possibly true unless you are in healthcare.  My medical school used to be in the neighborhood of this joint.  And the combination of burning so many bRain calories with endless studying and the formaldehyde from anatomy lab (induces hunger) the only thing we were thinking of when trying to escape rainy days and cadavers in the lab was this place.  The absolute best cheesesteak in the us, let alone philly.  It's in a rundown area, well, maybe that's changed......and it's a hole in the wall, could have also changed.  But no matter where it is or what it looks like, the ingredients are fresh and delicious, the secret recipe is top notch and the service is with a smile. There is not a year that goes by without me craving this place and now I'm a vegetarian but I tell you, if I visited San Fran, I'd have to fall off the wagon for a bite back in time.
author: Laurel L.

description:
Yeezus! That should really explain this spot!

Great hangover food! I would love to be a teenager again and hit this place up everyday, however my old age deters me from being able to enjoy such artery clogging goodness that often.

If you love philly cheese, then you love it fully loaded and want it to really fill you up... this place hits the spot!
author: Nolan M.

description:
by no means "authentic" if you've ever lived within a 2-hour drive of Geno's in Philly (I was immediately skeptical when they didn't have "whiz") so I order the regular 10" with American cheese, and all peppers and onions (aka "with").

It was pretty good.

I will return for more.

although i miss the whiz.
author: Mike V.

description: I've been coming here since 2000 this is my shit, I always do bbq and make it a combo with house made potatoes chips
author: Paul S.

description:
Pretty good. Not the traditional cheesesteak, but rather a California variant. The flavorful peppers are a nice choice.

Crew wasn't so good at fulfilling four orders at the same time, so be prepared to decode the output, or be prepared to order significantly different choices so you can tell them apart. Make sure your fellow dining companions are clean so when you have to get your fries off their plate as part of the mix up, you aren't eating their dirt.
author: Chris B.

description: As a preface; being from Philly, I've never been mildly impressed with another town's cheesesteaks. While these aren't quite as good as the real deal, it did make me feel at home and they're super tasty! I really love the classic memorabilia/photos, since they even had a pictures of my favorite place back home: Jim's Steaks. I will say it definitely lives up to their "habit forming" mantra, because I've been here twice since moving down the street this past Sunday. A little piece of home right down the block! 5/5 - since aforementioned Jim's is a 10/5. Great place!
author: Stefen H.

description:
This place is the reason why I gained 15 pounds freshman year of college. I seriously remember coming here at least twice a week way back when. Now that I'm older and can't afford to have all that greasy goodness I come back to visit the guys every few months. This place is THE BEST!! Their phillies are straight out "In West Philadelphia born & raised, on the playground where I spent most of my days, chilling out, maxing out, relaxing all cool....." 

10" philly with sweet & hot peppers, steak fries and a coke is all you need for a little piece of heaven. Come on a Tuesday, its double stamp!!!
author: Caye Q.

description:
As a native San Franciscan (as in "born 'n raised"), I'm proud to say that I've been raised on the menu of The Cheese Steak Shop.

I will NOT say the place is classy. In fact, it's a hole-in-the-wall. That is it's appeal: it's nothin' fancy, but it hits the spot. To be honest, the fries are its weakest point - they just aren't my thing. But the sandwiches pack enough taste (and meat) into a single half that you'll be jonesing for the other half the next meal. Of course I'm the kinda guy to eat a whole in a single sitting, so I'd have to buy two in order to have one for later.

Comparisons to "genuine" eateries in Philadelphia are fine and good for those who have been there, but this is San Francisco-style cheesesteak. It might not be your preference, but this is the taste of The City.

I just wish they'd improve the fries.
author: Charles L.

description:
My opinion of this place hasn't changed much other than the staff going above and beyond my expectations. 

They definitely hooked it up with the stamps I forgot on previous visits. Very nice guy. Now I'm only a few stamps away from a free sandwich.

The decor could be updated.
author: Justin C.

description:
Oh my goodness! The Cheese Steak Shop was definitely what I needed. We came here for a quick bite to eat on the recommendation of my friend, who is in love with this place.

Grilled onions and sweet peppers are a MUST. They definitely make the cheese steak that much better. Yum! Even thinking about it right now is making me drool. 

I am the type of person who almost always ends up taking home my leftovers, so I was kind of wary of getting a 10" or 12" cheesesteak. My friend told me not to be intimidated by the larger sizes, since when you actually eat it, it doesn't seem like the sizes are that large. I still got the 7", but really started regretting not getting a larger size by the time I was done. Don't be intimidated! Just get the larger size! Plus, you have to spend at least $7 to get a stamp on your card, so you might as well get the 10" and get a stamp.

tl;dr: I love hole-in-the-wall places, and this place was so so so good! If I'm ever craving cheesesteaks, I know where to go!
author: Lillian Z.

description:
The place feels grimy and parking is scarce.

But if you are looking for a quick cheesesteak sandwich, this is the place. Nothing fancy, just your average cheesesteak. 

You even get 5% off your order if you call in your order before 11:30am on weekdays.
author: Ray C.

description: Went over to San Francisco for a small vacation and my cousin recommended me this place. I went to over 10 restaurants during my stay and this had to be my favorite. The Philly cheese steak sandwich there has to be the best one I have ever had so far.
author: Carlos M.

description:
I'm not a fan of food chains but The Cheese Steak Shop is always an exception.

The lady who took our order was extra nice.
cheese steaks are always good, onion rings and curly fries good!
author: Learnee L.

description: The cheesesteaks and twirly fries were so good! Employees were very welcoming and let me know that the soda refills were free. Would definitely come again!
author: Nikki C.

description:
Ohhh, Cheese Steak Shop, how I miss you!  How do you count the ways?!  From their soft squishy sandwiches to the slightly chilled Tastykakes, I love thee!  But my heart and arteries are glad you're 3,000 miles away now.  As an ex-SF resident, I stumbled on the Cheese Steak shop years ago and it became a semi-regular part of my lunch runs.  I stopped in again yesterday and nothing has changed in this illicit love affair.  

This place is about as real as it gets: clanking spatulas chopping up the steak, soft Amoroso rolls imported from the east coast and American or Provolone (where's the cheese wiz?) melted on top.  The place can get uber busy at lunch but the line moves quick.  I knocked down a 10" King Philly with extra meat, delicious!  And some butterscotch Tastykakes finished off the meal.  As a bonus, the Cheese Steak shop was giving out free sodas for the Phillies win in the World Series, go Phils!  They've got a bunch of other steak options with grilled onions, peppers (hot-sweet), mushrooms, garlic and marinara sauce, all are ridiculously good and fattening...

Outside of a cross-country trip to the City of Brotherly Love, the Cheese Steak Shop is as good as it gets in SF.  With locations popping up throughout the city and East Bay, you should be able to find one nearby.  So enjoy their yummy cheesesteaks sometime soon, just give yourself some time between visits to clear your arteries out!
author: Ron W.

description: I don't know whether to give 5 stars or 1 star. 5 stars for how amazing their cheesesteaks are or 1 star for how fat I'm going to become now that I've discovered this place. Slightly over priced, but I'll be back.
author: Brian S.

description: The King of Philly sandwich may have been one of the best things to ever happen to me. No other Philly cheesesteak place has come close to comparison yet. It may look like a hole in the wall, chain restaurant, but this place packs an unexpected punch. I crave this place often, but my arteries cry "no" don't do it! Yeah it's a greasy-ass sandwich, but it's sooooooo worth it. You should go for it... Just don't say I didn't warn ya.
author: Joanne Y.

description: Best Philly Cheese Steak ever! Nothing compares to this place. It's just absolutely delicious! I will forever be in love with this place.
author: Travion J.

description: Went here for a quick dinner last night. Got the 10" philly cheesesteak. Not a bad price for the quality and size, but a pretty average cheesesteak overall. Bread could have been better as well as more cheese. Not a bad place for a quick cheap meal though.
author: Josue V.

description: The best phelly steacks ever.  The way they make them its just unbelievable.  Great service and a wonderful people
author: Vlad V.

description:
YES, finally a flavorful Philly Cheese[chicken]steak!

Everytime I order a philly cheesesteak from other places, it tends to lack flavor. I hated that. This time, maybe it's because I ordered the chicken but I did and I loved it. I had them add spicy peppers and it was fantastic. My mouth was burning but my stomach was being gratified. Plus, the staff was super nice and shyly informed us they were short-staffed but maintained a diligent speed while working.

Now for some weird stupid reason, the delicious spiciness of the my sandwich did burn my stomach for the next few days, just a warning. So bad yet so GOOD. I'm not complaining.
author: Mary C.

description: Came here for lunch with my sister and ordered the regular Philly Cheesesteak with peppers on top and steak fries. The fries were nothing special, so I will definitely order a different tyep of fries next time, but the meat in the Philly Cheesesteak is... simply..AMAZING!!!!!  It tastes soooooo good cooked with the cheese! The peppers were a bit too spicy for me so I ended up taking them off, but I recommend coming here to eat. The 15 minutes wait for your food after you placed the order was so worth it! Will definitely be back seeing that I live so closeby :P
author: Amanda C.

description: So-so cheese steak and the African American woman who was serving the orders deserves to be fired. Arguing with the customers like she was doing everyone a favor.  The food wasn't even nearly enough good to be going back.  Do not recommend.
author: s n.

description:
I invite all 4 and 5 star reviews here to go to other cheese steak shops and see if your opinion changes.

Every part of my experience at lunch was subpar. Didn't enjoy my sandwich and the restaurant was kinda gross. I should have went to Mcdonalds for lunch.

I have not been to Philly, but I've been to Phillies SF on Geneva and that cheesesteak is my favorite by far.  I wanted to have different spots across the city, but this won't be one of them.

No wiz option? C'mon Man!

I liked the roll, but as a whole, the sandwich didn't come together, the peppers, meat, cheese, roll it felt like separate elements when I took a bite, It didn't soak into the bread and get really juicy from the steak and cheese. Partially because there wasw no wiz... 

The sweet and hot peppers were huge and wouldn't stay on the sandwich, could have been cut in half.

The steak flavor was very forgettable. 

the restaurant itself is gross. I mean, I'm not asking for a makeover, the look fits the shop. But there was so much dust on all the pictures and posters. I didn't know if I should eat there. It was borderline Restaurant Impossible status on the cleanliness. Robert Irvine would go nuts. 

Also, there usually is a wait on these things, there were 5 people in front of me, that's fine. But there were 2 workers who were just standing on the side, not sure if they were on break, but it didn't look good to have 4 people there, with a pace of only 2 people working.
author: Glenn M.

description:
Over all great sandwiches! 

Pros:
Sandwiches are bomb
Fast, sort of friendly service 
You can call ahead
Loyalty card - get the 11th free 

Cons:
Steak fries - under-cooked
I personally don't dine in because it feels grimy
author: Marina S.

description: Solid cheese steaks, especially in San Francisco.  Prices are decent and location is convenient.  Good place to come after drinking at the nearby sports bars.
author: Beeza B.

description:
Good if you just have a craving for cheesesteak but not a Ginos or Pats (Philly steak shops). Very little meat and kinda small.  It isn't bad but I'm still looking for my perfect cheesesteak shop.

On the plus side, I ordered online and they made the steaks fast. Reasonable pricing.
author: Amy L.

description: bomb - ass flavor,  shitty ass portions,  especially compared to back in the 80s and 90s. if there was a reasonable ingredient-to-bread ratio it would get 4 stars, only losing one due to the exorbitant price.
author: Grizzle J.

description: Woa..Momma. Best Cheesesteak that I have had in a long time. I love spicy so I had the cheesesteak with hot peppers and grilled onions. Must have the Phresh Hot potato chips with seasoning!!! Loved. Wacky Wednesday special is buy 3 and get one 7 inch free.
author: Michellea D.

description:
Best in the neighborhood, although its the only one in the neighborhood.  Good cheese steaks.  It's a nice change of pace from the artery cleaning organic food that you can get almost anywhere else in the city.

Decor: 3
Food:4
Service: 4  

Would I go back? You bet your pastrami I would!  It's a nice change of pace.
author: Kelson H.

description:
I'm not from Philly, and have no point of reference, so compared to the cheesesteaks I've consumed in California, I think this is place is pretty damn good. I must admit that I feel guilty every time I eat here because I can almost feel my arteries hardening with every bite of this greasy goodness.

You can order your cheesesteak with beef or chicken, and with or without onions, garlic, mushrooms, spinach, pepperoni, bacon, bbq sauce, and hot or sweet peppers.  Veggie sandwiches, hoagies and salads also available for you more health minded folk -- but honestly, I wonder if they ever sell any of these other options?. I highly recommend sealing the deal to your coronary bypass by ordering the fresh potato chips on the side -- they're hot, crisp, and good!
author: Rachel V.

description:
I can't believe that I forgot about this place for YEARS! I used to come here often and then maybe it was because I moved away to college that I forgot about this place. Anyhow, I'm so glad that I found this place again because I love those Philly cheesesteak sandwiches! That melty cheese... Those onions... The juices... Ahhhh. The works! 

It's a good sandwich and the caution is right... "This may be habit forming." If I worked close to this place, I'd probably come more often! 

I got the 15 inch sandwich to share with my dad for about $11. It was more than enough. I was full off of my 7.5 inches of deliciousness! It's a good deal!
author: Connie Y.

description:
If you want amazing huge cheese steaks and a full stomach then this place is fore you.

Its so bomb i could eat there every single day.
author: Alex S.

description: Great meat, cheese, and steak! Probably the best cheesesteak I've had outside Philly. I like garlic, but WOW, was the garlic cheesesteak garlicky! Would not recommend ordering a steak with garlic unless you REALLY like garlic. The spiral fries were good too. There were also ample tables inside to eat your food.
author: Marc B.

description:
A great, no-frills, just deliverin' the good stuff kind of place!

Their cheesesteaks are really good, but don't forget their cheeseburgers; the old-fashioned, sloppy kind before burgers went all up-scale.

But the big draw for me are the sides, which are HALF OFF on Wednesdays!  Load up on corn fritters and zucchini sticks, steak fries and onion rings, etc.
author: Brandon L.

description:
Good cheesesteaks with tons of peppers. They like to chop the meat thin though which bugs me. Sometimes the cheesesteaks get a little dry and could use more gooey cheese. 

Do yourself a favor and "King of Philly" that bish. The amount of meat and peppers is ridic!
Or, bacon. Or, mushrooms. There's options!

This location smells a little funky (like a bag of bums) inside but good food and moderately priced for the amount of food.
author: Tay R.

description: Love the food here! Cheese steaks are amazing. The sides are pretty good also! There's plenty of seating options/space. Service is friendly. Not sure what else to say --I would definitely recommend!
author: Tania C.

description:
Having only spent a limited time in Philadelphia, I can only venture a guess as to what a native would think about this place. I suspect they would probably hold it in the same esteem that they hold that statue of Rocky at the steps of the art museum.
