Not to be tangential but I do want to point out that there is no statue of the boxer, Joe Frazier, who actually lived in Philadelphia (and actually existed).

Anyways, this place will hit the spot if you're looking for simple, greasy, gooey, cheesy goodness but I really get the sense that they are cutting corners whenever possible. Their bread is a bit stale and the meat a bit bland and the "King of Philly" is their super-sized version, which is the only sandwich that comes close to actual Philly cheese steak proportions.
author: Baron C.

description: This review is on a worker, not the food. My boyfriend and I came 20 minutes before closing (our bad). Anyways the woman cooking our food ( older, African American, with burgundy hair) seemed very unhappy. We could hear her mumbling, basically talking shit. I understand you're upset but be professional. She kept staring me while I watched her cook our food. After us more ppl came and you could hear her say "shit". Other than that the food is great!
author: Daveena M.

description: The 15" Philly chicken cheese changed my life forever. It was hot, spicey, and peppered to perfection. I slid it down my gullet without any regrets. Stay away from the side dishes, and eat this instead!
author: Jay C.

description:
Holy crap so glad I'm in town to eat one of these suckers right herrrrr. I was disgusted by Phillys until I stumbled upon this shop while in college. Their cheesesteaks leave this amazing scent on your fingers you only get when you are...feeling lucky...

Cheese-gasm
author: Steve M.

description:
The bread roll is heated/toasted, very cheesy, the meat is alright, not dry but not too juicy either, and each bite is spiced up with jalapeno.  Love the curly fries.

Customers range from jean/tees to business suits.  Quick and tasty for a lunch break.
They also have a loyalty card for repeat customers.
author: Ju D.

description:
Hands down the best cheesesteaks in the bay area. They use the correct bread and actually chop up the onions and meat nice and small so it literally melts in your mouth along with the piping hot cheese. Chopped peppers on top and not the green bell peppers but the real hot and sweet peppers like it should be. If you are darling try the roasted garlic cheesesteak for an amazing result. 

WARNING! This place is addictive and you will be back for more gut busting good eats!
author: Adam V.

description: The food is ok but nothing special, would much rather have jakes if I am in SF and Stevens Cheeseteak in Sunnyvale is a thousand times better. -4 stars for cleanliness. It was a dump today. The floor, the bathroom, the tables are all filthy. It's really that bad. Could not find one table that was clean to sit down at and there are tons of tables. Clearly they had no bus boy today and no one was willing to clean tables, clean the bathroom or replenish ketchup and straws and forks etc...so apparently it just wasn't going to be done today? Weird and Gross. Very disappointing.
author: Kevin K.

description:
YES YES YES.
 as a SF native, best cheesesteaks in the bay area.
 and i just went to philly last winter and i was not really impressed. i was thinking of the cheesesteak shop the whole time.
author: Bob Y.

description:
I crave these cheese steak sandwiches. So unbelievably delicious. 

Best hangover meal ever.  

You think you want the the 7",  you think if you order it with fries it will be plenty... You're wrong. Always go for the 10" + fries. Always. But be wary, upgrade to the 15" and you will regret it-- it's gunna hurt. Unless...you have superhuman willpower and can save the second half for later. But who are you kidding, you are gunna shovel that whole thing in. It's a trap.
author: Daniel K.

description:
I was first introduced to this place by a friend and kept returning ever since! I didn't even know this place existed as it is tucked away on Divisadero St. and unless you caught the bright yellow banner outside, you wouldn't even know this place was this good! 

Where to begin? The slogan that is posted around the shop is; "Caution: May be habit forming." and it certainly does speak for itself! After my first philly, I returned numerous times, bringing many friends as well as my girlfriend, who absolutely loves it when I bring her here. This place definitely set my standard for a cheese steak sandwich. 

I usually order the King of Philly 10" for myself with onion rings (yes, real onion rings, none of that frozen/fake onions from Burger King..), and a 7" Original Philly for my girlfriend. While it is a bit pricey (King of Philly ~$9, 7" Original ~$5), it's definitely worth it. 

We've tried Cheese steak sandwiches at other shops/restaurants and we agree, nothing beats The Cheese Steak Shop. NOTHING. 

"Duh, Winning!"
author: Jacky P.

description:
Lower pac heights? Is that what neighborhood this is considered? Anyway.

3.5 stars but Yelp only rocks the whole star, so I went Yelp 4 Camacho 3.5


I'm a big fan of these sandwiches. I mean, it's almost impossible to find a really good cheese steak out here on the Leftcoast. I've never been to Gino's or Pat's so I can't compare them to this place. 

I love the sandwich. Juicy, tender meat and oozing cheese is right up my alley. I love the peppers but I'd like mine chopped up a bit smaller b/c when I bite down, entire slices of peppers end up on my shirt/pants/floor. I guess I don't have the Guy Fieri lean down pat. What I don't like, the fries! It's almost like they said "You know, we have a damn good sandwich, let's stop right here and celebrate. Oh, and go get some frozen fries from Safeway."

I can live with decent fries, but these are brutal! Those curly fries are so nasty! Maybe change the freakin' oil once in a while or something.
author: Hector G.

description:
Alright.. I have been here a few times while at Mt Zion.. its a good place to get some cheese steak and fries... price is good.  Staff is friendly. parking sucks.

Great food for sure!!!
author: Roger A.

description: The Cheese Steak Shop is good for what it is, and it has been that way for a while.  It's not amazing, but the product you will receive is a solid cheesesteak, prepared in a great number of styles.  My go-to is a chicken cheese steak, with garlic, onions, and cheese.  A 10-inch steak does the job for me, and at less than $8, that a good value in my book.  That said, my recent visit was my first in probably 3-4 years.  And it will probably be 3-4 years before I return- but it's not because the Cheese Steak Shop has done anything wrong. This is a solid option on this stretch of Divisadero...
author: Andy S.

description:
I unexpectedly gave this place another shot (I wanted to go someplace else, but it was closed and I was parked right in front of the Cheese Steak Shop), and once again I was less than impressed.  In fact, I thought this place was rather meh, but I'll leave them at three stars.  

I got "twister" (curly) fries and chicken tenders.  The fries were fine.  It's the chicken tenders I had the issue with.  They really weren't "tenders" and were more like "nuggets."  They were also a little too crispy (burnt) for my taste and there was too much breading and not enough chicken.  I actually kind of wondered if the the employees here knew the tenders weren't up to par because I only ordered a five piece, but was given seven or eight.  Either way, I just wished they tasted better.
author: George A.

description:
I've never been to Philly so I can't truly judge the authenticity of this cheesesteak but I can review it on sandwich comparison level.  They serve about a dozen different varieties, each with different toppings on a traditional steak, peppers, onions and cheese on a soft Italian role.  You can order three different sizes so if you're hungry, go for 10 or 15 incher.  The 7 inch is more of a snack.  
They serve the melted provolone style not the cheezewhiz style of cheesesteak.
They also offer a few fried sides and a couple desserts.  Onion rings, fries, corn nuggets, etc.  I find these to have an over-greasy flavor so I skip'em.  They keep the Tasty-Cakes in the fridge so they're kind of hard when you get them.  
The dining area is small and get full at lunch time.
Parking on the street can be tough around here.
author: Pablo R.

description:
I've never had the real Philly cheese steak since I've never been to Philly, but I believe this comes pretty close to the real thing. 

Had their cheese steak here several times and every time, it's been a pleasant surprise. This thing is greasy, cheesy and busy with flavors that it might give you a heart attack. But no worries, the UCSF Hospital is just across the street should one occur. 

And if you want something greasy and good, try some of their deep fried side orders of mushrooms. These things are like veggies on crack, and very addicting. 

Funny story about them was my wife thought she was getting a great deal when she bought them one Wednesday afternoon. We were waiting for my son to finish his MRI and we got hungry from waiting. When she returned, she said the cashier forgot to charge them. So as I mentioned earlier, these things are addicting so we moseyed on over after the MRI only to find out that that have a special price of half off every Wednesdays on their sides. 

Surprise...Surprise!!! Quite a pleasant surprise!
author: John G.

description: Yum! Just ate dinner here - had a 7 inch classic philly with onions and peppers and hot potato chips (excellent and not as heavy as fries), went down with a nice Dr. Pepper. Good sandwich and perfect if you're hungry.
author: Audra E.

description: This place was here when I was a kid and not much has changed. The cheesesteaks are still delicious with the extra spicy peppers, but I agree the decor needs a good scrubbing and paint job. But for something quick it's a good stop.
author: Matt A.

description:
HOLLLLLLLLY shit. So a good friend of mine used to ravvve and ravvvve and ravve about this place and I had my doubts. We finished up a video shoot and drove to this place where I thought my doubts where going to be realized. Seriously, when I saw this place I was like WTF, this looks ghetto as hell. Alas, I waiting to judge until after the meal. Boy... I was sure glad I did. This was easily the best Philly Cheesesteak I've ever had. Even my friends family who is FROM PHILLY thinks its better than Ginos/Pats etc. 

Bottom line  = They aren't lying when they say "Caution; may be habit forming"
author: Jason G.

description: Very tasty sandwich, steak was tender and served on a soft roll.  I had mine with chilli and cheese and my daughter had hers pizza style.  Both were very good.  I would have given 5 stars except for mine didn't have as much meat as I expected.  a sandwich should never have empty bread.  I might not have cared as much except for my daughters while the same size had noticeably more steak.  Still it was was very good for the price and when in the area I would considered coming again.
author: Karen G.

description:
After a long grueling day at the hospital, nothing cheers a girl up like 7" of perfectly sliced meat. Pile on melted  American cheese, mushrooms, and sauteed peppers and you've got yourself a tasty treat. The food is definitely authentic and the time it takes to get one (about 10 minutes) is just concrete proof that you can't rush perfection.

The lines here are horrendous but keep in mind that the people in front of you might be ordering for a large group from any of the neighborhood hospitals or office buildings and the cashiers are very thorough here when reading back your order and making sure you're getting what you want. Bring a book or play with your iPod if you have a short attention span. This place is almost like the infamous Soup Nazi when it comes to order taking-get it right or get out of line and quit wasting everyone else's time.

I always get my favorite: 7" Philly with Mushrooms with extra meat and a little extra cheese and hot peppers. It's a toss up between fried mushrooms and curly fries for my side but both are equally tasty and a great accompaniment to my sandwich. This could put a smile on the face of anyone stuck at the hospital for sure. 

The lines are long, but the place isn't very crowded, and the tables are always kept clean by a rotation of staff members so sitting down is not a problem. Be sure to try a TastyKake if you have the room in  your stomach for it 'cause this place is the only I've seen in San Francisco that carries them so far.
author: Jessica K.

description:
The Cheesesteak, the grand daddy of all steak based sandwiches. The Cheesesteak Shop takes it another level. 

During my lunch breaks from school, I would travel on foot to arrive at this location whenever I crave that Cheesesteak feeling. Freshman year of college, I experienced my first 7" Sandwich from here and it was AMAZING. Next thing you know, you and a bunch of homies are chilling here eating away at 15" sandwiches! 

Your taste buds are just overwhelmed with the freshly made steak, the peppers giving it that nice added spice, plus the soft bread with cheese melted to make it one savory delicious meal. Oh, and do not forget the steak fries! They are the BOMB! 

The great thing is, this place is not expensive. A 7" goes for around $5, the 10" for around $6.50 and the ever so huge 15" for a good $10. The steak fries are delicious and there are a variety of Cheesesteak choices other than the original to try from.

Highly recommend this spot if your craving that feeling for some steak sandwiches, you won't be disappointed. If your a college student, YOU NEED TO GO HERE ONCE IN YOUR LIFETIME. It's right next to UCSF on divisadero so it's in a fantastic area, easily accessible. Now don't hesitate and just go and order an original Philly Cheesesteak. The only disappointment you'll realize is that when you finish your sandwich, you'll be craving even more!

Check it out for yourself and you be the judge.
author: Jesus A.

description: I really wanted to like The Cheesesteak Shop more since it came so highly recommended by my friends and coworkers, but for me it was just meh.  I actually like Buster's on Columbus Avenue better because it seems like their meat is better seasoned and the portion is larger.  In general I'd say that the staff at The Cheesesteak Shop are friendlier than the folks at Buster's though.  So, I'll give them that...
author: Danielle O.

description:
Great place to get a cheese steak made with rolls that actually are from Philly.  It's a great value too.  The 7" is a bit small, but if paired with an order of fries, it's makes for a good lunch.  The interior has character -- you see photos of famous cheese steak places from Philly, and restaurant reviews from Patricia Unterman and Bill Mandel that date from when the shop opened many years ago. (Note: Mandel is from Pennsylvania, so his review probably carries weight).  They don't use Cheez Whiz, which may disappoint purists, but that's OK with me.   The menu is quite large with hamburgers, many sides, but I would say most people order the cheese steak.

Update: I tried their curly fries, but prefer their regular steak fries.  Both are good.

They have specials, a "frequency card", and deals depending on the day you go, so check those out.

Interior for updated a bit, with seats from old Candlestick park and a SF Giants tribute wall with photos.  The menu is pretty much the same.

When it's crowded, it can take 10 min to get an order in, and another 15 to get served.  The sandwich is worth it, but if you're in a hurry, set aside extra time.
author: Dan C.

description:
Food is pretty good here, but service was horrible when we visited yesterday. The boyfriend randomly thought about this place and craved it, so we went for a late Sunday lunch.

On our first trip to the register, we ordered a Philly Cheese Steak, Hoagie Cheese Steak, Zesty Veggie Sandwich, Steak Fries, and Onion Rings. When we received our order, we got an Italian Hoagie, Zesty Veggie, Fries, and Rings. So the first thing my bf noticed was that they made the wrong Hoagie - he wanted a Hoagie Cheese Steak, but got the Italian Hoagie instead. Then as we waited longer, there was no Philly Cheese Steak - went to the pickup counter, and they never placed the order.

BF gets back in line for the second time - orders Philly Cheese Steak and Hoagie Cheese Steak cause he still wants to get what he planned to order in the first place. This time, he gets the order and gets the Philly Cheese Steak only. He checks the receipt again, the cashier never placed the order for the Hoagie. Granted, we should have checked the receipt before, but we gave the cashier the benefit of the doubt.

Now, mistakes are okay - we all make them, but the cashier was rude about it. She started lecturing him on how he should have made it clear he wanted two separate sandwiches, cause all she kept hearing was cheese steak and assumed one. 

Already the first time around, when they didnt get the order, I feel like the guys cooking or the cashier should have done something to speed up the process for us to get back in line. My bf had to get back in line, which was long, to re order. We pretty much spent the most of our time there waiting for the food to be right.

On top of it all, our onion rings were completely burnt and all the rings were stuck together and hard, couldn't even take them apart to eat them - why would you serve it out to your customers like that!

Okay, so the food is pretty good, but after this experience, we're pretty scarred. Usually I'm not one to complain on Yelp, but we spent our entire time here pretty pissed. We noticed that the cashier took a few other customers' orders incorrectly too... Get it together woman! And don't be rude to your customers, PERIOD. 

Since I don't review solely on one thing, I'll give them 3 stars. Food is good, but the staff working at the time of our visit just didn't give a sh*t.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
This place is legit. Good prices, good food, good people. What else could I ask for? I usually get the mushroom cheesesteak with curly fries. Haven't tried some of the other "non-standard" versions they do (why mess with the original?). This place is hella good for taking care of hangovers on Sunday when El Burrito Express down the street is closed.

My only grief is that sometimes the to-go orders aren't packaged very well and everything is a giant hot-mess by the time you make it back home. As much as I enjoy using forks and knives for dishes not meant for them (pizza), I prefer to eat a cheesesteak with the method it was intended to be eaten -- my hands. My suggestion to help fix this would be for them to use a to-go box/container vs just wrapping the sandwich in foil.
author: Farhad M.

description: Looking for a nice healthy sandwich? Don't come here. Want a greasy delicious gut bomb that will leave you sleepy and content? This is the place. The bread is shipped in from philly. The portions are big. Tasty cakes are available. This is the place I come when I want to satisfy my cheesesteak craving.
author: Noah T.

description: What happened? Portions have gotten really small. Do not order the large sandwich. I think they put the same amount of meat for the small one and stick it into the larger bread. I also don't remember it being this greasy. I have memories of biting into one of these sandwiches and feel the beef, cheese, onions, and peppers all gush out. Now, I just bite into oily bread. I am so sad.
author: Carrie W.

description: There are a bunch of cheese steak places in SF and I'm a fan of most of them with some little issues but was surprised by how much I liked this place.  Nothing fancy for sure but the sandwich was good (could have used a bit more meat).  Pretty cheap eats too.
author: Blake B.

description: This is my second favorite cheesesteak in the City, after Jake's Steaks.  Really, it just depends on what I'm after.  Jake's is probably more authentic, from a purist standpoint; but The Cheese Steak Shop has more options.  I particularly like the addition of roasted garlic and pepperoni to my cheesesteak.  In addition, I like The Cheese Steak Shop's seasoned curly fries more than I like Jake's waffle fries.  The atmosphere is pretty "hole in the wall", but I generally don't go looking for cheesesteaks and ambiance at the same time.
author: Scott E.

description:
Melted cheese, grilled steak, hot peppers, whole roasted garlic cloves, on a buttery toasted hoagie roll...  Mmmmmmmm....  Stumbled on this while driving through SF.  Used the iPhone Yelp app to check what was nearby, and BAM!  Found this gem...

They come in 3 sizes: 7" ($4ish), 10" ($6ish), and a whopping 15" ($10ish).  Plenty of versions to try: Original, Pizza sauce and Provolone, Barbecue, Mushroom, Whole Roasted Garlic Cloves, Pepperoni to name a few.  We tried the original and garlic.  Both were delish.

Definitely a place to go for a Philly Cheese Steak.  I've been to Philly, but have not had the cheese steaks there (how could I do that you may be asking??? Too short of a business trip).  Well, if this is what a Philly Cheese Steak should taste like, I'm a fan...  It definitely beats the other franchised version: Great Steak Company - that's for sure!

They had steak fries, curly fries for sides.  We had the Fiesta Poppers (jalapeno poppers)...  Yummy.

This place was definitely a hole-in-the-wall, but those are the best places in my book.  Their motto is - "Caution: may be habit forming", and I am glad I do not live nearby; otherwise, there would not be enough trips to the gym that could help me.
author: Lawrence L.

description: This place is an institution in SF and there is a good reason, their PHILLY CHEESESTEAK is the best because they make it with a soft but crisp bun, minced meat, perfect amount of cheese, onions, and peppers.  Even better is calling ahead to have it ready when you walk in unless you are like me and just roll in and then drink a whole soda waiting for your sandwich, which is why I suggest ordering ahead.  Plus they do a rewards program if you do get addicted to this beefy-cheesy goodness.  Double stamps on Tuesday and Sunday and after 10 stamps you get a free Philly cheese steak.  Booya!
author: D B.

description: Love the Cheese Steak Shop! Great place for a quick bite. I always go for the King Philly (extra meat, extra cheese) can't go wrong! Only negative might be the parking situation, but it is SF after all, so no real surprise there.
author: George S.

description:
After years of searching for the best cheesesteak east coast and west I always tend to crave for The Cheesesteak Shop. 

The two locations I'm a frequent customer at is the shop on Divisadero in San Francisco and the shop in Pleasanton. Both are really good and provide excellent customer service. It seems as if The Cheesesteak Shop only hire the humble, friendly, and smiley bunch they could find. 

I prefer the original with provolone cheese. I don't really understand this cheese whiz business other shops do, but regardless I would recommend their original with a side of curly fries.

As a bonus for frequent customers they give cards that can get stamped to score a free 10" sandwich.

I give this place an overall rating of 5 stars in terms of food quality and service.
author: Krystle A.

description: For the best and most authentic Philly cheese steak in the San Francisco Bay Area.  Excellent taste but not so good for the waist.  Like their logo says, "may be habit forming" it's very true once you've had one!  Accepts credit cards and open seven days a week.
author: Jeremy K.

description:
I ordered the 7" BBQ cheesesteaks with provolone cheese and the bf ordered the king of philly which is a 10" sandwich with the classic meat and cheese.

 I ordered BBQ cheesesteak with grilled onions and hot and sweet peppers. Oh so good, the steak was nice and juicy with just enough cheese and the onions with the hot and sweet peppers gave it a little kick. 

The King was philly was pretty good, basically like the other sandwiches but with a lot more meat. And of course we ordered the curly fries. Portions of the fries aren't that big but if you go on certain days, they have special coupon days or on tues they have extra stamp day, and wed is double your size of ur side order! Definitely a place to check out if you are craving cheesesteaks.
author: Anita W.

description:
I honestly hate to write bad reviews, but what the heck. 

Was in the neighborhood for a doctors appointment and my hubby and I wanted a cheese-steak sandwich. Opps, maybe a ground chicken sandwich? The meat was so ground that I told my husband that I can easily make it at home. It was super minced. Weird. And it had more peppers than meat. It was not cheesy at all! I almost wanted to call it the philly pepper sandwich. We were not impressed at all. 

The curly fries werent all that either. What helps a bad curly fry is some good ranch. And unfortunately that wasnt good either. 

Should have went to the gyro place across the street! 

The place needs a good remodel also. And its NOT cheap. 

The people behind the counter seemed nice though.
author: Boops D.

description: This was the first time I ever tried a cheesesteak and I was not disappointed. I wouldn't mind just eating like 4 more of these. I only ordered a basic philly cheesesteak, but it was more than I would've expected!
author: Holly P.

description:
This place definitely deserves more than 5 stars!

Years ago, I remember trying the most amazing cheesesteak I'd ever tasted. For the longest time, I was desperately trying to remember what the place was called. All I remember was that it was in SF and everything was yellow..

Fast forward to 2011, I was telling my boyfriend how I had the most amazing cheesesteak and I couldn't remember what the place was called. All I said was 'yellow signs' and he said "Cheesesteak Shop?" Thank Heavens! I begged him to go and we went later in the week. Since it is in SF, give yourself extra time to find parking. Luckily, we found residential parking on a weekday. The place looks the same with the yellow signs and everything!

I always get the 7" with fries. I am literally salivating thinking about how amazing these cheesesteaks are! These cheesesteaks ooze with loads of cheese.. yeah they're oily, but whatever! Once you take your first bite, you'll fall in love just like I did many many years ago.

They're opening one up in Downtown San Mateo! :)
author: Joyce E.

description:
The best cheesesteak I've ever had. The cheese is melted evenly with the meat and once you take a bite, the flavor encapsulates your senses. The toppings to bread ratio was perfect.  I knew about this place for awhile, but never actually took the time to try it out. The sign outside, "Caution: May Be Habit Forming" is odd, but it's effective in grabbing your attention.

There is a good selection of sandwiches along with sides. They also have a discount card where you receive a free 10" sandwich once your card is fully stamped. You receive a stamp for each 7 dollar purchase.

Their prices are reasonable.

Final Thought: Caution: May add 10 lbs to the scale, but you'll be happy.
author: Jason N.

description:
Wow.  This place is da bomb.  Cheesesteaks with bread flown in from Philly each day.  Tasty cakes in the fridge.  Too bad I don't live closer.  Actually good thing I don't.  5 stars - even though the place is filthy!

I got double meet with white American cheese and some pizza sauce on the side.   Can you say yum?  Add in some fiesta poppers and I had one very healthy meal.

Can't wait to go back!
author: Todd M.

description: The best cheesesteak I have ever had. And I've been around philly and tried cheese steaks all over the states. I always get the cheese steak hoagie with everything. King size it for double meat and cheese for 2 bucks or so. Get the curly fries and a drink and you have a best "junk food" meal ever. Usually long lines but so worth it. Just soak up the grease in the air !
author: Bobby L.

description:
I ate here because I was pretty sure it was mentioned in a Roach Gigz song ("I'm on Divis in my PJs, eating a cheese steak"), but afterwards I realized he was probably referring to Jay's on Divis and Fell. Regardless, this is a pretty decent cheese steak for SF, even if it is a chain (albeit a really small chain), and you can't beat the price. They've got too many options, so I just went with a basic 7" Philly Cheese, which was like $5.

I'd choose Jay's over The Cheese Steak Shop if I was equidistant between the two, but if I was three blocks closer to The Cheese Steak Shop than Jay's and I needed to get some cheese steak in my arteries pronto, I'd come here again.
author: Mark A.

description: A normal.philly cheese steak sandwich place. I'd never had the real thing, but this I'd good greasy food I'd come for when I want something cheap. They ran out of fries when I last came here. The interior of the restaurant is pretty dirty, oily tabletops. They need a better ventilation system to keep the place cool. Maybe a window?
author: Christina L.

description:
This location offers cheap cheesesteaks, and sadly, you get what you pay for.

Comprising my Cheesesteak was a fluffy roll, containing tough meat (not a lot of it, I might add), cheese which had to be searched for and peppers, which added crunch, but not flavor. Spicing was minimal, and despite the addition of garlic to my sandwich, underwhelming. This may have been one of the most unsatisfying sandwiches I've eaten in my life.

What saves The Cheese Steak Shop from the one-star maelstrom of my discontent were the curly fries (outstanding in every way) and the fast service.
author: Casey U.

description:
East coaster checking in.  My credentials:  grew up outside of Philadelphia and worked in Philly for 11 years.

Bread:  Authentic.  Nice and firm on the outside, soft on the inside.

Meat:  A little dry, even with the melty cheese. The meat should have been juicier - a little grease won't kill ya.  But it sure makes the cheesesteak taste a little better!  Quantity of meat could have been a little more generous too.

Krimpets!  Oh how I love thee!  Always a good surprise to see these butterscotch delicacies out here.
author: Allie A.

description: Nom nom nom! This place is delicious. I had a cheese steak at another restaurant and it just made me crave this place. Amazing!
author: Megan V.

description:
4 stars and over 600 reviews I was expecting to get my socks knocked
off. I mean the bread was good but needed to be more toasted/grilled. The filling (provolone and meat) was tasty but the portion was underwhelming. Staff was nice. Bathroom was dirty. It seems they are just resting on their laurels.
author: Vito G.

description:
I can't believe that I never got around to reviewing this place.

The last time I was in SF, I was craving cheesesteaks and thanks to Yelpers found this place.  I can only handle so much of Philly's Best and Jersey Mike's in my neck of the woods.  They had the standard cheesesteak down and I'll definitely be sure to come back the next time I visit.

Can't comment much on things like parking as I stopped in before closing.
author: JP A.

description:
yay cheesesteakkkkk.

i've had this place bookmarked for awhile and finally got to try it.
the big yellow sign that says caution threw me off as I was looking for "the cheese steak shop"

we scored parking right outside on a saturday around 11.

ordered
the regular philly and the mushroom one. both with a side of curly fries and onion rings.

the mushroom one tasted better because it had slightly more flavor/cheese. 
i enjoyed it and was veryyy full.

craving satisfied! i will be back! and next time i'll stick with the smallest size!
author: Christine M.

description:
If you want the REAL cheese steak in SF, this is the place to come.
I've been to Philadelphia, tried all famous joints and still think this place comes pretty darn close to the real mccoy.

Been coming here since my college days at SFSU for 25+ years.
author: David H.

description: All time classic cheese steak that's beyond novelty... It's memorable. I love the cheesesteak with grilled onions and garlic cloves. I need to remind myself next time to get the 15 inches, it's just too damn good to go 10 inches. I get hot peppers on the side to put hair on my chest. The curly fries are perfect, actually perfect. Get them.
author: Miles G.

description:
My favorite cheese steaks in San Francisco.

I recommend getting the larger sandwiches (the 7" isn't very filling) and their burgers are pretty good too (they taste a lot like the philly cheese steaks).  

It's not the quickest place in the city but it sure is tasty.
author: Murphy O.

description:
mhmmm Spinach & Mushroom cheese steak with the sweet peppers and a lil bit of the  spicy peppers is my favorite! 

I usually start on the ends because at the ends that is usually where there is less meat and work my way towards the middle, which has the most meat/cheese! :0

The 10" is good for one person but the 15" is good for two people to share!
author: Janet Z.

description:
I've been a regular here for well over a year. Their cheesesteaks are kinda good but not great, but it's a couple of blocks away so it was my go-to place if I was too lazy to make food. They also have this Philly Guylic sandwich that I really like, and if you order it you get 1/2 off any side and a fountain drink. I've been getting that a lot lately.

I went in awhile ago and got my usual, that combo special I just mentioned. Instead of being $10 and some change like usual, it was $13 and some change. I mention that to the cashier and he told me "oh you only get 1/2 off on Wednesdays". The sign for that special mentioned nothing about that, it mentions that any side is 1/2 off ALSO on Wednesdays. So I'm like "what the hell" and change my order to just a 10" plain garlic cheesesteak so I'm not paying almost $14 for lunch.

When I get my order, I ask to talk to the manager so I can ask about why I was going to get charged so much for that thing I've ordered multiple times already. Now here's the part where I got pissed. The manager WOULD NOT listen to what I was telling him, he just kept pointing to my receipt and reiterating that I ordered a regular garlic cheesesteak and not the special. After 3-4 repeated attempts to say "I know, BUT, I changed my order because it was going to be over $13 and it's usually a bit over $10, and that's what I'm asking about" and him pointing to what I ordered (I already KNOW what I ordered, dude) and saying it's different. YEAH, I KNOW IT'S DIFFERENT. I CHANGED IT. I TOLD YOU THAT THREE TIMES ALREADY.

After nearly 3 minutes of trying to get him to listen to what I was actually saying I just gave up and left. Definitely won't be spending money here anymore, I came there for food, not to get dicked around by some guy who refuses to listen to his customers. What a joke. I definitely won't miss the creepy, skid row looking employees and clientele here either.
author: Brendan R.

description:
I love this place. They definitely have the Philly cheesesteak taste down, 
I recommend the Pizza Cheese 10" with fried onions and hot peppers.
This is a must stop for me when I get over to the city from Marin.
They even have Tastykakes.
author: Robert B.

description: I've been coming to this place for many years and I love it!! Love the cheese steak and steak fries!! The place needs to be a little cleaner though :)
author: SF Lady G.

description:
My two experiences at this place: 

1) a few years ago, delicious cheese steaks but the place got robbed the night I ate there and my bank canceled my check-card (which is how i found out it was robbed) 

2) this weekend, my sandwich was 70% bread, 30% meat. I had to order and pay for each sandwich individually to use a coupon and had to repeat my order to the cashier 3x to get it right. The portions were weak! My "large" fries and onion rings were a rip off.
author: Inna L.

description:
I live right up the street from this place. My parents know the owner of the shop and come here once in a while to buy lunch. Their philly cheese steaks are great. You can't go wrong with whatever you choose to buy.

I like getting mine with garlic and sweet/spicy peppers. And when they put garlic in it, it's not just minced up garlic, they put big garlic chunks! 

It can get pretty busy during lunch because there is a hospital and other stores nearby, but they are pretty quick at making the food.
author: Chris K.

description:
Trying to figure out a healhy eating option this past Sunday, we gave up and decided to give this palce a try.  I'd never been there but my bf had.  Lots of people waiting in line so it must be good.

Not much for cheese steaks, but I picked a 10 inch regualar cheese steak, steak fries, fried zucchini and curly fries.

I actually really enjoyed the sandwich.  The peppers were firm and yummy, and the bread was soft so that I didn't have to participate in a tug-of-war with my sandwich at every bite.  Some reviewers suggest ordering double meat.  If you want a heartier sandwich def. order double.  My bf (a regular for many years here), ordered the 15 inch and the last inch, inch 1/2 on either side was meatless.  No bueno.

The fried stuff was good.  Except the zucchini was a little bland.  Oh, and what's with charging you for ranch or bbq dressing?  I can see being charged for an extra one, but for the first one?  Doesn't that come with the zucchini?

Anyway, I'll be back and this time EXTRA hot peepers for me.  YUM!
author: Jennifer H.

description: My husband kept bragging about their food how good it was but his experience was six years ago I gave him the chance to try it out because I had already something in mind but the experience was awful the food was way too greasy and the vegetables and meat weren't properly cooked
author: Karen M.

description:
I'm not going to act like I know about authentic Philly cheese steaks, but what I do know is this place is good.
Randomly came here on my home one day and I cant stop going.

Best cheese steak in the city and yes I've been to Busters.
author: Nader F.

description: I really like this place for their sandwiches.  Be sure and King it so you get double meat.  If your going during lunch you might want to call it in, cause there can be a 15 minute wait by the time you wait in line and get your food.  The onion rings are great albeit a bit pricey.
author: James H.

description:
I'm going to be short and frank.

The food here is great. Simple cheese steaks done right.

Where they have gone wrong is the service. Yesterday I placed an order online with a couple friends. This was the first time I used this service and the last. When I arrived 45 minutes later the man at the register, Robert, was confused and informed me he had forgotten to tell the chef. To compensate for this dilemma he gave me a free .50 cent side of ranch. I waited another 20 minutes and received my food. 

When I arrived at my car I realized he forgot to give me a soft drink. I ran back inside and asked for my drink. He asked to see my receipt and when I came across irritated while finding my receipt he gave me Attitude. This is rule number one of what not to do in the service industry. He went on a quick pitiful rant about how everyone makes mistakes. I had spent well over an hour waiting to get my friends food, I did not want to start a pity party for this guy.

I must end by saying that Robert was right; everyone does make mistakes. However, in the service industry you don't put your problems on the customer. You can make up for mistakes with kindness and sometimes even giving the customer something nice.

I have been going here for years. The food is fantastic. However, we live in a large city with many other steak shops who may provide a safer and more welcoming atmosphere for its customers.

Caution may be habit forming, let's just hope your attitude isn't...
author: Erronious M.

description: Haven't been here in a while, but I remembered last time the cheesesteak was awesome. Tried it this time, and it was nothing like the steaks I'm used to. Flavor was there, but there was hardly any meat in it! Before there used to be steak overflowing from the sandwich. Now it seemed like there was more mayo than meat. Totally disappointed. Rather go to Jay's now.
author: Doug D.

description: This place was pretty cool and the food tasted pretty good too but th ed only down fall is the meat. The one I got which was just a basic cheese steak was more like ground beef which I'm not the biggest fan of.the guys there are not really about customer service just more like they want you in and out to the next customer and when we asked questions about the place they seemed annoyed and it's not like they went busy or anything. Meh I've had better cheese steaks
author: christina a.

description: I was there when they opened it, and a year after that. It was great, cheese steaks, fries was good, I am from Philly you know, I was happy to see this place. And then I was there today, Jan, 7 2015. The place is filty, everything is dirty and old, and gross. Pictures are never been washed, so as the windows, doors. Now the sandwich. I ordered a mushroom cheese steak, with grilled onion. I took good 15-20 minutes, to prepare it, I was the only customer around 4:30pm. Well the sandwich was how can I say it, .. bad, bad bad. The onion was not sauted, it was burned, and was not soft it was crunchi burned. The meat, was not the usual chip-steak meat, it was ground meat, the roll was from last year, dry, an falling apart. Amorosos in Philly would kill themself, or kill.the owner. My advice to the owner. Close. Rethink. If you cannot keep the food quality, and the place clean and inviting, you should look for a different venture. Philly cheese steak is not you can play with it. It is a iconic food, like american apple pie...
author: Aleks V.

description:
CHEEEESSEEESSSTEEEAAAKKKKSSS!!!!!! 

Hands down the Cheese Steak Shop makes the best cheese steaks.  Nothing fancy here.  The meat is chopped up nice and fine with the cheese and onions mixed right in.  The bread is goldilocks too, not to soft, not to hard.  The hot and sweet peppers are also a must.  The peppers make the sandwich, to be honest.  There are 3 different sizes you can choose from; the 7 inch, 10 inch, and 15 inch.  I've only had the original and it's the bomb diggity ill nana.  I would like to try the hoagie though, which comes with lettuce, and tomato.  I'm not really into the side dishes they have.  Spiral fries are pretty standard.  

As for the Decor, it's pretty outdated.  There's all these pictures of famous Cheese Steak shops, which are framed and all hung crooked.  The place is a little bit dirty, but I don't mind because the sandwiches are so good; I always get my cheese steaks to go.  Oh, I forgot to mention the bad ass "Hook" poster they have, which is signed by Robin Williams.  If this shop cleaned up and remodeled a little bit, it would definitely be 5 stars.
author: Anthony N.

description: Simply the best Cheese Steak that I have tasted in the Bay Area. It's great fast comfort food you don't want to miss.
author: Mario A.

description:
A Phili Fed day means it's time to get cheese steak for lunch! And probably that I should be spending an extra hour in the gym... But anyway, this place has better cheesesteak sandwiches than anywhere else in the marina. the meat and peppers both seem to be much higher quality and the option to add bacon or garlic is awesome. 

Downsides: 

-The salads don't seem to have very much meat compared to cheesesteak salads at other place.

-When I order a lot of things look good, but I end up combining too many extras (garlic, bacon, extra meat) and the the sandwich doesn't taste noticeably different other than having some extra meat.

-It takes about 30 minutes for them to process take out orders, which is decent but still slow relative to similar places in the area. When people have been up early and skipped breakfast even a little bit extra waiting time can be kind of painful.

-Parking is usually pretty annoying in this area, even for our take out orders.

-I really should eat fewer cheese steak sandwiches.
author: Jeff L.

description:
I'm really sad that I didn't enjoy this place more. But I really don't like the steak that they use here. Especially since I went to Buster's recently, which has phenomenal cheesesteaks! 
Also, I can't give more than 3 stars to a place that doesn't have cheese wiz as an option for the philly cheese steak. What kind of "authentic" place not have cheese wiz as an option??? 
That said, the sandwich was pretty good, and the bread used for the cheese steak was delicious. It was perfectly toasted and didn't get soggy. I just wish the steak they used was not so minced-like, and that they had an option for classic cheese wiz haha
author: Rachel T.

description: I can't really speak on the authenticity of "The Cheese Steak Shop" as I've never been to Philadelphia, but they tasted good enough for me to want to come back! I made the mistake of ordering a 10" cheesesteak and definitely should have ordered the larger one; there just was not enough food for me for dinner. We also split an order of curly fries and I must say that portion was a little bit on the smaller side for us to share. The interior was on the older side but stuff like that doesn't bother me. I'll be coming back for sure; maybe they can add Cheese Whiz as an addition? That would be awesome!
author: Tommy C.

description: Must try! Definitely the best cheesesteak in San Francisco. The place looks cheap and shabby, but you're there for their food... and they make MEAN cheesesteaks. Go for 15'' one and feel the cheese flowing through your veins! :)
author: Igor P.

description:
After seeing grandma, I craved more food. Knowing that we were on our way to a BBQ at my sister's, I wanted something light and easy. Like a cheese steak!

Right around the corner was The Cheese Steak Shop. Bad day to go! It was packed with Bay to Breaker hippies! Argh! They make me so mad with their stupid clothes and rambunctious attitudes! Damn kids. Made me wait almost 45 minutes for a damn cheese steak after placing my order. I got a simple 6" cheese steak with onions. Only later to find out they did in fact have whiz. Curses!

So after an eternity of waiting will smelly hippies, my name is called. I get my bag and snag a table. To my dismay, the meat is not overflowing out of the bread. The cheese is not goopy and oozing between layers of meat. I was very sad. 

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/RJjuozKTsgwPNa429tnxbg?select=U3KKGFdWhadb01MH4tiVCA

The bread was great though, meat perfect and flavorful. Muy authentico. I've had every "famous" cheese steak in Philadelphia and this was on par with taste. Just the portions were off for the price. If the kids weren't there and the meat more plentiful, it would have been a knockout cheese steak for California.
author: Eli G.

description:
Why do good things have to be so unhealthy? This place is fast and cheap. You can pretty much customize your cheesesteak: with mushrooms, with garlic, etc. The guys working here are really friendly. I really don't have anything to complain about. Why not five stars? Because I'm convinced that there has to be some place out there that is less likely to clog my arteries. Or maybe not. On the down side, I think my stomach started rumbling a few hours later. I don't want to blame the cheesesteak though. And, it would be nice if they closed later than 10pm. My cheesesteak cravings don't usually hit until past 10.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description: ANytime I have a dental appointment in the city, that is my stop as it's only 20 minutes away to the Dentist when I go to Polk to Mason street. They have quality food and good help. The one in Corte Madara is also excellent if I ever have time to get to it. Love the steaks, onion rings are my favorite, always remember to order. 15 inch is my favorite and I'll order one extra one to take to work the next day.
author: Darren S.

description:
Scrumptious. 

Order the chicken, it may be slightly less harmful than the steak. Then again, it tastes exactly the same, so hard to tell.

Minus one star for the overwhelming not-so-good smell that takes a while to adjust to....is it the onions or the carnage? Anyway, good stuff.

Curly fries=super goodness.
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
Quality meat.
Juicy stuff.
Greasy--in the good way.
Spicy and sweet peppers.
Cheesy goodness.
Yummy-o philly cheesesteaks!
Good fries.  
Good burgers and other stuff.

Friendly service.  

Yeah, I love this place.   And you should too!
author: Fannie S.

description:
These people are serious about their Philly-ness.  My favorite is their giant Amoroso's placard right near the entrance screaming, "Look! Lookit us! Amoroso's! We use them here!"

Oh honey.  If one cares about Amoroso's rolls, one could immediately tell you were using Amoroso's rolls.  No need to blare it out like the unpopular girl who just got invited to the Cool Kids' Party.

But, mocking aside, I had a Philly Cheesesteak.  (And I don't call just anything a Philly Cheesesteak)  Not the be all, end all of Cheesesteaks, but certainly the best one I've had on this coast.  That being said, I felt the steaks were a little stingy - probably to get away with the 'extra meat' option.  You shouldn't need to order extra meat on a Cheesesteak.  A Cheesesteak should be oozing (oozing!) with gooey cheesey meat.  If I can eat the entire sandwich without dripping out meat and toppings, well, that's like eating an entire burrito without dripping out meat and toppings.  You got yourself one skinny-ass burrito!

If this place were within walking distance, I could see myself stopping by often.  But, parking can be such a chore that I don't know how often I would brave the constant parking spot or driveway? tease.
author: Cathy Y.

description:
Ambiance - zero stars. Food nine stars. Cheesesteaks are truly great.  I'm not a "I'm from Philly and I know cheesesteaks" afficianado but these are just plain old GOOD.  The combination of tasty well-seasoned meat, the sweet and spicy peppers (spicy peppers are actually spicy!) and melty white american cheese on a toasty roll cannot be beat.  I get mine with mushrooms.  So good. Also the curly fries are perfect. 

The first time we went here we had to walk by a snarling, barking german shepherd to get in (he was tied up outside), and it was worth the PTSD. Go meat!!
author: L S.

description: I would like to give this place 3 and 1/2 stars. Ordered a 7" Philly. Tasty! Price is good too! The only thing I don't like is their bread. Adding an option for whole wheat would be nice!
author: Wendy L.

description:
It's been a long time since I had a cheese steak sandwich, and such experiences were pretty much limited to visiting Great Steak & Potato places at mall food courts.  Some colleagues decided to call for a lunch gathering here and I agreed to join in.  I was told to be there by 11:30am because they said the lunch crowd can be overwhelming, but that was not the case yesterday.  It could be because of it being a holiday week but I understand why it could get busy because of two hospitals (Kaiser and UCSF Mount Zion) being within a few blocks, along with other medical offices.

I ordered the 10-inch deluxe which, according to the menu, had a few variety of cheese and mushroom.  It was an enjoyable meal, especially with the peppers I requested for.  A colleague ordered some fries that we shared, which in my mind was nothing fancy.

Overall, for under $7 before tax, I'd say if given a choice of this or a foot-long Subway sandwich this will be the choice most of the time.  Service was overall pretty friendly also.
author: H K.

description:
DEE.

LICIOUS.

I made a feeble attempt at being healthy; I got the spinach mushroom cheesesteak. It was delicious - I'm pretty sure that cheesy creamy sauce it was covered in was not healthy. At least I tried?

Don't forget to pick up a frequent buyer card!
author: Jess C.

description:
This place does decent cheese steaks if you like american cheese on them, but otherwise there are better ones in the city. I typically order with provolone, and the quantity of meat/cheese in the 7" is pretty small. Order a 10" if you're looking for a meal out of it. I lived in Philly for 4 years and these aren't as close to an authentic cheese steak as Phat Philly (probably my favorite in SF) or Jake's (fantastic with hot peppers). 

Interesting hint for those looking for a more realistic  cheesesteak: this place DOES have whiz. they refuse to put it on a steak, but it is on their "sides" menu and comes in a little plastic cup. It's even heated. Last time I was here I ordered a 10" steak, the side of "cheese sauce" (they admitted it was whiz) and put it all over my steak. It was much better. give it a shot.
author: Adam F.

description:
This place is a Divisadero institution. Guaranteed during the lunch hour you'll see doctors from the hospital next door coming to clog their arteries with these delicious sandwiches. I have nothing bad to say about this place. The food is excellent and reasonably priced. The menu and atmosphere is unpretentious and streamlined.

You order from the counter. You wait until it's ready, and then you go get it and enjoy.

Everyone should try this place for good cheesesteak, and if you're not partial to beef you can get any sandwich on the menu with chicken instead. Grilled onions, sweet peppers, and hot peppers come at no extra charge as well.

This place is pure gooey goodness.
author: Arin V.

description:
I wasn't sure what to expect when walking into The Cheese Steak Shop.  I was pleasantly surprised.  The staff were all very nice and helpful.  A man recommended we try the #1 so we did.  It was great.  The meat was chopped up so tiny it reminded me of cat food, strange, but it tasted great!  The sweet peppers added a little something special to the mix.  The steak fries were excellent.
The bathroom was spotless.  Always nice to see a clean bathroom.
A nice place to sit and chat with a friend while waiting for her doctor's appointment.
author: Amy P.

description:
Yum.

The sandwiches here are fresh-made. I like the pizza steak sandwich that comes with pizza sauce and provolone. The Philly cheese steak comes filled with sweet peppers, but sadly only American cheese. Both are juicy, and the bun is toasted on the grill. Try the onion rings. They have a good batter and don't come out dripping oil.

This is far better than a fast food brger.
author: Monarch B.

description:
The cheese and mushroom, add chicken with grilled onions and spicy peppers is my go to! Delish!

Get the "spiral" fries. You can thank me later!

A cheap, delicious lunch...6 inch sandwich, fries and a drink comes in around $7.60!
author: Vanessa L.

description:
What else can I say...you DEFINITELY get what you pay for here. 

When I first saw the prices for the cheesesteaks I was thinking to myself WOWW THATS REALLY CHEAP! $4.95 for a cheesesteak! HELL YEA! Then I got my sandwich and there was BARELY any meat in it. Lets just say it was a whole lot of BREAD. Pay the extra $2 for the extra meat.
author: Annie L.

description:
BEST cheese steaks in town  at a affordable price. 


Cons: Goodluck finding a Park.!
author: Niecey H.

description: Being that I've never been in Philly for a authentic cheese steak, I'm going to guess this is as close I could get. I try many other cheese steak in the city and this is a very good one compare to others. The bread was awesome with the grilled beef, white American cheese and sweet peppers. The steak fries were also good and waiting time was not to bad even at 12:15 lunch crowd from the near by medical center.
author: Wolfy W.

description:
*3.5 stars*

Knowing what to expect when going out to eat makes all the difference when going out to eat.  For a quick, satisfying greasy sandwich, the Cheese Steak Shop does the job.  

I think it takes a little while for the food to get prepared, but for about $6, you get a fairly large cheese steak sandwich filled with peppers and onions on a toasted roll.  I've only had the classic cheese steak here, but other items on the menu also looked appetizing.  

Knowing you can be full and satisfied for a cheap price makes it all worth while to come back which is why I do!
author: Natan O.

description:
Average run of the mill cheesesteak - they do serve them on Amoroso Rolls from Philly which is a plus. There is no option for Cheese Whiz on the cheesesteak though and the amount of meat on a regular cheesesteak was less than ideal. Felt the overall value for the price was less than ideal.

Overall, I felt Jake's Steaks in the Marina made a superior cheesesteak.
author: Brian D.

description:
This place is great! When you step in, you first notice the pictures of some of the original cheese steak joints in Philly. Then you notice the smell of the place. I can't put my finger on the smell (probably just the oil and stuff) but it wasn't incredibly pleasing. 

Service is ok. Quick. Not rude or anything.

Now onto the steaks. I ordered their tastefully classic mushroom and cheese sandwich. It was the 7" sandwich. A bit small, but I ordered large onion rings too. The rings were golden and crispy. The cheese steak came dripping with juice and oil like how it should be. The beef was sliced and chopped up making it easy to chew all that goodness. Peppers were a bit over powering in my opinion, but the onions were good. Bread was normal. Nothing special.

What I really liked about this place was the pricing. My whole meal was about $6 for some good old fashioned cheese steak and a batch of onion rings. The sandwiches are greasy and filling. Next time I'm gonna try their king of Philly sandwich.
author: robin w.

description:
My friend & I finally came to the decision to come here for late lunch. Totally forgot that this place existed..but thankfully I remembered. We had some criteria for where to eat: Close-by? Yes. Cheap? Yes. Pay up front & no tip? Yes. We're there!

7" Spinach & Cheese - Delish! I love me some spinach! I would definitely get this again. Sandwiches made warm too. 

Spiral Fries - Very crisp & yummy!

The workers were really nice too :) 

Luckily, we found parking a couples stores down. It's metered-parking. 

I'll be back again :)
author: Jessica A.

description:
I was checking out places to grab lunch around our hotel, and luckily Yelp led me here!

Oh man, the cheese steak was perfect! I did read reviews here that said the meat was a little skimpy, so I "Kinged" ours, and it was delicious. Yes, it's very greasy, so it's not a place you would eat from too often. But a very yummy treat!
author: Jessica P.

description:
Well, in the run for the best cheese steak in SF and after a hard day of golf, we decided to stop here for some decent smackage and damage to my cholesterol levels.

Its a walk-in joint, typical and simple, with reminiscent nod to the fading 70's and Hello 80's family furniture.

I ordered the Philly Chicken, with Cheese and Mushrooms with a side of curly fries.  OH MY LORD.  It was fantastic!  The chicken was juicy, the mushrooms not too soft, and the peppers and onions were done just right: not too crispy or overly cooked.  When I bit into the bread, it was soft with a crunchy crust.  The juice of the meats and vegetables dripped onto the crinkly paper lining my plate.  The fries added the right amount of even more grease and spices to my already succulent sandwich.  After my first bite was ordained by the stretch of melting cheese, I knew we had gone to the right place.

Great juicy cheese steaks.......and cheap on the wallet too!
author: Miika M.

description: The service is very nice. The food is not very good. The cheese steak meat is lacking and dry, might have been steakums. The bread was a bit stale and not bouncy like amoroso bread should be which negatively affects meat juice and cheese absorption. The hoagie was just bad. Bologna instead of advertised mortadella. No capicola. Bland salami. Place is cutting corners on the food.
author: Sub S.

description: I've only been going to this place or its sister restaurants for 30 years now.  So I might need a little more time to form an opinion.  The thing of it is that the sandwiches are great, the qualiity is great and its been that way all along.  Steak, cheese, onions on a soft roll with sweet peppers... sounds simple but it is executed so well.  Their chicken cheesesteaks are good too!  Staff is always friendly and since I call ahead I zip to the phone order line and have mine the moment I arrive.  Even my Philly family admit its not bad (they miss the cheese wiz so who's to say th is isnt better). Ill be back.
author: Sam L.

description: I feel so guilty whenever I come in here because everything is sooo good yet sooo unhealthy! I try to make myself feel a little better by ordering the spinach/mushroom w/ chicken, though in reality it doesnt really make a difference anyway!
author: M W.

description: Delish, the closest you'll get in SF to a real cheesesteak in Philly.  Only reason for 4 instead of 5 stars is their refusal to put Whiz on the sandwich, just like they do at Jim's on State Street.  They do sell it, but it comes on the side only.
author: Dan C.

description:
Meh, mediocre fries and cheese steak.  Both were edible but it is a fucking cheese steak shop, edibility is the lowest rung they should be shooting for.

They were edible enough that had it not taken nearly 30 minutes to get my cheese steak and fries, with more people behind the counter than in front, I might have bothered to give them a 3.  Or even go back and give the meh food a second shake.  As is they won't be seeing me again, I tried My Ivy Thai across the street and have no reason to ever bother with this place again.
author: Max Jonathan S.

description: This place is old fashion with a feel from the real Philly. I love coming here when I'min the area. Make sure to get a 15 inch!
author: Michael A.

description: We had to go here for lunch today.  We ordered two Cheese steaks.  One hoagie style (with lettuce, tomato, and mayo) and one regular.  Both ten inches.  Oh my Goodness!  We have been coming here for decades and they still have the Best Cheese Steaks in the entire Bay Area.  The Steak was seasoned perfectly and the bread was soft and fresh.  These sandos were the perfect Cheese Steaks.  The Steak fries were awesome and the New fried potato chips were excellent.  We have had Cheese Steaks from almost every place in the Entire Bay Area and everyone else seems to try and duplicate The Cheese Steak Shop's recipe.  They all Failed!!!  This is By Far the best!  If you have not been here yet, then you have not had a Real Authentic Cheese Steak.  We love this spot and all the other Cheese Steaks suck compared to this place.  "Caution May Be Habit Forming" is their motto for a good reason.
author: D.c.g G.

description:
I was craving cheesesteak after watching the food network so I hopped on down Divisadero to The Cheese Steak Shop. The area can be hard to find parking so be ready to circle around for a few minutes. The cheesesteak here is a lot smaller than what I'm use to but definitely much more flavorful than other places I've been. I wish they provided more meat in the cheesesteak as I'm accustomed to Jersey Joe's cheesesteaks.

Food Highlight: Mushroom Cheesesteak
author: Rich L.

description: Get the KING SIZE Cheese Steak with garlic... Heaven!
author: Anna W.

description:
This place sooo brings me back to high school when my sis and I would blaze outta school in south city and head to the city to deliver medical transcripts..so I've been going here for HELLA years!

I came back here last week, my sis was giving birth at kaiser on Geary so we were in the neighborhood.

I just got the plain philly cheese w/ sweet pepper... OMG it brought me back! Still delicious....I actually came 2 days in a row!! ooops!!  but YUM!
author: Jade B.

description:
The people behind the counter were nice.

The King Of Philly sandwich was very underwhelming. Unsatisfying.

I don't really need to do that again.

Recommended? = No, not really. Not with Jay's Cheesesteak or Acme Burgerhaus so close by.
author: Chris R.

description: Omg Omg Omg, one of the best Philly Cheese Steaks ever, and it's a chain.  Wtf?!
author: Ken H.

description: Definitely habit forming! There was a point where I came here nearly everyday for lunch. I gave it up for Lent one year to kick the habit and save some money. Curly fries and a cheesesteak - best lunch to get through those long work days.
author: Christy Y.

description: I've been having the Deluxe Cheesesteak, xtra sweet/hot peppers at this franchise around the bay area for 18 years. I was very sad to hear that these places no longer sell jars of peppers, since I love using them at home for my own cheesesteaks and hot dogs. I will always love grabbing a 10" at the shop now and then, but admittedly the beef could be a little better quality for the price and the portions have dwindled since the good 'ol days.
author: George P.

description: Sketchy looking place. Pretty good value. The cheesesteak was alright. I've had better...
author: Charles P.

description: I love this place, even more than some shops on South and Passyunk Ave in Philly!   BUT- the cheese seems to be disappearing on the sandwiches here over the years.  I shouldn't have to open the bun to look for the cheese! Staff is ALWAYS friendly, and gives you your order with a smile!
author: Jodie S.

description:
3.5 stars but rounded up for their consistency.

Food: Cheese steaks are solid, it's good every time I go. Cheese is melted perfectly and the curly fries have a nice crunch.

Ambiance: Location is definitely run down, I would imagine it being the same way in Philly though.

Service: It's kind of a long wait, but to me that means they're taking the time to make the sandwich correctly. 

Price: Probably a few dollars on the high side, but still worth it.

Overall: Greasy but great cheese steak. Grab one and head over to Fishbowl and wash it down with a beer and catch the game.
author: Binh D.

description:
Not always a fan of cheese steaks until the boyfriend introduced this to me. The sandwich is cheesy and juicy...perfect w/ the sweet peppers and extra ketchup on top. 

The boyfriend loves it, I love it.
author: Julie L.

description:
first time visit 
FEB 5th Sunday's Lunch
sandwich was great!
soft bread... 
tasty...
author: Scottster C.

description: This review is only regarding our order placed via doordash.com. The delivery service is great, but the food we ordered is another story. Ordered a few cheesesteaks, steak fries, and corn fritters during our lunch hour at the hospital. We received over cooked fritters, and over cooked steak fries, literally. Perhaps it's only worth spending money with the Cheesesteak Shop if you can pick up the food on your own, so that you can check it. We've never come across any issues when we pick up or dine in with them. It's a tad bit disappointing that this time was the complete opposite.
author: S. F.

description: Best Cheese Steaks this side of the country. What more can you say!
author: Doug L.

description:
Greasy, but I LOVE it. I could chomp on their curly fries all day looooong. 

ALSO!
Gotta get a stamp card, if your going to keep coming here.
author: Tiffany M.

description: The place is a dump and the signage is faded but who cares, people come for the Cheese Steaks not the ambiance. Available in 7", 10" or 15" these sandwiches boast an impressive stack of grilled meat & cheese as well as grilled onions and sweet/hot peppers if you desire (trust me you do). The sandwiches are great BUT (there is always a but), if you go at lunch, be prepared to wait, it was almost a 1/2 hour for us to get ours and some folks just don't have that kind of time to wait for a sandwich. So if you do have the time, then give the Cheese Steak Shop a chance! I recommend the PEPPERONI (with Pizza Sauce & Provolone) as well as the KING OF PHILLY (the classic with 50% extra meat & cheese). I also recommend a nap after eating here!
author: G C.

description:
I just want to say this place still completely rules.

- Northern Delaware native
author: Jim S.

description:
my face feels greasy and as I stare down at my plate, I can't help but think i'm going to have a heart attack. "it's okay" i tell myself, "Kaiser is just a few blocks away"

and into the wild I go devouring a bacon mushroom cheesesteak sammich.. I only go for the 7 inch but hey, I think I can take on a 10incher.

Get your mind out of the gutter.
author: Susy C.

description:
My boyfriend will kill me for say this but I honestly don't get why people crave this place day and night.  I've had their sandwiches a few times and I still don't get it.  It's greasy and I feel like I have to run 10 miles to sweat out all the unnecessary calories I'm putting in my body.

This place is ghetto as all hell.  It's filled with bummy looking people and loud talking teenagers.  That's not exactly my idea of a perfect dining atmosphere.  I make my boyfriend take his order to go as often as possible.

Parking is terrible on Divisdero but thats the norm in SF!
author: Eleanor L.

description: Artery-clogging eats next to a hospital? Oh, the irony. And of course, that wasn't going to stop me. I tried the mushroom cheesesteak and pizza cheesesteak with hot & sweet peppers, onion rings, and twister fries.  For me, the sandwiches were missing that certain 'je ne sais quoi' to take them to the next level. I mean, putting meat and cheese together is fool-proof...so the cheesesteaks were just ordinary to me. The bf and I also did not like the sweet peppers because they overpowered the savoriness of the cheesesteaks. Maybe we'll have better luck next time with just the hot peppers!
author: Caralisa L.

description:
Now this Cheese Steak shop is the place to be! By far it is the best I've ever tasted in the city, and most similar to Geno's in Philly. The cheese steak here is AMAZING, I always recommend it to friends and for the quality of the food it is worth every penny. 

The place is rather small, but has historical significance as the walls around you are filled with pictures from Geno's as well as old memorabilia of all sorts. 

The price is rather expensive, but after your first bite it don't seem to matter. The cheese steak will definitely melt in your mouth and pepper's are flat out amazing as they go nicely with their sweet taste. The meal is fairly greasy though so be careful for those with High cholesterol and high blood pressure. Be sure to also bring a few heart burn tablet's if your stomach isn't quiet the strongest.

Be sure to check it out anytime your around the area. It is definitely one of the wonders in San Francisco that you cannot miss out on.
author: Kyle C.

description:
Best cheesesteak place!!! Not from SF... but I make it a point to get it every time I'm in the city... I usually get their cheesesteak (beef, cheese and onions w/out green peppers) and a side of curly fries! YUMMY!!! If you are not a fan of beef, there is a chicken option too.

If you don't plan to eat there, I suggest you call ahead for pick up. Since they make it fresh, it takes about 15-20 mins.. depending how busy it is.

DELICIOUS!!!!
author: Jolynn B.

description: Best Cheese Steak that I have tasted , habit forming for sure!
author: SF G.

description: Cheese steaks are pretty good - not enough meat but stay away from the hoagie so wrong - they have no clue what they are doing with the hoagie - very disappointing
author: sherri s.

description: Solid classic cheese steak...they kinda skimped me on my curly fries but the cheese steak was satisfying enough.
author: Jesse P.

description: BEST Cheesesteak in San Francisco.. hands down!
author: Jessica C.

description:
CAUTION: May be habit forming (the message on their awning)

And I believe their message is true. Ryry loves this place, I've only been once and I had a good time. 

Ryry loves getting their hoagie cheesesteak and use his frequent buyer card in which you get a free cheesesteak for every 10 you buy. ***Tuesdays are DOUBLE STAMP DAYS!

Lots of sides to choose from but their curly fries are where it's at! They are awesome - not too greasy, very crispy! Other main ingredients available in their cheesesteaks- not just beef, but chicken, veggies, too. 

Decor, not so great, but food definitely makes up for it! + friendly, efficient staff + eco friendly environment where they promote the re-using of wicker baskets for food serving and utilizing recycling bins.

(Ryry's only gripe: the hot peppers could be hotter!)

(check out my food pics!)
author: Christine C.

description:
This cheesesteak is really, really effin good. It's not too greasy, everything is flavorful and melds together in a great way.. hot, melty, steaky, cheesy, oniony peppery goodness OMG I want one right now. *fat* It's inexpensive too. I find the 10-inch is the perfect size (that's what she said!) Fries are decent but didn't blow my mind.

Service/decor is like a fast food joint from the 70s. Not in a kitschy or cool way, though. In its own way it's enjoyable.
author: Remi X.

description:
Having recently been to the original cheese steaks in Philly, I'm now declaring myself a connoisseur to apply that knowledge to those here in the bay area.  Though its only bread, cheese, meat, and the other stuff you wish to add, there's certainly a way to put them together where all the components can compliment each other and make each bite worthwhile.  

It didn't happen with this one.  I remain a fan of Jake's Steaks in the Marina.  What did I get here?

-The King with a side of onion rings - the meat was too dry and the flavors just weren't there.  There was more peppers than it should be which hid the flavor of the cheese and meat meaning it was either overpowering or the meat and cheese were just not flavorful enough.
author: Vincent K.

description:
"Caution: May be habit forming." 

What a warning! It's true. I find myself coming back to this place maybe 2 or 3 times a week for a cheese steak fix. 

My favorite is the mushroom cheese steak with the hot and sweet peppers. The wait is a bit long even when I thought I miss the lunch crowd (I usually come in around 2 pm). I guess a lot of people called in and order a bunch at all time of the day. 

But it's pretty cheap. They give you coupons like $1 off any sandwich and a basic 7" sandwich is around $4.75. On Monday, it's double coupon value day, so if you bring in $1 coupon, you get $2 off! 

Parking around this place is horrible, though. Good thing I work so I can just walk there.
author: LeTran B.

description:
Gawd! This place is goood. But it's not great.

Now that I have had good cheesesteak.... I ponder to myself... what is a great cheesesteak?

I really enjoy the meat and gooey cheese topped with red and green peppers.

Now that I stand back and think about it. I wish the meat would be a little more seasoned. The peppers could be a little more crunchy, than overcooked. I personally like a toasted bread roll than the really soft kind.

I guess that would be my dream cheese steak.

But I would be back to the Cheese Steak Shop... I still have to get my stamps for a free cheesesteak... FREE!!
author: Sam T.

description: This place is a joke! $13.00 for a sandwich with barely anything on it, soggy cold fries, and an extra $.64 for ranch. It only took them 35 minutes though.... Worst food experience I've had in San Francisco.
author: Devin M.

description: Huge cheesestake 15" way bigger and fatter then subway and for almost the same price but 15 inch  awsome. I came here once two weeks ago early morning and it was very good. I only order the cheesestake but in couple days I'm going to try there curly frys as well. I rode my bike and its a 8min bike ride from my place so thats good. And this is the only place were you can get full with a huge sandwich.
author: Anthony G.

description: Believe it or not I don't come here for the cheesesteaks I usually get the Italian hoagie with extra sweet peppers. OMG. it's good!...
author: Crystal P.

description:
This little sub shop just around my home, so sometime when I was really hungery, i always came to here. I usually order "king philli", it has everything in it. I think it is around $7-8, couldn't remember. Great place to go for this price.

I have order the onion rings, it is terrible.....
author: Carol X.

description:
2.5* Classic Philly Cheese Steak
2.5* Barbecue with Smokey BBQ Sauce and Provolone
author: Aaron L.

description: I think the only other time I've had cheese steak this good was when I was actually in Philly.  Greasy and satisfying.  I usually get the chicken Philly with garlic.  They put whole roasted garlic cloves in the sandwich, and the garlic is all soft and caramelized.  Definitely get your sandwich with peppers and onions.  You also can't beat the self-serve soda fountain (i.e., unlimited soda).
author: Karen W.

description: OUTSTANDING cheesesteaks. I introduced this place to my friend from Philly and he told me that this was almost like home. whether you're local or an east coast transplant, this is good grub. i also like the sweet peppers that I've only been able to find here. CSS uses imported from Philly Amoroso French rolls for authenticity. they even have color photos of the Mecca of cheesesteak shops - Geno's and Pat's on their walls. Go for the steak and cheese. the grillers like to clang their spatulas as they cook. Extra entertainment while you wait for your steak!
author: Jeff W.

description: I've had some pretty wild and drunken nights here but let me tell you what I remember- these sandwiches are amazing.  I've been to Philly before and I honestly can't say that these are just as good but they really are the best philly cheesesteaks I've had on the West Coast.  I just wish they had a little more cheese in them.  They also have some fun non-traditional varieties that are worth a try, I like the mushroom.
author: Kash S.

description: I've got no idea how "authentic" this place is, but the food was good, the portions were great and the prices were reasonable. I'll be back.
author: Nicholas R.

description: Wacky Wednesday half off any side all day!!  Original Philly Cheese with everything is the way to roll.  It's a heart attack waiting to happen but I LOVE IT!!  The staff is friendly and encourages use of their frequency card.  One thing, small sides are small so go BIG.  You only live once:)
author: H H.

description:
The best cheesesteak I ever had was here! Granted, I haven't been to Pat's or Geno's in Philly yet, but so far in my cali born-n-raised vida loca, I must say this place takes the cake when it comes to cheesesteak!

I was planning to cook a beef stew dinner from scratch, but glad I opted to try a new place instead. I def got my meat on tho, with these sandwiches stuffed to the max with thinly sliced, perfectly cooked strips of steak, american cheese and sweet peppers and onions. I'm drooling just writing about it! The roll was perfectly soft and crisp at the same time and soaked up the juices of the yummy goodies inside. And to top it all off THEY HAD PERFECT STEAK FRIES. I'm obsessed with fries. If you shipped me off to a desert island and left me with only one food item, it'd be french fries ok. And if they were the Cheesesteak shop's steak fries, I'd be chill with being stranded for a minute. 

Maria who works there is cool as hell too. I call her Maria Pastora.
author: Anita A.
