description:
Tasty bomb-ass cheesesteak sandwiches with bread flown in from Philly, and TastyKakes for dessert.  I recommend the 10" or 15" sandwich with extra meat, grilled onions, hot peppers, and a large curly fries.  This is the only restaurant for which I actually carry a stamp card to get a free sandwich.

I haven't had a cheesesteak better than this on the west coast, ever.

For those seeking a lighter experience, their spinach and chicken sandwich is also excellent.
author: Walter K.

description:
After having a steak here we were soooooo disappointed that we didn't have one anywhere for at least 6 months or more, no lie. I will say the flavor was good however the amount of meat inside was so skimpy it was truly laughable and verging on insulting. We just looked at each other and you could almost see the acronym "WTH" on our faces. If we took our two steaks and combined the meat, it would have been what you'd normally expect in a steak, what little we had seemed flavorful enough, just very little of it.

I'm sorry but can't think of a single reason to go back, I'd rather just forgo having a steak than trek out here but thankfully there's Phat Philly now so we're good. I'd have to rate if higher from the perspective of a pepper sandwich with meat though, if there is such a thing.
author: William S.

description:
Very simple ingredients, chicken/steak + bell peppers + american cheese + bread = great sandwich

The bread is fairly narrow so make sure you order a long enough one.

Downside: very dirty, the tables still had garbage from the last customers. The floor looked as though it had a stampede of muddy feet.
author: Chirag V.

description:
Finally found a decent place to eat days before my mother went home from a 3 week stay at the hospital nearby. Better late than never is so true here.

Both times I ordered the spinach and cheese chicken sandwich with mushrooms and grilled onions, both times they were delicious! Juicy and and flavorful (I loved the sweet peppers you can use as a topping). I also got the curly fries both times and those were just ok. The sandwhich rules.

The place itself could use a make-over and new paint or something, definately not a place to bring a 'princess'. The tables needed to be wiped down both times I was there-but didn't bother me too much since I was just picking up the food. There is a signed poster of the movie Hook by Robin Williams.

The service was very friendly both times, and the food was also affordable, under $10 for the sandwich and fries. Would have looked forward to going back this weekend if mom was still at the hospital.
author: nina B.

description:
This is one of those spots I've been going to for years but never got around to reviewing.  The food is consistently good, the onion rings are the second best I've had in the city (I think Buffalo Burger has better ones) and the only time I've felt sick is if I ate way too much, which is way too easy since it's so good.  I tend to order either the garlic cheesesteak or the BBQ cheesesteak, and I get it with provolone because Cheese Whiz sorta scares me.  :/  

The only thing I don't like is the fact that their sweet peppers are almost never just sweet - I'm not sure if that's on purpose, or it just gets mixed in with all the hot peppers before they're served, but it gets annoying when it becomes difficult to eat the sandwich.  I love spicy food, but the hot peppers tend to overwhelm the flavor.  In any event, I'm about a sandwich or two away from filling up my card and getting a free one, so I think once my eyeglasses are ready, I know what I'll be having for dinner...

4.5 stars.
author: Sus... B.

description:
My friends and I found this place on Yelp and decided to get our cheesesteak fill one friday night, so we came here. It's a little shop on Divisadero, not very impressive from the outside. The first thing I noticed was that the menu has a bunch of interesting choices for cheesesteaks, and the prices are pretty acceptable (I think I paid $10 for a sandwich and a snapple). The employees were very patient and helpful, and the service was quick.

i got a basic philly cheesesteak, and I was very impressed. It was hot, and delicious. I'm not cheesesteak expert, but I was impressed by how cheap and good it was. 

The only negative I can think of is that the place itself is kind of dingy and small, but other than the lack of ambiance, it's a great place, with great people and amazing food. I will definitely be back!
author: Sean F.

description: 5 stars for a great cheese steak in LPH.  Not a philly, but great nonetheless.  I concur that this is great for hangovers - cheesy, greasy, and salty.
author: Jeff P.

description: This place is right next to the University of California San Francisco Medical Center. My wife and I went there and I had a 10" cheese steak with fried onions and my wife had a 7" cheese steak with garlic, we shared zucchini sticks. It was really tasty. I grew up in South Jersey eating cheese steaks made with the famous Formica's deli bread and american cheese and I've eaten a ton cheese steaks after going to Philly games and hanging out in Philly at Pat's and Gino's on there bread with there cheese whiz. So I think I have a good opinion on cheese steaks and these were excellent. The bite was so good I was thinking about it in the middle of the night while trying to sleep. We went to the wharf and had clam chowder, shrimp cocktail, dungeness crab and swordfish but I still couldn't stop thinking of that cheese steak, man was that good!!!
author: Bucky J.

description:
I'm 25 and I can honestly say that I've been eating at the Cheese Steak shop for over 10 years now. I love it! Back in high school we used to have competitions to see who could finish the 15 inch the fastest. 

Though my metabolism has slowed down considerably, I still try to hit up the Cheese Steak shop once a month. It is now my special treat after a visit to the doctor (I hate shots) or after a hard core Yoga workout (they have to balance each other out, right?) 

I'm not a Original Philly Cheese Steak kind of person - I just like tasty food. I ALWAYS order the 7 inch Pepperoni Pizza cheese steak, twisty fries, and a soda. This place never disappoints. I often bring my out of town friends here and never worry about what they might think - it is that money. 

If I could give more stars, I would. For all of you new to the Cheese Steak shop, it is definitely habit forming. Make sure you pick up a stamp card. After so many stamps you get a free 10 inch. Tuesdays are double stamp days and Wednesdays are half off sides days.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Cheesesteak? I never craved it, nor did I ever go out of my way to have some. But after this place, I'm a changed woman! Having come to this place after a smaller first lunch, I was not hungry. Not until the 15" monster came out with those irresistible twisty fries (curly fries). OMG
The sweet peppers in the cheese steak made it that much better. The soft crispy bread, the gooey white cheese, hot and sweet peppers...the meat was just the icing on top. Let's just say this place is now on my crave list...
...it'd be sooo good after a few drinks...hope they open late!
author: yeana j.

description:
Ok. Cheese Steak shop. Yum. Definitely does the job when you're craving something with carbs, meat, cheese - all topped with some hot peppers - which is almost always for me. Did I mention I'm happy I only live a few blocks away??

Even though their slogan is: "May be habit forming," you know after eating it that there is no way you could make it a habit. The gooey cheese and meat alone could do some damage on any body. Not to mention the curly fries you can get along with your sandwich. Only thing about the fries is that even the large order doesn't amount to very much.

Can't go wrong with The Cheese Steak shop and its prices. A good stop for a quick bite (including New Years eve...).
author: Angela S.

description:
where's the beef!  it's been an epidemic since the recession started and this place is no exception.  lately i've been noticing skimpier and skimpier portions.  and i'm not even a huge meat eater.  very sad.

order with extra meat, that is my suggestion.  classic with everything on it, grilled onions, sweet and spicy peppers.
author: Josie M.

description:
Very solid cheesesteaks, probably some of the best in the SF area.  Definitely go for the classic cheesesteak, maybe get it with mushrooms. If you're willing to get messy or use a fork, get the pizza cheesesteak.  Also, unless you live within 5 minutes, I'd eat them there or you risk them getting soggy.

The sides are tasty too, especially the poppers.

Some interesting facts 
1. When you calculate cost per inch, the 10 inch cheesesteaks are the best deal, and the 15 inch ones are the worst. Really strange because you'd think that it'd be cheaper per inch as you got larger.
2. Definitely go on Tuesdays and get the double stamps! They have cards that they'll stamp for purchases and every 12 stamps you get a free sandwich.
author: John H.

description:
Food is great! Defiantly the best place in the city if you want an authentic Philly Cheese Steak! 

My favorite is the 'King Philly'. =)

But the wait is usually several minutes. I would call in your order ahead of time, that way you can just grab it. Normal wait is around 10-15 minutes if you stand there and wait! But the food is worth the wait!
author: Jeff D.

description:
They're not lying when they say it's habit forming! I'm a small girl, but I can easily eat a 10 inch on my own. I'm always screaming,

"GET IN MY BELLY!"

Thank God there's one in Berkeley!
author: Hana J.

description: LOVE their cheese steaks and have never yet complained about it. The service is fairly fast depending on the day and time you go. But on a Sunday its usually not busy. Don't forget to order a side of curly fries, zucchini, or onion rings with your cheese steak.
author: rae m.

description:
Very good cheese steak in a no frills establishment. Sandwich comes with plenty of meat or chicken, onions and peppers (if requested), and real melted cheese (provolone, cheddar, etc...) on a soft roll. My favorite place for a good cheese steak in SF by far. The meat and chicken are always tender, well-seasoned and properly cooked. Try the King of Philly (extra meat or chicken) if you are really hungry. The seasoned curly fries are solid but can be overcooked at times. 

The only major downside to this place is they do not serve beer. It is purely a take-out or "eat and run" establishment.
author: Juan S.

description: One of the best cheese steaks Ive had. I usually get the 10in bacon philly and I "KING" it for more meat and more cheese not bad. They also hook you up with a lil card and when you get enough stamps you get a free 7in Philly. Its pretty addicting If I do say so myself. Also there Chicken and garlic philly is on point!
author: Rene L.

description: nearly 15 years of getting a cheesesteaks here and the same great quality with the same manager.    Frequent buyer punch card has gotten more difficult to get a sandwich and the sweat peppers sometime have stems...but only things I can find to call out.  Service and consistency makes it 5 stars.
author: D S.

description:
When on a Friday, during lunch time.  Expected worse, but ordered and received food in under 30 minutes.  Very nice!

The cheesesteak is really juicy and savory!  The white american cheese nicely melted on top makes it perfect.  (I'm becoming a big fan of white american on cheesesteaks. ) The meat to bun ratio is excellent (they don't skimp on the meat) and I absolutely love the onion, hot and sweet peppers on the sandwich.  I really think it brings it all together.  

This one really rivals Phat Philly and Jake's Steaks.  I'm going to have to come again to really decide which is my fave.
author: Lesliegh H.

description: Recently hit this place for the first time, and I was fairly impressed. I got the standard cheesesteak and fries, and both were quite good. The service was also exceptionally friendly, much better than I've come to expect from a casual sandwich place. I think I still have a slight preference for Phat Philly based on their cheese (not from Philly, so can't weigh in on the relative authenticity), but it's close; I'll call this my option 1B.
author: Pat M.

description: I've been going here for years...really, YEARS...and it's just the best frickin' cheese steak I have had ever in the state of California.  I've never been to Philly so I'll need to re-evaluate this place if I ever do get over there.  But seriously, just can't go anywhere else for a cheese steak, it has to be from here...no ifs, ands, or buts!
author: Emy B.

description:
I would hate to be a vegetarian and not know the taste of these sandwiches. This place is a hole in the wall type place, but he cheese steak sandwiches are AWESOME. I love the peppers, melted cheese and juicy meat! You can't get that flavor anywhere else. Make sure you order bigger than you think you want because you'll eat it! 

Summary:
Sandwiches: Perfect
Atmosphere: kind of grimy actually
Give it another go? For sure!
author: Kirstie A.

description:
The sign on the street has no shop name, instead it simply reads "Caution: May Be Habit Forming." I thought this was just a bit of over-confident-but-clever advertising... until I ate my first one. Now, I can't make it through the city without stopping here: the addiction has taken hold.

Importing both the meat and bread from Philadelphia proper, this place strives for authenticity. Sticky, gooey American cheese dresses the standard sandwich, and while your inner health-nut may be wincing right now, he'll shut right up once the first bite hits your mouth.

The verdict is still out as to whether or not they make their own curly fries or not, but I'll be honest, I couldn't care less. They're so good that they're impossible to put down even if they've become soggy as hell because you got stuck in traffic on your way to pick up your take-out order. (You did order take-out, right? I doubt you'll actually want to eat there. Like many shops of it's kind in the city the Cheese Steak Shop is an experiment in contrast: amazing food in a decidedly not-so-amazing spot.)

I can't shout my recommendation for this place highly enough, but be sure to understand my boisterous enthusiasm does come with a caveat: they aren't messing around with that slogan, so make sure you know what you're getting yourself into.
author: Ryan J.

description:
I'm a big time carnivore and I love my steak in every form and way.  My girlfriend brought me here and I have to admit that I was skeptical.  But, to her credit, she was absolutely right in her opinion that this place was top rate.  I live in the Marina and there are some philly cheese steak shops around my house and none of them come close to this place.

I usually order the pizza sanwich which is just your basic cheesesteak with marinara sauce.  I am sure everything there is good but I've never deviated because I like this sandwich so much.  I could easily eat here a few times a week, but then I would wiegh 647,916,846 pounds and no longer be able to transport myself to get a sandwich.  The fries are also done very well which seems to be a lost art in this day and age. Too many places make soggy or not cooked correctly fries, and it is really a downer.  This place does it right.  And the soda machine has free refills. Winner, winner, chicken dinner.  

Five stars and I look forward to my next visit there.
author: Hanley B.

description: Great cheesteaks but lunch time could take a while to get food since they are so slammed. They also have a frequent card that doubles on tues and Sunday's.
author: Paul K.

description:
Calling all carnivores, the mother ship beckons!!

The husband and his friends obsess over this place and over the past two year my occasional sandwiches have convinced me it is truly the best cheesesteak place in the City.

Our visit today introduced us to their new apps menu - sweet corn fritters?! That just stole the show. I usually opt for a chicken cheese steak with mushrooms and onions, while he does the "King It" original. It always hits the spot.

For those transplants from the east, truly the mother ship is calling and meat is her lure - this place hits the payload for a great authentic taste. Did I mention the outrageous deals they do different nights of the week? Check them out on Wednesdays - three sandwiches get a 4th for free and Tuesday is double stamps day.
author: Jacquelyne L.

description: This place is delicious, but make sure you can handle all the oil and fat they use up in this place. I would not recommend it as your diet buster, but if you're already on a pretty downhill food plan, this place is amazing!
author: Don W.

description: really great phillies and twisted fries, affordable too. great service to boot
author: Niket B.

description:
DUDE...

I don't even like cheese steak sandwiches.  

Come here and order up the mushroom cheese steak...Perfect mixture of soft bread with perfectly browned slices of meat, a sprinkle of onions, mushrooms, and melting cheese...WOW.  It's simplicity is what I like about it.  Other sandwiches from other establishments tend to go overboard with too many flavors.
author: Meesh K.

description:
MmMmm.

Philly Cheese steaks and fries...How could you not indulge in such a inexpensive delicacy.  Good cheese steak shops in the city are very rare these days, especially with San Francisco's healthy food craze.  

But if you like to take your diet a back and succumb to your juicy, tasty cravings then this is definitely the place to get your fix.  I say a 10 inch cheese steak with a side of fries should hit the spot just right.  Make sure you get yourself a buy 10 get 1 free card in case it becomes an addiction
author: J Y.

description:
i stopped in here to get a sandwich while I was in the neighborhood.  I have fond memories of the shop in Walnut Creek.  

However it took an insane amount of time to get a sub-standard sandwich.  I stood in line for 30 minutes whyile the incompetent cashier worked.  After ordering, I waited on a stool right next to the counter for an hour for my sandwich.  They called name after name, but not mine.  Finally I asked them where my sandwich was, and it turned out the sandwich had been sitting right there on the counter for 40 minutes, without them ever calling my name.  Total time wasted:  1.5 hours for a cold sandwich without enough meat or sweet peppers.  I will not be going back there.
author: Michael B.

description:
So, on a recent visit to SF, my friend told me I had to try the Cheese Steak Shop, so i went with him to try it out.

I got the original veggie sandwich and he got a cheesesteak. I only ordered a small size and oh my, it was HUGE! It definitely was a surprise and was delicious. It came with giant heaping portions of grilled vegetables on this tasty white bread. I was scarfing down the sandwich!

My friend got some curly fries with his sandwich and they were perfect! They're crispy and packed with flavor!

For 2 sandwiches, curly fries and 2 drinks it was less than 20 bucks which put another smile on my face!!
author: Michelle Y.

description:
An ok place for what it considers to be cheese steaks

I guess I am biased since I've had cheese steaks from Philli but that this place was tasty but not fulfilling. It wasn't full when we got there but immediately after arriving the line got almost to the door. Just by how quick the line got and the time that it was (around 3:00 pm) I figured this place would get a lot busier once people went for dinner,

Something told me not go get a simple cheese steak from here so I decided to get a chicken philli with bacon and steak cut fries. My friend got the regular beef cheese steak and the first thing I noticed was how small the portions were. Sure, I could have gotten the biggest size sandwich, but I thought the 10 inch would be enough... it wasn't

After trying some of my friend's sandwich and vice-versa, we both realized the chicken cheese steak was better than the beef.

Just by how full it got after ordering, I can already tell that this place has a lot of people who find it delicious but not me.. its ok.

I guess I just expected a giant cheese steak that could barely stay within the buns, but not this place..
author: Roberto B.
Jean K.

description:
I was a cheetah roaming the living room savannah in search of wilderbeasts.  After a thrilling chase that included some impressive maneuvering (such as calling in the order and picking it up), I had lunch by the jugular.  As I waited for lunch to cool down to an edible temperature, the sandwich's pulse slowed, and eventually stopped.  Ripping open the paper wrapped tube, it was uncut.  Eff.  I had to tear it in half with my hands.  Though there was not a wounded gazelle's chance of escape, eating sandwiches half at a time makes me feel like a la-dy.  After spitting out the fiberous, chewy, woody stem sections, the rest of the sandwich was ok.  It did not have a lot of flavor.  Or I am having trouble tasting.  I added some Beliezian hot sauce which was delicious.  But the sandwich lacked a certain something.  

There is something wrong with me lately.  I don't like it traditional.  I don't like the usual.  I'm thinking outside of the box.  In some places, like Philly, I'm sure that kind of attitude could get me shot.  Or worse, I could be denied service.  

Today, I did the usual thing to make sure something tastes good: I waited until I was really hungry, nearly faint from the fatigue and exhaustion.  And then I called in a order to the Cheese Steak Shop.

Originally I was going to have some pot noodles of the instant variety, with a hard boiled egg and the egg was already being de-natured.  But suddenly I realized that I had the car!  Oh joy, oh joy, I had the car and somewhat possessed the ability to drive.  As far as the state of California is concerned, I had the right to drive.  And I was going to do it!

The woman on the phone was very informative regarding the amount of meat on the sandwiches.  I think the 7" was 3.5 oz whereas the 10" was 4oz.  and then if you wanted to add more to that....something about being $2.50 more....Math...not my strong point.  Not something I'd like to be caught in a dark alley, alone, doing Maths.

I got the 10" Mushroom steak with onions and hot peppers.  Why is it that there are so many pepper-stem sections?  I ate at least 3 in my sandwhich.  The stem section is the slice that contains the stem-stubby bit that attaches the pepper to the plant before it was marinated and turned in to food.  The stem section is woody, fiberous, chewy and detracts from the otherwise soft, juicy, melty, gooey cheese steak.  It's like a public service announcement in the middle of church.

I hopped in the car, in the rain, and made my way over there.  Luckily I found parking right off of Sutter.  The sandwich was ready.  I handed over the $1.50 off coupon and my stamp-card.  Apparently I can only get a stamp if I purchase $7 or more, but the woman let it slide this time. 

I skipped back to the car, drove home as quickly as I dared and sat in the living room to enjoy the kill.  

And it was a bit mealy, floppy, gooey, soggy.  But sometimes floppy is good.  Some people like floppy.  But floppy wasn't the problem.  Maybe I didn't wait until I was hungry enough?  Maybe I don't want a traditional sandwich?
author: Christina C.

description:
These cheesesteaks are A-MAZING! I'm a huge fan of cheesy, meaty, peppery goodness, and this is the place I crave.

The steak is perfect -- thinly sliced. The cheese is melted to perfection. And the sandwich is can be smothered with grilled onions, sweet and hot peppers. Totally, scrumptiously delicious.
author: Lauren F.

description:
I'm a big fan of Cheesesteak Shop in Berkeley, and I always enjoy the food.

However, earlier this evening I went with a friend to the Divisadero Cheesesteak Shop, and enjoyed less than professional customer service.

The cashier was friendly, and the food was great as always, but at 9PM sharp, we were told more than once, loudly, that "we're closed!" The implication was, of course, that we were to leave immediately, even though we were still eating.

I can appreciate that employees may be tired at the end of a long day, but I've never been made to feel like I had to scarf my food and run out the door within five minutes of the restaurant closing--not in ANY restaurant I've been to before, anyway.

I say, bad move! It came across as incredibly unprofessional, and I felt extraordinarily unwelcome. If I ran a business, I'd never allow my employees to do this to customers. It rubbed me the wrong way. Maybe I'm being hyper-sensitive, but I don't plan on returning.
author: Tom S.

description: Two nights ago, I had one each of Pat's and Geno's cheesesteaks in Philly - trying to settle a bet I've made with myself that they may not have been as good as I remembered years ago. And last year, having tried The Cheese Steak Shop on a whim, and thinking "holy shit, I think this is the best cheesesteak I've ever had at this crappy looking dive," I think the answer is finally clear: This is the best cheesesteak in the galaxy.
author: Henry M.

description: The staff is absolutely wonderful. Very friendly and attentive-- made me feel at home. I ordered the garlic and cheese steak sandwich and it was good. The taste of the peppers, cheese, and garlic mixed together was delicious! The prices were incredibly reasonable. I ordered a small sandwich with curly fries for under $10. Love the newspaper clippings around the restaurant-- gives a nice historical perspective to things. Will be returning!
author: Lissette L.

description:
The Cheese Steak Shop served me the best quality Philly cheese steak I have had so far. I have yet to go to Philly & try Geno or Pat's but it shall happen soon. My friend & I ordered the 10 inch Original Philly Monster Cheese Steak with the works. The cheese melted deliciously on the meat, which was tender & cooked to perfection. The bread was a nice complement to the flavors. I enjoyed the ambiance of the place & the different people from all over the city who come to enjoy their delicious food. Their prices are very good!

A 4.5 out of 5 stars, I shall come back here again.
author: Clark P.

description:
i've never had an "authentic" cheesesteak.  I don't think i'd like the cheez whiz.  i've never even been to philly, minus a stop in their airport a couple years back.  but i like meat.  i like big, greasy sandwiches and fried food.  i'm a carb-loading, grease-loving, over-indulging carnivore and i'm not afraid to admit it.  

my first taste of this place involved a 10" bacon cheesesteak.  bacon! with beefy, cheesy, oniony, greasy goodness.  it was such a divine amalgam of flavors.  a side of twister fries were good, (but dare i say i kind of prefer the ones they have at jack in the box?).   but oh man, that sandwich.  i could feel my arteries turning into butter.  plus bacon!

on wednesday's they offer 1/2 off sides.  i got myself a stamped card (10 stamps = free 10" cheesesteak), a coupon flyer, and an appetite for more of these sandwiches pronto.
author: Anne Marie B.

description:
I reviewed the wrong place!  This review should be for The Cheese Steak Shop, not Jay's.
----------------
The first thing Tintin said when he woke up was that he wanted a cheesesteak so off we went.  I had the 7 inch hoagie with no mayo and it was the perfect size.   The meat was tasty and not overly salty or fatty.  The fried zucchini were only ok because the breading to zucchini ratio was off.  Too much breading.

Parking was easy, the cheesesteaks were good and I'm curious to try the other sides so I know we'll be back.  .
author: Seong P.

description:
Phoned in the order - picked up within 15 minutes.

Funky smell in the shop, so don't plan on eating here.  

Their sandwiches are pretty tasty although the bread was a bit chewier than it could've been.  

For whatever reason, I felt like the sides portions were kind of small - which is good, in a sense, but still felt thrown off because other places have ginormous portions and i've gotten used to that.

Steak fries - very lightly salted, if at all - but all the while still yummy.

Fiesta poppers - will definitely opt out of these next time around.  and this is the first time I've had jalapeno poppers at a place that didn't have ranch dressing. hahaha

Overall, quick eats.  Good quality.  It'll definitely satisfy a cheesesteak craving.
author: N Y.

description: Awww, sukki sukki.  Double stamps now on Tuesdays and Sundays.  The staff are great but c'mon, fill up the curly fry basket for real!!
author: Rene C.

description:
I remember coming here on my first day at work. All I could remember was that there could have been more meat in my cheesesteak. It took me over a year to come back and give it another shot. This time I was sufficiently pleased. Got the mushroom and cheese with curly fries. I don't know what it was but everything was perfect. Just the right amount of meat and cheese. The peppers gave a wonderful kick. 

Every since that I've been craving cheesesteak once a week. Only pitfall is that the line is usually insanely long and the wait for your food is even worse...If you can I would call in your lunch order. Tuesdays are double stamp days. Woot! Coupons are available if you ask the staff.

**Side note: I got hollared at by an employee as I was leaving today. He remembered my name when my ordered was called and my friend claims he called me baby as I left... Not sure how I feel about that...
author: Tina Y.

description:
On the lunch menu for work today: The Cheesteak Shop.

My coworkers have been wanting to try this place, so we decided to place an order today.  After reading through some of the Yelp reviews, I decided to go with the 7' Mushroom Philly (4.69) w/ 3oz. extra meat (1.59), grilled onions, hot and sweet peppers, and a side of onion rings(2.39)....just under $10.

I was a little upset to find out that my onion rings werent included in the order (go figure...Why is it always ME...the pickiest of the bunch?!?!) *sigh* No worries, I just swiped some steak fries from my boss.  

Upon unwrapping the foil, the bread looked kind of like a soggy hotdog bun, and I thought to myself, ugh I made a mistake for ordering this...However, I was pleasantly suprised to see that the bread didnt fall apart. The flavor of the philly was pretty tasty.  The mushrooms were a nice addition and the cheese was perfect...not too much where it overwhelmed the sandwich.  It was DEFINITELY great with the peppers...a perfect balance of sweet and spicy for me. I loved that the hot peppers were just spicy enough for a little zing and not overly spicy, where I couldnt tasted my food.  

The 7" was perfect for lunch...and I probably could've done without the extra meat, because everyone else's didn't look skimpy, like some of the other yelpers commented about.  The onion rings were..oh wait, THAT's RIIIIIIIGHT...I DIDNT GET ANY!!! Well, the steak fries were exactly how I like them...dry on the inside, with a little bit of crisp on the outside.

Overall, pretty good place. Tasty sandwich, reasonable prices, and a satisfied belly.  Definitely worth a try. Now please excuse me, i need to wipe my face before this food coma kicks into full gear =p
author: sue l.

description:
Think Homer Simpson when he thinks about food. His eyes half closed, jaw drops, mouth wide open and drool to the side of his lips is exactly what happens to me when I think about The Cheese Steak Shop on Divisadero. "philly cccccheese steak...hmm......" Ok.. snap out of it.
If you think Jersey Joe, Jake's, and Philly's Cheese Steak Shop (burlingame) is something to rave about then wait till you try this place out. Their cheese steaks here are greasy, creamy and fatty just like it SHOULD BE! The meat is smothered with melted cheese sandwiched by soft Italian roll, grilled onions and sweet pepper.... omgoodness its a torture writing this review.gotta go.
author: Rebecca L.

description:
This place is delicious-o! I went to this place after work yesterday with a few of my friends and instantly when I walked in I could tell this place was going to be good. The place is your typical downtown sandwich looking place, but the food they cook is delicious. Their cheese steak is probably one of the best I have ever had. 

The thing I like about this place though is that the prices are actually good. They food is really good so I expected it to be expensive, but surprisingly a 7", 10", and even the 15" was reasonably price. I would def. recommend this place to somebody. Their types of cheese steaks are very good. 

If you want a rec for one I would suggest the Hoagie or the Bacon one.
author: Sonlay V.

description:
Upon entering the door under a bright yellow awning, painted with the Liberty Bell logo, a smell of fresh bread, grilled onions, and peppers permeates the restaurant. 

"We import fresh Amoroso rolls from Philly [Philadelphia, PA] twice each week..." says James Talley, a manager and 15-year veteran of the grill at the original store on Divisadero Street, "...nobody else in the city does that."

It is San Francisco's first, oldest, and most genuine of its kind--The Cheese Steak Shop, a favorite for many Bay Area residents and visitors since 1982.

"I like all of them, but my favorite now is definitely the mushroom steak", says Talley. The mushroom steak sounds like what it is; mushrooms, onions, peppers and steak. "Fifteen years ago I would eat the sandwiches on a daily basis, but now it has started to catch up with me", as he rubs his belly over the red manager apron.

The company's motto--"it may be habit forming."

"This place is pretty addictive...I love it...but try not to come here too often" says Cobalt Janssen, 43, who grew up on the east coast but moved to San Francisco in his early twenties. "I remember when they opened sometime in the early 80's, I had been to Philadelphia when I lived back east and this sandwich matches up to any of those."

Janssen mentioned he likes to watch his figure though, because he assumes the role of  'Tina Sparklene' a hypnotist who performs in drag.

"Many of our customers will visit The Cheese Steak Shop before or after they come to us," explains Allison Wahl, 25, who has worked as a receptionist at the nail salon next door since it opened last year. 

While her personal favorite is the deluxe cheese steak, she mentions "...my only real complaint is that sometimes the clientele parks in front of 
our business and plays their music a little too loud for our customers to relax and get their nails done."

The Cheese Steak Shop currently operates 10 stores throughout the Bay Area, and is looking to expand its fresh and flavorful--albeit unhealthy habit, throughout the western United States.

(Matt McKnight, 2009)
author: matt m.

description:
Delicious but cleanliness definitely concerns me. If this place delivered or if you didn't have to actually step foot inside their place to get the food, than it would be A LOT better. 

The cheesesteaks are awesome, I would regularly call in and pick one up during the halftime of football games. The steak fries are also really good. 

As I mentioned above, the only thing holding this place back in my opinion is there actual storefront, it is sloppy, kind of gross looking, and at times a little ghetto. I guess if you really like authenticity it doesn't matter, but I would prefer they cleaned the joint up a little bit because the food is really good.
author: Sam K.

description: I've been eating here on and off for about 30 years and in general the food tastes great. The service is interesting, and the joint is traditionally filthy, but what do you expect. The reason I'm giving three stars is that the portions of food have gotten smaller and smaller over the years and the prices higher. I'm not a huge eater but for 10-12 bucks I should be able to get a meal that satisfies. Unfortunately I guess the cutbacks are a sign of the times, but I'll be back anyway.
author: Sheva B.

description:
Over a hill and through the woods to Divis. Yellow awning, where are you? Ahh yes! tucked in the block I see my homeland. 

"Two large Chicken Phillys with everything, and extra meat."
"$28.50"
"!!! Gulp"
"You meant the 15 inch, right?"
"Oh boy, no. I'm sorry! haha I mean I'm hungry but not that hungry!"

I waited for the family meal and enjoyed the eatmosphere. The cashier was super funny and I couldn't wait to bite into my philly. I run back to union, brown bag in hand--protecting my valuables. I get back to the pad and the smell sets a spell on me as I NEED philly. 

I bite into my sandwich and all my dreams are fulfilled.
author: rachel m.

description:
I've never been to Philly nor am I a cheese steak aficionado but do know a good meal at a fair price - my dinner last night from The Cheese Steak Shop? A good meal at a fair price. For under $20 we had a 7" beef, a 10" chicken, a large curly fries and a package of Tastykakes.

We both preferred the chicken over the beef (and the chicken was MINE - score!) but both were good. The curly fries were crack-a-liscious, luckily we got our order to go or else I would have been ordering more fried, curly goodness.

One other important note - they hand out nifty coupons with your order saving anywhere from $1-$6 on future orders AND on Monday night they double the coupons, making a bargain basement meal all the more affordable.

Next stop - Phat Philly's for comparison. But I'm having a hard time imagining a better value than my meal at The Cheese Steak Shop.
author: phil h.

description: The food to price ratio is really good at this place. We got some of the cheesesteaks and fries, which were delicious. We ordered online and it was very simple. The inside of the place is kind of...well it's there, but the food is good. The staff seemed friendly enough as well. I'd definitely come back!
author: Josh S.

description: I thought I was being ambitious by ordering the 10-inch mushroom and cheese steak but it was just right. In terms of food quantity, the 10-inch felt to me like it was half of a $5 footlong. I had it with the twisty (curly) fries and a soda. Maybe I had high expectations, but I was a bit underwhelmed.... it was a bit on the greasy side without a lot of meat packed into the bun; I liked the cheesiness though and the combination of sweet and spicy peppers is great. My companion had been many times before and said the sandwiches and order of fries both seemed smaller than usual. Two 10-inch cheeseteaks, a 32oz soda, and a large twister fries came out to about $17. I'd probably go back, but I'm not in any particular rush to do so.
author: Kimberly S.

description: Been coming here for years. The only place to get a cheesteak!!!
author: Trev C.

description: These are the best cheesesteak sandwiches in the bay area! Get the 'King of Philly', it is amazing!
author: Nicolas M.

description: I completely concur with the reviewers who are citing a need for more staff during lunch hour. Forty-eight minutes is way too long to have to wait for a freakin' sandwich. The food is good, but not 48 minutes of wait time good.
author: Laura D.

description:
I give this 2 stars ONLY because I think they've changed their recipe over the years.

I went here last week after about a year long hiatus and realized that the flavors had changed.  

I was raving about it to my little sister on the drive there totally playing it up.  When I took my first bite I was like 'wait, there's something missing' come to realize it was that flavor I was looking for.  The flavor that used to draw me to this place time and time again was nowhere to be found on my reusable wicker plate.  I even lifted it up to see if it was hiding underneath... nope no such luck.  There was lots of meaty juice - but sadly - it was bland!  I was so disappointed.  And sadly so was my little sister.

We shared a 'large' order of onion rings.  Judging from their sample sizes shown on the board I figured it would be enough.  Um... I think they gave me a small instead. We had about 4 onion rings each.  Sad face yet again.  

I think I'd go back just to make sure that this last visit wasn't a fluke.  If it was then I'll definitely update this post.  But sadly... 2 stars it will have to be.
author: Judy T.

description:
I was in the neighborhood and was looking for some lunch and I passed by Cheese Steak!!. Their classic Philly cheese steak is pretty dang good. Portion is questionable but acceptable. I mean the bread is like the bread you get at subway's. (which is pretty darn small) The meat was ultra tasty and topped with jalapeno peppers. YUM! Add some curly fries and a drink for 2 and some change and you got yourself an awesome meal. The meat in the Philly cheese steak is very juicy and flavorful. Cost for a 15inch Philly is about 10.29 which is a bit pricey but once in a while would be ok. 

Unfortunately, this place isn't in the best part of town. A bit ghetto and inside the eating area is not the cleanest. Service is ok but not stellar. Still a great place to grab a Philly cheese if you're craving a good one.
author: Allan T.

description: Hella. Get Spinach & Mushrooms added on. Fast Food Swag
author: Nicholas W.

description:
I'm teetering between a 4 and 5 star rating here, but I just can't click that 5th star for a few reasons:

1. it's a chain, which is fine, but it doesn't make me feel like i'm eating an authentic philly cheesesteak.

2. the sweet peppers really taste bad. eat one alone without anything else - you'll see what i mean. if you like it, you're a maniac.

3. the wait. the wait here is horrendous.

4. the portions for the large side is itsy bitsy. like 5 onion rings.

but those things i overlook for how really good this sandwich is. greasy & gooey, those cheesesteaks are really quite amazing. BBQ sauce is pretty good, the prices are good, they got specials during the week which is always fun, frequent stamper cards, fun employees, sports pages up on the wall...the list goes on and on.

I'm going to try another sandwich from here (i've had 3 so far) and if it's every bit as good or better than the other 3, I may hook them up with the 5th star.
author: Victor B.

description: Probably one of the best cheese steak shops ever. My good friend is originally from Philadelphia and brought me to this place because she said that this was what the cheese steaks tasted over in Philly... IT DID NOT DISAPPOINT! I believe that she even said they import their cheese steaks from Philadelphia or something like that?? Not sure. Regardless, this place is habit forming indeed. At one point (after my friend introduced me to it) I was coming to this place at least once or twice a month. It's been at least two years since I've been here, but I love this place. I intend to be going back soon!!
author: Athina L.

description:
Nah fool.  This place is shwagg.

I had high expectations from all of the people claiming but evidentally everyone on yelp like shitty food.  Thats cool with me though cuz leaves more of the good stuff for me.

I got a fifteen inch with peppers.

The one time i ever went to philly, i went to a super-bomb cheesesteak place and they poured cheese all over it.  

Here: weak amount of cheese.  

Roll sizes are all wierd too.  

Fifteen inch: long and skinny

Ten inch: medium and fat (semi-chode)

7 inch: short and fat  (chode status)
author: Chris C.

description:
I want to give it 4 stars.

I think their cheese steak sandwiches are soooooooo yummy.  Probably nothing close to an authentic Philly Cheesesteak.  So you've been warned.  Also, they are extremely greasey.  It's like guilt is dripping off the sandwich instead of oil.

I hate lines.  They get busy.  I hate waiting.  So, I call ahead and get it to go.  Parking's a pain anyway.

None of this slows me down... I have like 5 frequent cheese steak cards in my wallet and they're all almost full of stamps.  (You know, buy 12 get 1 free...)  Ridiculous.

Also.... sometimes, there are cute boys.  Icing on the cake.
author: Lauren R.

description:
5 stars for service. Called me by my name  everytime he spoke to me. 
-1 star for the glares that I was greeted with and no hello.
-2 stars for the super small sandwiches. I paid 7.53 for a 7 inch, like 10 French fries, literally, and a coke. (kudos to free refills). The meat tasted like a white castle patty chopped up with a sliver of cheese and minced onions. I had to strategically place each piece of meat so where I would have a taste of it in every bite. 

Basically, I will probably be back but only if I have NO time to spare to go to Jake's Steaks in the Marina.

Cute kid working behind the counter though. ;)
author: Cally L.

description:
- 2 King O Philly Cheesesteak Sandwich Meals
   One with Twister Fries
   One with Battered Mushrooms
- Order of Jalapeno Poppers
- Order of Large Ranch

*** The Sandwich was really good and tasty!  Along with all of the sides!  Do order a large side of ranch to go with the fries, mushrooms and poppers!  It's really thick and creamy!  Perfect! ***

Reminds me of a small mom and pop shop.  Decor is egh, but it's nice to see the photos of respectable cheese steak shops from around the United States.  

This is a place you have to try once and then if you're feeling like a hefty meal, then make that choice to come back...   Otherwise, I'm am trying everything once and when I think about it, I don't have enough time to try it again unless I've given a 5 star rating to an establishment.
author: Limzer L.

description:
I don't think I've crave for anything as much as I've craved for a cheesesteak from this place. 

In high school, as my friends picked up smoking, I picked up cheesesteaks. ( they come in 7, 10 and 15 inch sandwiches -pick your size)

In college, as my friends dabbled with drugs, I dabbled with different combinations of cheesesteaks. (they've got everything from bacon, mushrooms, pepperoni, onions, garlic, hot and sweet peppers to chicken)

This is one of the first places I drove to when I first got my license. It's the first thing I think of when I wake up in the morning.  It's what I want at night after a long day. It's what I long for when I'm feeling down. It's what I want for Christmas... birthdays, Valentines day..... ... If I could marry it, I would.
 

I admit, *stands up*

 " I, Anna, am a cheesesteak-aholic, I am addicted to the mushroom cheesesteak with extra hot peppers and a side of steak fries with cheese sauce"

*sits down*
author: Anna T.

description: Today my co-worker gave me a cheese steak because it was buy two get one free day, and that was a pretty awesome lunch gift.  I liked it, but I didn't love it.  Part of me knows I NEED to go back and eat it very fresh and warm and crispy.  I would like to try their onion rings ASAP.  I think I might not be the ideal cheese steak candidate, so my opinion might not be the best.
author: Julia D.

description: This place has some good cheese steak! I usually prefer mine with a little hot/buffalo sauce which they don't have in the restaurant (most places do). Over all though it is very tasty in comparison to other places and can hold its own without sauce IMO. But that is my personal preference.
author: Mark C.

description:
Dear Yelp,

I used to go to the Cheesesteak Shop pretty regularly, as in at least once a week, sometimes twice if I was feeling saucy.  What's strange is that at pretty much the same time I lost my taste for it, friends of mine became obsessed.  Well, there's just some shit that can't be forgiven, such as:

1.  I've ordered provolone every time I've been to the Shop.  American cheese is a Barack Obama-nation.  As I said in my old review, sometimes they would forget to put provolone on the sandwich, but they would always remake it.  Towards the end of my career eating at the Shop, they always gave me the wrong cheese.  How fucking tweaked out are these employees that they can't read a simple receipt?

2.  The last few times I was there, the meat tasted really gamey.  Either it was old, undercooked, or under seasoned.  The first time I chalked it up to bad luck.  However, it kept happening again and again.  I couldn't even finish the sandwiches the meat tasted so bad.

3.  This is the real kicker.  The final time I ate at the Shop, I noticed this new promotion they've got going: the King Philly.  For something like a buck fiddy extra, you get twice as much meat and cheese, or so they claim.  In reality, they reduced the amount of meat and cheese they give you on a regular cheesesteak.  So instead of just raising prices, the geniuses in marketing came up with a zany promotion so people don't realize they're getting fucked.  Real cool, especially in these times of economic crisis.

After my final visit to the Cheesesteak Shop, I gave my stamp card, which was fully filled out, to Rita C.  I didn't want to ever step foot in that shithole ever again, even if the sandwich was free.  It's a real bummer that this place sucks now, but the universe always balances itself out.  When one cheesesteak place becomes shit, a better one opens.  Phat Philly anyone?

I give the Cheesesteak Shop a fantastic score of 1 out of 5 stars.

Love,
James
author: Cheryll M.

description: Had a salad here with cheesesteak on top (I'm on a low carb diet - it's the closest I could get!).  Everything was tasty, I just wish it had more meat. (and I ordered double meat.)  Regardless, I would definitely visit again - quite tasty.
author: Jennifer L.

description: I use to love this place. They're still my goto spot for a cheesesteak but I feel like they kinda skimp on the meat, and especially on the cheese. I always have to ask for extra meat and cheese; maybe it's just cuz I'm a fatass?
author: Lisa N.

description:
I never really liked cheese steaks before (yeah yeah I'm weird...I know). I've tried them at other cheese steak places and I just never liked it. After the boyfriend begged me to give this place a try.. I gave in and I'm glad I did!

I got the spinach with provalone and it was pretty darn good! This place is small and it doesn get busy around lunch time and dinner time so try to beat the rush to get a table!
author: Heather C.

description:
Vapid. Sparse. Slow.

10 minutes for a cheese steak when no one else is around makes me sad.  

A true cheese steak is messy.  A true cheese steak oozes and goozes with cheese and drips and splatters with grilled meat and onions.  This cheese steak stared sadly back at me.  It looked naked and defeated.  The first few bites are just bread.   This sammie is neat, compact, and small.

The interior is dilapidated but is speckled with local reviews and sports teams giving it a homey, small-town feel.  

Willing to try it again with hopes that I just got a bad sampling!
author: Jane L.

description:
This place is the bomb! I go here at least once a month. If it was in my neighborhood I would go more often. 
I usually get the Value meal which includes: A Hoagie w/cheese, lettuce and tomato,a soda and twister fries! I love those peppers they use on the sandwich. (where can I buy them?) The wait can be awhile at times, the workers are nice and the prices are in my budget range.

Writing this review makes me want one! NOW!
author: Shanika M.

description: I have been coming here for years. Being a transplant from the East Coast, was yearning for an authentic cheese steak. This is the best cheese steak in Northern California...hands down. Don't worry about the price. It is worth it!!!  Enjoy.  You can't lose here!!!
author: Ray g.

description:
THE BEST!!!!! philly cheese steaks in san fran.  
just thought i'd say that.
author: Marley E.

description: Awesome cheese steaks here, easily the best in town. Just be sure to let your sandwich cool because it can burn your mouth.
author: Won't B.

description:
I'm always surprised when I see doctors and nurses in here. I know that Kaiser is just around the corner but you would think that health care workers would be outside the door with their arms linked singing "We Shall Overcome" instead of inside indulging in what could be THE unhealthiest food you can get. But damn, this shit is TASTY. Gooey cheese, sweet pickled peppers and french fries. I can feel my arteries clogging just thinking about it. I guess it's a good thing it's so close to a hospital.

Tuesdays are double stamp days.
author: Josua P.

description:
I've been going to this greasy gem for decades.

The sign out front say's "Caution: May be habit forming" because I believe (and correct me if I'm wrong), they sprinkle crack rock on top.

I'm sure that this place is going to be responsible for at least 22% of my first heart attack (although that math is not a perfect science)

I always order the 10" or 15" Mushroom Cheese Steak and add hot sauce and jalapeno peppers with a side of Steak Fries.

I also strongly recommend eating THERE rather than TO GO as cheese steaks do not travel well and get soggy.
author: Thömas F.

description: Little skimpy on the meat but the flavor is definitely there!  It's a dive and it doesn't bother me at all.  The curly fries are thumbs up and I can't wait to go back.
author: Sassy G.

description:
I've been informed by a reliable source that Cheese Steak Shop actually does have Cheez Whiz!  +1 star!

Don't get too excited; they refuse to actually put in on your sandwich.  If you are jonsing for some whiz (hehe) you must order it as a side and apply it to your own goddamned sandwich.
author: Emily X.

description: The line is always ridiculously long. We order 50 cheese steaks for the office and they told us it would be ready in an hour. An hour and a half later we were still waiting. It took 2 hours to prepare. Should've told us. Finally ate the sandwich and I was disappointed. What are these people waiting for?? Maybe I'll give it another chance... maybe...
author: Wendy L.

description:
When I first moved to SF in 1993 I visited the East Bay briefly and had a cheesesteak at the sister location to this shop. Being wet behind the ears it took me a good 5 years before I realized they had a chain with one right up Divis from my house. D'oh!
Still a favorite to this day, they make solid Philly style grub thanks to using only Amoroso hoagie rolls, which is key. Everything is served up just right, but they'll maybe forget your peppers, which technically should be grilled into the meat. 
I get my Philly on sitting next to the old photos and license plates of 'home' that adorn the walls.
author: Colleen B.

description:
I'm from Philadelphia.

Philadelphians know cheese steaks.

THESE, my friends, are real deal Philly cheese steaks.
__________________________________________________

The difference between the sammies served at TCSS and the plonk that others serve in airports under the Philadelphia cheese steak moniker shamefully featuring shaved fillet mignon and A1 sauce is striking.  I get all filled up with violent indignation each and every time I see the bastardization of this home town favorite.  TCSS does cheese steaks to perfection because:

1) A cheese steak can only be considered a Philadelphia cheese steaks if it is made on an Amoroso's roll.  TCSS flies these buggers in so they're basically fresher than you can get in the City of Brotherly Love.
2) The meat is basically Steak Um chopped fine.  Proper.
3) The consistency is pure, chewy-delicious Heaven.

TCSS even sells Tastykakes, which is Philly's own family-owned snack cake company.  Simply delicious.

Add to that great combination crispy onion rings and pictures of the great cheese steak shops of the Philly area and TCSS makes this Eagles fan's heart sing a song of joy.

TCSS doesn't have any ambiance to speak of other than that provided by the salt of the earth staff and patrons, but then again, what more ambiance do you need???  This is the *peoples'* food we're talkin' here!
author: Chad T.

description:
Tasty.  Awesome.  Awesomely tasty.

Loved it.  This is so much better than Jake's in the Marina.  The meat actually tasted like meat.  I actually liked it so much, i finished my 7 incher in 3 minutes.  it was done by the time i walked back to my car located at kaiser.
author: Janet S.

description:
OK.. so I've been working next to this place for a little over a year.. When I first worked here, i use to eat here twice a week... until I gained weight... So I avoided this place until I lost the weight that I've gain.. So now i just eat it once every two weeks.. OK fine, maybe once a week.. Man I love this place but not what it does to me waist line. AnywhoOoo ...
Bacon cheesesteak with extra cheese 
Spinach/mushroom cheesesteak
Philly Cheesesteak (the regular one with just cheese and make sure to get grilled peppers and onions)
their chicken cheesesteaks are awesome too!
If you don't want steak/chicken, their Italian Hoagie is another good choice. Loaded with Italian meat 
and side of LARGE twister fries or onion rings are a must. You're already eating 3,000 calories, might as well eat another 1,000.. 

I love how they have a frequent stamp card where you get it stamped every time you order a meal there and when it's filled you get a free 10" cheesesteak of your choice! Mine gets filled fast since I'm such a fat ass eating it all the damn time but hey, at least I get some for free! Love the guys that work there, always cracking some jokes and laughing with me or at me..
author: Juliane N.

description:
Oh my, a philly cheese steak is good on any occasion, but when it's done right, that's even more of a reason to celebrate.

Nothing fancy here, but the ingredients are fresh. Make sure to get either  hot cherry peppers or sweet bell peppers, whether you go for a steak or chicken sandwich. Whatever you do, you get your goods served on a Amoroso's roll brought in from Philly (http://amorosobaking.com/).

Note: I thought this was just a one-off, but turns out they have franchises all over the Bay Area. Good for you, not for your cholesterol level.
author: Nish N.

description:
If your looking for a Philly cheese steak sandwich in the Bay Area, this is the place to go.

A buddy of mine lives in Santa Cruz, and every time he's in SF he makes a run to The Cheese Steak Shop. 

Could it be better? Sure it would be nice to be able to eat there, have a beer and watch a game on the TV but it's more food to go.

Parking is very limited. Try parking in Wells Fargo parking lot.
author: Steve K.

description:
Pure cheese steak yumminess. Possibly the best cheese steak in the city. Delicious, inexpensive, and the perfect hangover cure. Yeah they're a bit greasy and salty, it's a fucking cheese steak. 

I only wish that they were a few blocks closer to where I work. Oh well, after a sandwich I could probably use the walk.
author: Mark G.

description:
I watch others munch on their Cheese steaks, but I don't feel sorry for myself.

So what if I can't eat  the steak?

This place has the best veggie sandwich I have ever had in my life!

The Original Veggie. Try it my vegan friends.

Sandwich so good, it can change a mood. Sandwich So good, times slows down. Sandwich so good, makes you wanna slap the founders of Subway, Togo's and Quiznos Simultaneously. Sandwich So good, it can cause a man to change his mind on sueing you.

Anway... I'm a pretty humble guy when it comes down to sharing food, but...

Go ahead and ask me if you can get a bite of my Original Veggie sandwich. Go ahead ask me! Com'n you scared? Ask me!

Oh yeah, no touchy my tasty cakes either or my curly fries.
author: Sani S.

description:
I'm actually really surprised this place received this many 5 stars. I can only imagine that the rest of the places here in SF are that much worst. I grew up in NJ eating at least one sandwiches every week so I've got my likes / dislikes but have also tried numerous places in and around Philly. 

Based on the quality of the steak and the bread (from Philly) it's a 3 but i had to detract a few points due to the following issues: 
1st - American Cheese is standard on the steaks...possibly the worst possible cheese choice. Provolone or Wiz...no exceptions. I'm a provolone fan 
2nd - My friend asked for Wiz o his and the guy responded, you must be from Philly? He offered wiz on his fries but not the sandwich. If you have a bucket o' wiz, why not offer it on the fries. 
3rd: I tried the pizza steak (mainly b/c I knew a regular cheesesteak would disappoint me), it had some of the thinnest pizza sauce I've ever seen. The bread was almost soaked through before i sat down. 

Customer service wasn't very good, not horrible but nothing worth noting. Clean place with Root beer on tap...yummy. I would not return.
author: Daniel A.

description: in college, I used to go to the version near Berkeley ALL THE TIME, stamping away at my frequent flier card like no other, collecting free sandwiches as a proud regular. I came to this one in SF for the first time after a 7+ year hiatus....  the same yummy meat w/ the same awesome sweet/hot peppers! One difference is they give less meat here than I remember (or am I just a bigger eater now? nah, I doubt it). Minus the peppers what is leftover is slightly lacking in size. Ordering extra meat would make for a better hoagie. Great value overall.
author: Judy K.

description: Best cheese steak by far in the Bay Area That I've had. Too bad they don't serve any beer.
author: Carlos G.

description:
First thing's first: Turn everything you think you may know about regional specialty restaurants on its head. The way it usually goes down in the northeast is that the dirtier & older the place looks, the bigger its capacity for greatness. This goes for cheese steak joints in Philly as much as it does for pizza joints in New York & wing joints in Buffalo. Establishments like these are so passionate about their particular craft that they skip right over things like spiffing up the place with flashy decorations, keeping matching/usable furniture & mopping.

The Cheese Steak Shop is like Sylvester Stallone in 'Cobra'. All they know how to do is build the perfect cheese steak, in the same way that Stallone's Lieutenant Cobretti only knew how to clean up the streets. Cobra would return home to an empty house & open the fridge to find only a beer & a jar of mustard in there...that's it. Then he would sit at a filthy table (one chair only) & knaw on week-old pizza crusts for nourishment, keeping his gun within reach the entire time.

Side Note: Next time you watch '24' & wonder how Jack Bauer got to be such a badass, you can think about three things: Stallone, 'Cobra', & cheese steaks.

The Cheese Steak Shop's biggest strength is the same as their biggest weakness...they care *too* much about building the perfect cheese steak. But please, just accept that fact. Don't try to get too close to them...they're emotionally incapable of doing anything else, & are destined to be alone, with only the smell of sizzling ribeye, onions & sweet peppers to settle them.

You & I are safer & happier for their very existence.
author: Pete J.

description:
This is by far my favorite place to get a cheesesteak! I have been looking for a good cheeseteak for a while and have found it here.  

The peppers, onions, cheese all just come together perfectly.  The roll is amazing too.  There's been a few times where I have had to get what my friends and I call the FAT KID COMBO, which is getting the 15'' Mushroom Steak with a side of fries.  I usually finish it because it just tastes so good, I think maybe getting the bacon steak might be the new fat kid combo though. 

I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE, I do no write reviews that often but I will for this place.
author: Dustin K.

description:
I've tried this place once before back in high school. Initially I thought it was pretty plain due to the fact that it was during lunch break, and some of my classmates bought it to-go and brought it back to school. It was cold and kinda plain so I never really had a good experience with it. 

I was craving a Philly today so I decided to give this place another try due to the positive reviews by fellow yelpers. 

I found parking in the area to be a bit annoying but nonetheless, I found parking and walked into the place. Delicious smells and odors filled my nostrils and I looked at the huge board menu. 

I decided to go for a 10 inch Mushroom and Cheese Philly. The guy behind the counter was the manager apparently from the name tag. I put in my order and I said "whiz with" but he gave me this look and asked me "what?" rather rudely. I suddenly realized maybe they don't do their sandwiches here with whiz so I just said with grilled onions. 

I waited for my order and while I was waiting, I noticed 2 of the staff members were engaging in some sort of argument. I don't really know what about, but apparently one guy didn't like what the other guy was doing and they exchanged words and phrases which included obscenities. I was a bit dismayed by the lack of professionalism. 

I then looked at the manager as if to see if he was going to say anything but he was talking with one of the other employees. Eavesdropping, I heard them talking about a female patron and were saying some things about how she looks and how "excited" they were, if you get my drift. Obscenities were also used in this conversation. 

I basically had to wait about 15 minutes for my order, which was pretty surprising considering that other places have your order ready and in your hands in less than 5. 

I walked out of the place already annoyed by the lack of professionalism and I give it some sort of slack considering it is a 'fast food' type of restaurant and not some upscale place, but I don't give any excuse for the rude, unnecessary comments toward female patrons. 

I get in my car, and instantaneously, my entire car was filled with the aroma of the freshly made, piping hot sandwich. I decided that everything else can wait and I opened up the wrapping. It was nicely wrapped in a sheet of foil and then further wrapped in parchment paper. There it was, a 10 inch, mushroom cheesesteak. Looking at it was already a feast. The roll was nicely toasted and warm, but still soft and fluffy, slightly soaked in meat juices. The cheese was nicely melted and blended with the meat. Speaking of meat, there was a lot of it, and I mean a lot. 

As for the mushrooms, this was where I found disappointment. I had imagined a 1:2 mushroom to beef ratio but what I found was more like 1:100. They were pretty skimpy on the mushrooms and considering the fact that I ordered a MUSHROOM cheesesteak, it was more like a cheesesteak with mushrooms that were accidentally spilled onto the grill and they just decided to throw it in. 

I took a bite. It was like taking a bite out of heaven. The bread was really good, fluffy and soft. The white American cheese was nicely melted and combined with the meat ever so perfectly. The meat was tender and flavorful. And well, the only thing I wished was more evident was the flavor of mushrooms. 

I devoured the sandwich in less time than it took for them to make it. And believe me, it gets better with every subsequent bite. 

All in all, this place makes a great Philly. Granted, I've never been to Philly to try a real Philly, but since I didn't know better, this place makes one of the best "authentic" Philly's I've ever had. Jake's has whiz and better employee behavior, but I think I'm pretty sold on this place for a while. 

It would be 5 stars, but the employee's made this place drop down to 4.
author: Derrick L.

description: I have been going here for years and will drive across town at break time to get one. Today I had the Spinach and Mushroom---maybe the best ever. I am a sucker for steak fries and this place never has disappointed me. I have never been to Philly but with this establishment in SF, who needs to travel East. The help is friendly and always have a smile. If you haven't been here yet---WHY?
author: Mark S.

description:
What the fuck?

It does not take 35 fucking minutes to make a fucking cheese steak.  It definitely does note take 35 minutes to make a fucking cheese steak on at 3:30 on a Wednesday fucking afternoon when there are hardly any fucking people in the fucking place.  And if it does take 35 fucking minutes to make a fucking cheese steak then it sure as fuck better taste a lot fucking better than this fucking piece of shit that you threw the fuck at me the other fucking day.

And no fucking cheez whiz?  How fucking authentic can this fucking place claim to fucking be?  That's fucked up.
author: Doctor L.

description:
In all fairness, this story takes place on my 3rd visit here, so clearly it's not a bad steak, even for a 15-year veteran of Philly.  But here's what happened today.  I walk in and order a 10" steak with provolone and raw onions for the wife.  Fine.  Then I order a 10" mushroom steak with provolone and Cheez Wiz (don't start - have you tried it?) from Ming, my helpful cash register guy.

Ming says, we don't do that here.

I say, really?  what's that?

Ming says, we don't put cheese wiz on the sandwiches.  Then he looks at me knowingly and says, You must be from Philly.

So let's be clear.  You have Cheez Wiz?  Yes, he says.  And you're telling me you're REFUSING to put it on the sandwich?  We don't do that here, it's a San Francisco thing.

I don't get speechless often, but I'm at a loss to explain this.  The LIberty Bell is on the freaking sign.  The grill guy is wearing a Phillies hat.  They import Amoroso's Break, for Chrissakes.  Honest to God, I'm never going here again.  It's Jake's in the Marina from here on out.
author: John H.

description:
It amazes me that so many places get cheesesteaks wrong. it's just cheese and steak on a soft roll, optionally with onions and peppers. It's a formula that works. Don't screw with it by adding stuff like lettuce & tomatoes (I'm looking at YOU, Jay.)

The Cheese Steak Shop has been getting it right since I was a little kid. The steaks are as habit forming as they claim and the decor and service are, well, authentic. Decide what you want before you get in line and go at off peak hours if possible.
author: matthew r.

description:
I've never been to Philly for a real cheese steak, but the California version suits me just fine.  I've ordered the same sando for years:

Chicken Hoagie, 10 inch, easy on the mayo, lettuce, tomato, and provolone.

We just stopped in tonight (btw, Tuesday is double stamps day- fill a card get a free hoagie) and it was simply good.  Stopping in and grabbing a table, listening to the R&B that plays on the radio, makes me miss living in the hood.
author: Valarie A.

description:
Yum!!!  Best cheese steak. I grew up on this place in the East Bay(Walnut Creek) and was super excited to see there was one in the city as well. 

Perfect soft bread that doesn't overpower the steak and cheese.  Unlike Buster's in North beach(all bread).  The mix of sweet and hot peppers are to die for.  On top of that, the curly fries and the wide selection of cheese steaks, you really can't go wrong.  The chicken is right up there with the steak.  Pretty pricey, especially if you go for the 10 inch, but well worth it!!
author: Chase F.

description:
The place: small and smelled on cleaning products. Not too appetizing. And parking sucked...
The price: It's alright... not the cheapest steaks around town, but it's not too expensive.
The products: I got the philly steak salad... it was a little awkward. I wish the steak was a little bit more tasty because I felt it in my mouth, but I didn't taste anything. My friend got the original and it was better - should have gotten the sandwich instead. The bread was good (right amount of crispiness), the cheese was melted to perfection, and I love that you can ask for the jalapenos and stuff. But again, the steak just didnt seem to have much of a kick to it. Maybe it's because I'm asian and I like a little msg in my life, but there was just something missing...
author: Christal T.

description:
As a boy, I was weaned on cheesesteaks by my grandmother in some of the best places in Philly. The ones here are the real deal and I almost had a tear in my when I bit into my first one (no shit!). 

The key to their greatness lies in two ingredients - the Amoroso buns they fly in from the City of Brotherly Love and the white American cheese they use. 

The latter is more important to me personally, as there is no cheese better on this earth and it is the only one that is used by the best cheesesteaks (I pissed off the cheese chef at Gary Danko once by asking her for some - true story!). 

Yes whiners - I know Pat's King of Steaks put Cheese Whiz on the first one - but they've evolved since then and any self-respecting Philly cheesesteak person used white american cheese. If you're using provolone, you're a fucking pizza shop that sells bad steaks on the side, not a cheesesteak place, so don't waste my time. 

Anyhoo - if you want melted cheesy goodness on perfectly diced steak with onions and a classic roll - get your ass here pronto. Dig.
author: Jay N.

description:
Finally tried it today....We both ordered cheese steaks, one with marina sauce one without.
I guess I liked it being that it only took my a full 3 minutes to eat.....
Very friendly guys work there with really cute personalities. 

I don't think it was the best I have eaten but I will definitely be back!
author: Christine S.

description:
Perfect.
I ordered a 7" philly and couldve eaten the whole thing, but I have this thing for steak-cut fries. 

And fish and chips. 

My sandwich was tasty, ordered with sweet peppers - meat and cheese were perfectly intertwined. There wasn't too much meat, which i personally like.
The fries are hot and fresh-fried, thick cut and go so much better with the CheeseSteak. My companion ordered curly fries...

Which made me so happy that I also ordered the Fish n Chips bc the fish wasn't fishy, and the batter was crisp, golden and perfect. It was accompanied by condiment packets, but this is a cheesesteak place so no hate there. We split the fish and it came with more fries for him. 

Next time love, you need to get your own fries, or I'm going alone.
author: Cheryl D.

description:
Best cheese steak EVER. Seriously.

I recommend the classic cheese steak with grilled onions and both hot and sweet peppers. They also offer a bunch of variations on the classic (including a chicken cheese "steak") and a cheese steak salad. I've never deviated from my usual order, though.

If you're ordering take-out, you'll want to call it in first - orders usually take 10-15 minutes, depending on the time of day.
author: rachel m.

description:
Damn you, Cheese Steak Shop.

These are tears of longing.  I up and moved to LA a couple of years ago and I crave, CRAVE a 10" hoagie cheesesteak with hot and sweet peppers.  Extra mayo.  I have dreams about you.  I have 2 yellow stamp-cards: one in my car and one in my wallet.  Just in case.  See you on my next trip.

Damn you.
author: blackbird e.

description:
It was OK.  

I heard so many good things about this place...I was all excited...I used to go to Philly when I had a serious craving (yes...I would travel an hour and a half for a cheese steak).  And from what everyone told me, it was comparable to Jim's.  No.  The meat lacked that flavor for me.  And the service was kinda creepy.  When I left, the cook said "Bye, *insert birth name here*".  Granted, I paid with my card, but why the hell would the cook know that?  Creepy.

I don't know if I am willing to give it another shot....I mean, the food was probably a 3, but the general creepies stole a star...this is to be continued...

Dun-dun-ddduuuunnnnnn.......
author: Dottie G.

description:
Alright so we planned a trip to Marc by Marc Jacobs on a weeknight and coming from Milpitas straight from work it was a bit hectic. So before leaving work I yelped the area to find a place to eat. We wanted something different from the ordinary sushi, italian, mexican that we eat on a regular basis. So I found The Cheese Steak Shop and boy was I glad that we tried this place. Although yelp had said it was only a few blocks away, it turned out to be about 6-8 blocks away. So after walking there tired and all and wishing we had driven, we found the yellow awning of the place. 

The menu was fairly simple and was straight forward. I inquired about what to get and he had mentioned the Mushroom cheese steak was popular. So we ordered the Mushroom Cheese Steak and the regular philly cheese steak. Along with a side of steak cut fries. Overall the bread was warm and soft and the meat of the cheese steak was like butter, it was softy goodness. 

I wish I had ordered the fried mushrooms as a side instead of the fries but overall the place was great. 

Suggestion if you're hungry do not order the 7" order the 10 or the 14" so you'll be full.
author: Justin G.

description: awesome place! Love the chicken cheese steak KING!!!!! Sweet peppers are a must!!!!!! always the same quality of food each and every time!!!!!!!
author: Dmitriy G.

description: For those who give this place less than four stars, you are all morons.  They fly most ingredients in from Philly and have a great, consistent product.  I have brought a couple friends from the Keystone State and they all say this place could be dropped down in Philly and you wouldn't know the difference.  I would stick to the King of Philly with the works as smaller sandwiches may seem to lack volume and the rings and fries are good but not amazing.  But the star of the show is the cheese steak and this one rocks.  The locations are franchised but with pretty strict guidelines (the owner of the Marin location had to take down some memorabilia that wasn't local or Philly).  The ingredients and technique are handed down from the experts.  The location in Pleasanton is my favorite, complete with a guy in a Phillies hat who might have just flown in to make you your sandwich.  In any event, complaining about service, portions or parking is totally missing the point of the shop.  This is where you come to get the real deal without a bunch of B.S.  The guy who mentions one star for his waistline, he gets it.  No low cal/low carb/gluten free vegan crap here so eat them while you are young and can get away with it (I am sadly, not).
author: Michael B.

description:
The expansive yellow awning out front doesn't advertise the name of this eatery, but instead boldly states this warning in big black letters:

CAUTION: MAY BE HABIT FORMING

They're not kidding, and these are the real thing. The Cheese Steak Shop uses the same rib-eyes and brand of soft rolls you'd find in Philadelphia, importing them regularly to create the authentic taste. While I know that Cheez Wiz is preferred by some, you won't find it at this place.

There is something about the melted cheese slices melding with the greasy chopped rib-eye and the slight heat from the hot (but not spicy) peppers--which I prefer and recommend over the bell peppers--that when prepared just right, satisfies one of the most basic of human cravings: the need for a great cheese steak.
author: Ben W.

description: Small, cramped and not especially nice.  Aside from a group of people that seemed a tad unhygienic, the place seemed pretty clean.  Took about 5 mins after I ordered to receive the hot, greasy bunned gut bomb. The spicy peppers are a nice touch but I think it's the gooey cheese that makes this sandy so good.
author: Dustin W.

description:
Arterioliscious!
