I have introduced several people to this greasy hole and nobody has been disappointed. FYI, the chicken cheese steaks are about as good as steak 'cause as we know it's all about the group orgy of meat PLUS cheese, onions, mushrooms, and the hot 'n sweet peppers. 

I usually don't get the peppers 'cause they burn twice, if you know what I'm sayin'.  But I digest...

YES, service takes way too long. Order ahead but still be prepared to wait: too many peeps have figured out the phone order maneuver. 

YES, parking sucks. Go with a friend and wait in the car at the bus stop while he gets the food. Chances are he'll come back before the 24 bus shows up to menace you.

YES, this food is probably bad for you, so leave the car at home and walk your fat ass over to Diviz. Then you can reward yourself with a 10" with extra meat.

YES, the steak fries are not so good. Order the curly fries and eat 'em while they're hot. Do a little happy dance. Get tossed out of the place.
author: ChickCaesar S.

description:
Oh, man this place is the shit!  And I don't mean "poo-poo" shit, but rather "That's my shit!", shit.

I usually get a 10" mushroom cheese with no peppers and provolone instead of swiss.  If you're coming here during lunch, call them as you jump in the car and it'll be ready by the time you get there.  There is a separate line for phone orders and sandwiches can take up to 20 minutes to make if they're busy (which they usually are).  Parking is easy if you know where to park, but I'll let you figure that out yourself ;)
author: Jeff L.

description:
I love Cheese Steak Sandwiches Mmmmm...

This is the closest place to me that I know about . I always get a 15' cause i'm grubby and I always end up being super hungry. Mushroom with cheese and hot peppers you can't go wrong. The only down fall is that they only put a little meat which I think sucks.. But I guess its ok cause I pay for extra meat. 

Philly Cheese Steak + Curly Fries and a Coke = Me a happy camper
author: Nette A.

description:
I am so in love.  I know that the sign warned me that it could be habit forming-- I guess I was just in denial about what an addictive-personality I am!

Here's a new place to bring my Philadelphia-born dad.  Thanks Vinny for mentioning that they have Tasty Cakes--I hadn't noticed!

I want a sandwich now.......!
author: Melissa Q.

description:
FOUND IT!  Finally...the Philly Cheesesteak makes it to the West Coast.  Born and raised in Pennsylvania, just outside of Philly (yes, I usually got the "Yo Adrienne" jokes) and so I KNOW what it is supposed to taste like and this is EXACTLY it.  

Amoroso buns - check
Hot peppers - check
Sweet peppers - check
Diced onions perfectly  mixed in on the grill with meat and cheese - check
Tastykakes (OMG, they have Tastykakes!!) - check

They even have a photo on the wall of the cheesesteak place I used to go to in Media.  ~sniff.  I come here when I want a taste of home sweet home... and when my yellow cards need to be redeemed!
author: Adrienne P.

description:
"I, myself, have run through Philly many many times and have been to all the "famous" steak shops: Pat's, Jim's, Geno's, Tony Lukes, Ishkabibbles(my favorite name BTW), etc... and I can sum them all up in one word...BLAND! The Cheesesteak Shop, however, is anything but bland. The only thing they owe to The City of Brotherly Love is a "thank-you" to the bakery that supplies their bread which is flown in daily from PA. I like that they pay respect to all the old-skool steak shops in Philly by hanging photos of them on the walls but in my humble opinion they really don't owe them anything. 

The sandwiches are a greasy godsend that everyone should try at least once...I don't care if you're a Vegan...try one! They have so many styles of steak here I won't even attempt to list them all. I will tell you my favorite and highly suggested model that doesn't even include beefsteak. I pretty much always go for the 7" Chicken Cheesesteak combo with onions, bacon, hot cherry peppers, and the secret ingredient...MAYO! The combo comes complete with a drink of your choice and side of fries, and is a great price...I like the steak fries best but the twister ones are good when you feel like going cuckoo-crazy. Don't bother making your combo a "large" I've found that the size of fries is no different if you just say you want a small side. 

Don't forget to pick up a stamp card which will get you a free steak after you collect 10. Sometimes the person behind the counter is feelin' generous and might give you an extra stamp or two for no apparent reason...Don't forget that Tuesday's are always "Double Stamp Tuesdays" without fail. My favorite of the locations is the one on Divisadero...but they're all the cat's pajamas!

You WILL be Satisfied!"
author: NaN K.

description:
Caution: My Be A Habit Forming

yea, that right. that sign is posted in front on this place and its damn true. ive been here many years and still to this day i love it. this is the only place to come for some philly cheese steak. if i never get the chance to go to philly for the straight grease through the bag authentic one ill still be happy for what us san franciscans have here. ever since my first visit ever ive always ordered my usual..10 or 15-inch  mushroom cheese steak (depending on my hunger) with the hot and sweet pepper and a side of either curly fries or onion rings and it always hits the spot. never have a been disappointed but i tend to always lose their stamp card. there has been many times where i only needed one or 2 more but like i said i tend to lose them. or maybe my friends are stealing them. BOO!!! 

for those of you who never tried...its a must. your missing out and remember that a  habit for this will form. like they say. enjoy!
author: Tuan D.

description: You know it's not amazing. However it's not horrible. I like this much better than some other places in the city. It is going for that California style of philly cheese steak, but it still is no Jersey Joe's. A little greasy, but pretty flavorful with a lot of hot and sweet peppers tossed in their with onions. Decent overall.
author: Greg G.

description:
Consistent, believable, close enough to the real thing, fast, greeeezy awesome, and friendly considering it IS a philly cheesesteak joint (been to Pat's or Geno's lately?)

In fact, I think it's time for a visit during my lunch break. YUM.
author: Lindsay B.

description:
I haven't had a Cheesesteak from this place in at least 5 years.
I don't know why...
Mama had half of one in the fridge.
I killed that bitch.
Cold.
I'll be back there soon.
Maybe I'll buy two, just so I can stick one in the fridge.
author: Barry A.

description:
Got grease?

when you have that itch to go to cheese steak Heaven... look no further that this place. Everything here rocks!

I still find it hard to drive by without indulging...  but I think I have overcome my addiction. Hallelujah! My colon thanks me! lol
author: Steven G.

description:
Went back again! Ordered the extra meat and cheese (forgot whats its called) It is kinda a dump but WTF how many meals can I eat on Fillmore that cost me 40-100 bucks. The onion rings are the best, even when I took them to go, still crispy. Its takes some time to get your cheese steak but so what sit there and read the paper on the wall or better yet buy a paper.
It would be nice if some of the "idle" employees would clean the tables.
The guy that works the cash register is good, I doubt he screws up many orders.
author: Mark M.

description: We tried a few other locations first, but I have to say the original one here in SF was by far the best. I loved that the bread was so fresh and softer than the Suisun location. I just hate when we have to drive through the traffic in the city to get here (trying to avoid getting hit by any cars) but what my tummy wants my tummy gets, even if we might end up paying a hefty price for it.
author: Petra S.

description:
Don't know what the hype is, don't let that offend you if you love this place. But my cheese steak experience was just plain OK.

If you've seen my recent reviews I've been to a string of smelly places lately--this is one of them, whatever it is, cleaning product or something--its not appetizing at all. 

The service however is top notch and super friendly.
author: kate r.

description:
An example of Yelp for the iPhone in action (ahem...):

Brother-who-has-lived-in-SF-5-years-and-never-experimented-with-fuckin'-anything: "Yo, let's go to the Lucky Penny"

Me-who-has-taste: "The Penny sucks, yo. Let's get something else, please god."

Brother: "Well... okay. What?"

Me: (Insert triumphant sound and lightbulb over head) "I'll use this nifty new location aware Yelp app!"

(A few seconds pass...)

Me: "How about this cheese steak place a few blocks from here. Great reviews.... HAHA! Dude, the Penny has like 2 stars!"

Brother: "Well, yeah, I mean.... the Lucky Penny isn't ... ya know...'hip'"

Me: "Dude, it's a fucking dive. It should be hip. Hipsters love divey strange ass places. It should be a legend. You know why not? Because it sucks."

Brother: "Let's just get a damned cheese steak."

And what a cheese steak it was. It filled me with joy. Joy! They could end wars with these things!

+3 stars for killer steaks. +1 more for an authentically disengaged staff that doesn't give a shit what you think. +1 for being nearby and open.

-1 for taking 20 minutes to get a damned hot sandwich in the middle of the afternoon on a weekday.

Nobody's perfect.
author: Aiden B.

description:
Hmmm, where did the meat go?

Well, there's not much to these sandwiches.  Soggy bread and lack of meat and cheese was pretty disappointing.  Adding this place to my list of lunch spots I don't like but have to eat at every so often because there is nothing around here to eat!!!
author: Jeanne C.

description:
LEGIT!
It was my first time eating at this location and "The King Of Philly" is absolutely delicious. Might be a bit on the pricey side, but ordering TKOP definitely fills you up (+get your money's worth). I'm definitely having lunch there again next week!
author: R T.

description:
This is The Spot

Best Philly in The Bay No Doubt

Ive been sprung on these things for years you will be too

cant ever decide between the bacon cheese or garlic chicken so i get both
they got spots in the east bay too and one in Reno that puts the cheese sauce like back east

think im gonna get one now
author: Scotty B.

description: Definitely believe the sign - it is addictive.  The cheesesteaks are so delicious!
author: Wendy L.

description: I love you cheesesteak shop, although you are a tad overpriced. I will ding you on the price by one, but I will love you for the best sandwich in the area!
author: Claudia L.

description:
Yum, this place replaces Busters as my favorite place to get a cheesesteak for me.  Of course Busters was my only spot I liked enough but The Cheese Steak Shop has really good ones.

Nice melty cheese, good steak - and it's fairly quick too.

I went before they were gonna close and 30 minutes before you can't eat in and have to take it to go, but it was definitely worth it and I was sober.  Hung over or before you head home I imagine it's even bettah!
author: Gene X.

description:
If you have ever had either Pat's or Geno's from Philly, this place may disappoint you - but that being said, this is still the closest thing I've *personally* had to a proper Philly Cheesesteak since I moved here from the East Coast almost 6 years ago.

The portions are great, the taste is pretty good, the staff is friendly and courteous, and the price is really reasonable. 

My only two "complaints" are that the steaks are frozen instead of fresh and they kind of overdo the peppers if you ask for them. 

But if you're a fellow East Coaster looking to have a taste of home, or just a Californian looking for a fairly authentic Philly Cheesesteak, this spot is a nice place to grab one!
author: Marco M.

description:
Like many sandwiches--the muffalatta, hoagie, lobster roll, po'boy--the cheesestake absolutely requires the correct bread or the whole shebang is worthless! The Cheesesteak Shop has it right as they use Amoroso rolls! Hot, yummy, cheesy goodness! 

And, this is the first time I'm actually glad a restaurant doesn't deliver! Too dangerous!

Note to Whiz fans--nope, it's all about the white American or provolone cheese here

Note to my Philly friends--I'll say this one is closer to a Jim's steak that Pat's or Geno's

P.S. They also sell Tastykakes for those of you craving your Butterscotch Krimpets!
author: Wendy G.

description:
One of the better cheesesteaks I have had.  I really like the sweet peppers they put on them.  That really adds to it.  Haven't been here in a while but what I remember was that they take pretty long.  Not sure if things have changed but I know one of my friends told me that the best thing to do it phone in your order ahead of time.  

I've had some cheesesteaks at some regular diners and I think the best suggestion is to NOT order cheesesteaks at places that do not specialize in them.  Then again, many people may already know this.  

Gotta say though, I think they are better than Geno's in Philly.  When I was in Philly, I had a choice of the 2 Cheesesteak landmarks in this Country and it was between Pat's and Geno's, which are right across the street from each other, and I pretty much chose the wrong place.  

I made the mistake of going to the cleaner place with no line (Geno's) when I probably should have went to Pat's (dirtier looking place WITH a line).  

But that's probably a conversation for another day...  

I guess the topic was cheesesteaks and it brought me back to daydreaming about my Philly trip a few years back......  

Well, let's get back to business.  Let's just say if I was in San Francisco and I had the urge for a CheeseSteak, this is probably the place I would go....

DAILY SPECIALS:
Be sure to get a Frequent Buyer's Card (1 stamp for every $7 purchase; 12 Stamps = 1 FREE 10" Sandwich)

TUESDAYS are Double Stamp Days

WACKY WEDNESDAYS: 
a) Buy 3 Sandwiches and get a 7" Sandwich FREE (Xtras Not Included)

b) Buy any size Italian Hoagie and get 50% off second Italian Hoagie of the same size or smaller

c) Half off these sides - ALL DAY Wednesday, Every Wednesday: Fries, Twister Fries, Onion Rings, Chips, Tastykakes
author: Mark W.

description:
Deeeeeeelicious! 

Grilled onions, melted cheese and tasty meat on bread... what more can you ask for? You got pretty much all of your major food groups compacted in one cheesesteak. The twisty fries (curly fries) were also pretty good.
author: Teresa Y.

description:
With the name of Cheese Steak Shop, you'd think cheesesteaks are their specialities, that they've mastered this simple concoction of buttery roll, seasoned meat, grilled onions and melted cheese over their years of establishment. And with people writing high reviews and the lover stating that it beats (my fave) Fat Philly's, how could I not resist?

I went with the 7" hoagie because I always get the hoagie at whichever cheesesteak institute I visit. There's something so unbelievably amazing about having the regular cheesesteak combo served with lettuce, tomatoes, mayo, provolone cheese, sans onions. Mmm. But that "mmm" turned into a "hmm" the second we received our cheesesteaks. While the lover ordered the classic Philly and I ordered the hoagie, I strangely could not differentiate which cheesesteak was which. They looked mundanely the same. Little roll filled with shriveled up meat covered by a medley of colorful yet unappetizing peppers. The lover obviously figured which was his, being that he actually likes this place, whereas me on the other hand had to figure out my lettuce, tomatoes and mayo were covered under that shriveled meat blanket. All that hot meat that laid on top of my veggies left them pathetically wilted and greasy. There wasn't enough mayo and I barely recall any cheese to that hoagie. The meat was not even close to being considered seasoned, it was as if I were chewing tasteless rubber that was sloppily lodged in between bread. *sigh. I sat there in despair, munching away that poor excuse for a cheesesteak. The only bright side to my meal was the twister fries drenched in cheese sauce.

Never again Cheese Steak Shop, never again.
author: Ally C.

description:
My friend told me about this place...declaring it as the best cheese steak he's ever had.  I don't know what kind of qualifications he's ever had in judging cheesesteaks....he grew up in San Carlos....and has never been to Philly.

Anyways....I ran out of ideas for dinner last night.  My usual bowl of breadcrumbs and cereal mixed with apple juice just wasn't appealing to me anymore, I needed something to fatten me and up and grease my mouth and hands.

To The Cheese Steak Shop I headed!!  oh....actually, I called in my order first...which saved me some time of waiting.

Got the 15" mushroom cheese steak .  Ok...i had asked my friend (who's about 5"4 and weighs a buck 25) if he usually orders the 10"....

"For lunch...sure"
"And for dinner?"
"15"
"!!!!"
"They're not that big...."

Not to be outdone, I got the 15 incher myself and an order of steak fries.  I was going to put him to shame!!  (I'm 6"1 and weigh a good 200lbs).  I arrived at the destination and picked up the package.

Waitaminute...something must be wrong....my cheesesteak....the thing....it's....it's poking out of their bag.  The thing's almost TWICE as long as the plastic that's carrying it.....

oh dear god!!

half an hour later....my hands smell like cheese and beef...there's still a good quarter of the cheese steak left......and half uneaten fries.

Do i concede defeat??   NO!!!  At midnight....right before I went to bed.....I finished every last bite of the greasy goodness!
author: Tadd L.

description:
Best Cheesesteaks in town! Seriously you will not be disappointed. I've been coming to this place for years and each time I grub here, the sandwiches still taste as good as when I first tried them. The joint is a little dirty and smells like a big ol' grease market, but hey you knew that already right? It's a cheesesteak shop. What did you expect?

The Cheesesteak Hoagie (steak, cheese, lettuce, tomatos, and mayo) topped with sweet and spicy peppers is my personal favorite on the board. Paired with an order of their twister fries, it's a meal fit for a king. My only small complaint about this place is orders do take entirely too long to come out. Don't know if the bread is baked to order  or what, but 15 -20 minutes from order to arrival can get a little irritating. Oh well though, still totally worth it.

For those of you who've only sampled cheesesteaks at your local Subway or Great Steak & Fry,  stop by The Cheesesteak Shop. You will seriously be blown away.
author: jeff c.

description:
I ordered a cheesesteak with mushrooms, onions and peppers.

The steak was there and quite good. However, the cheese was barely there. I got maybe two mushroom pieces. No onions. A few peppers (not grilled).

The service is friendly if slow.

What bumps this up to a 3-star is that you can get a non-obesity-inducing 7" sandwich for $7, instead of being forced to order and eat some 10" or 12" monstrous greaseball.

Another bump up is that they wrap their to-go sandwiches quite tightly in foil and paper, so you can indeed take it safely to go and not worry about a disintegrated sandwich. The expert packing rivals that of Pancho Villa's burritos.
author: Rob T.

description:
I love love love this place.  Have I mentioned that I love this place? :)

I always get the cheesesteak with sweet peppers.  It's the best combo of sliced sauteed beef, melted provolone cheese, on french roll.  So simple, but so good.  Highly recommend.  One downside is that the interior is kind of ghetto (and not in the most chic-chic neighborhood) has a funky smell to it so I usually get it to-go.

Tips: 
* Get both hot AND sweet peppers, you can always pick some out if they're too sweet and hot (which is what I inevitably do with the hot peppers).
* They have a loyalty card (get 10 get 1 free) so ask for one if they don't give you one and you think you'll be a repeat customer.
* I like to call in advance since the line for pickup is usually shorter.
author: Ellen C.

description:
This place rocks--and as a girl who formerly lived in Philly I feel I can say this with confidence.  They make the most authentic cheese steak around and you know why?  It's the bread!  They fly in Amoroso rolls from the east--where they can make a decent soft roll because the water isn't so darn hard or soft or whatever.
I also love the card stamp for the free sandwich and that they have Tastycakes--even butterscotch krimpets yum.
I try to only eat here about once a month though...cause it's meat and cheese and fries oh my!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Yummm.... 

Had an appointment at UCSF and almost went to the Falafel place when Cheese Steak Shop popped up on my GPS. 

Is this the Cheese Steak place on Yelp? Wasn't sure but how can I risk missing out on a Yelp spot?!?

I LOVE the fact there's so much selection and different combinations and that they have fried mushrooms.

I got the 7" Cheese & Mushroom which turned out to be on the small side as the buns are quite narrow for the 7". Cheese wasn't evenly spread out and I threw on a dash of salt but it was still a damn good sandwich. Mushrooms were a bit overfried and I burned my tongue but that's my own fault. Cuz you'd think I'd learn by the 3rd mushroom but no that didn't stop me.

Clearly this isn't 4 stars on the high quality food category but it's damn good greasy goodness.... Next time I'll get the 10"!!!
author: Princess Pompom Patootie W.

description:
Took one star off because the service is hit or miss. 

The food makes up for it though.  This place is the real deal, authentic as it gets.  

Amoroso's!  Tastykakes!  Makes this former east coaster happy on hung over sundays!
author: Hillary S.

description:
Okay...

A friend of mine, out of Philly, was here for a job assignment for about a year and, of course, she mentioned the cheesesteaks over there and how good they were and how she missed them. 

So I thought I'd take her to above mentioned place and let me tell you, they didn't disappoint and she was very impressed with the quality of the sandwiches. Her typical thing was the Chicken Cheesesteak w/ mayo, no peppers, no mushrooms. 

What almost made her orgasm in public, though,  was the fact that a) they use the original Amoroso rolls! Yep, the ones baked in Philly - flown in,  b) their fridge,which was stacked with Tastycakes and c) that they serve cream soda!

Don't ever tell me again a woman's not easy to please on occasion :)

Great place for lunch or after a drink. 

What's up with the nurses, though?? Shouldn't they know better?
author: Mike K.

description: The best Philly Cheesesteak ever. Thye say you have to go to Philly to get one of these, I only go a couple blocks. The meat is lean and the bread melts in your mouth a big thumbs up.
author: Ezra J.

description: Great philly. I personally have to try more phillies to be able to judge but i would def go back and was plenty satisfied.
author: M R.

description:
So I was sitting at home, starvin' like Marvin (I feel like only douchebags say that - true?) so I decided to call up my mans Richard (be sure to check out his review right below mine) and Alex so I could annihilate my hunger with a 15 inch cheese steak done in the style of the city of brotherly love. Having checked out the Cheese Steak Shop the day before, I naturally chose to come here again. The shop's slogan is "Caution: May Be Habit Forming" and uh yeah. I came here two days in a row.

I've only had the original Philly steak and it's pretty delicious--get the 15 inch if you're starving; the 10 inch suffices and I won't even try the 7 inch, that's like snack status. Steak, white American cheese, onions and sweet peppers give this cheese steak some pop. The sweet peppers offer a nice contrast that I didn't think I would enjoy. I do, though.

The curly fries taste like Jack in the Box fries. 

Mid-meal, my friends and I discovered something fantastic: mere feet away from us was a man who looked like the spitting image of Martin Luther King, Jr. No lie. This absolutely made my day.

Oh I almost forgot, if you're getting a 10 inch, make sure to "King" it--they'll give you extra meat and cheese. Apparently, they don't "King" 15 inchers. I don't understand this, because you can just ask for extra meat and cheese and they charge you the same additional fee.

You'll probably see me here, chillin' with MLK.
author: Edmund C.

description:
One of my coworkers from UCSF told me about this cheese steak shop. I used to work right across the streets from the shop and I would walk by it during lunch hours...better believe it...its PACKED in that little store. I decided to give it a try one day and I'm glad I did! Their cheese steak sandwiches has been the best I've ever had! My favorites are the steak sandwich with spinach and cheese or the steak sandwich with mushroom and cheese. =P delicious! 

Their bread is soft and sweet and they give you a nice portion of meat, cheese and topping.  I usually get the 7'....it's pretty filling, but on hungrier days I can eat the 10' all by myself. =9
author: Jenny K.

description:
Best Cheesesteak in SF, enough said.

Oh, and "man up" for the 15".
author: Michael F.

description:
How good is this place?

I live in Los Angeles

I went there 12 years ago. 6  years later, I was still having occasional dreams about eating one of their sandwiches. When I started traveling regularly to the BA for my job, I would never miss making a side-stop here, even if I had to schedule a two-hour lunch to drive up from San Jose. 

I haven't traveled up to the BA for 2 years now, and I am interviewing for a new job. One of my first questions? Will there be travel? 

Any place that makes that deep a Pavlovian impression over 12 years is definitely THAT good.
author: Chris M.

description:
This place is a classic.  I don't think they can match up to the cheese steak carts in Philly who's sandwiches melt in your mouth, but I live in San Fran so I'm gonna pretend like I've never had those before.  
I always tend to go for the hoagie just because I like all the toppings (lettuce, tomato, peppers, mayo) but I've had their chicken steak and pizza steak too, and those are good.  
I love those peppers.. can't get enough of em.  You can ask them to cook the peppers on the grill with the meat if its not to busy..this is what I prefer.
Get their curly fries.
Make sure you're in close proximity to a nice comfy couch you can pass out on after wards..this meal will put you down for a few hours.
author: Ray S.

description: Love this place. Great buns, go for the chicken rather than the steak, ask for spinach, mayo, shrooms and you are golden. Not for every day food, but great for the hungover/malnourished at any hour.
author: Cynthia D.

description: I've been meaning to come here for a long time. I didn't exactly know where this place was, until I saw "Caution: may be habit forming." I went in there and got the most basic meal: regular Philly cheese stake and small fries. I enjoyed my meal very much.
author: Alex Y.

description: What can I say about the cheesesteak shop other than it's comfort food at its finest!! Go for the cheesesteak with sweet peppers, mushrooms and EXTRA cheese. YUM YUM YUM!!!
author: Kandace K.

description:
You don't need whiz!!! This place is definately habit forming and I do highly recommend any sandwich where you can clearly taste the meat.... think of it as looking death in the face.

You can find me there eating the garlic or spinach..
author: Eugene G.

description:
My friend suggested we go get cheesesteaks and I was a bit hesitant because everyplace I have tried in SF has really sucked. I told him nothing could beat the cheesesteak shop in Pleasanton. Surprisingly enough it was the same place!! I was so excited to go and get one and I will have to say this place is bomb!
I got the normal cheesesteak, nothing fancy but it brought back memories of eating these in P town. It was delish!! I can't complain and I will definitely be back for more. They also have a frequent buyer card, which is great because after your tenth purchase your next one is free.
author: Kehaulani K.

description:
If you love "street food" type stuff this is heaven on earth!

I've been going here since I was a kid. Hands down the best meltiest and grubb'n cheesesteaks in the city. Never been to Philly, but have heard these are almost identical. Top quality.

CHEESE STEAKS!!!!

ps - you gotta get the sweet and spicy peppers on it for sure.
author: Michael M.

description:
Amoroso greatness.  Sometimes you need a cheesesteak, and the place to head is The Cheese Steak Shop.  Deffo habit forming, but if you're going to die, a coronary with gobs of real provolone and soft fluffy Amoroso bread is a choice worth considering.

Oh my is it ever habit forming.
author: James D.

description:
It is not Geno's nor Pat's. But we had to try this place with a friend's recommendation. Easy to find location and not bad parking.
We had the 10" cheesteake w/ mushrooms and small side of twisted fries and soft drink. The bread is good, the meat was good, but didn't care for the cheese. And the mushrooms, well lets say I barely noticed them mixed in the meat. They only had American white cheese and no other options. The side of small fries was really small. So I recommend ordering the larger side if you luv fries. It was okay for west coast cheesesteak. The other place we have gone to was in the mission, Phat Philly's. That one is by far the better of the two.
author: Mauling W.

description: I wish people would be more critical on yelp. This is a good cheesesteak. It's meat and melted cheese it would be tough for it to be gross. However it is not very meaty, it's 11$ for a cheesesteak combo...it's good not great...jakes in north beach is better
author: Christian S.

description: I must say, this is one of the best tasting cheese steaks I've had in SF even though a little skimpy and served on what amounts to a breadstick. The home made chips where pretty good also. Unfortunately the complements stop there. The rest out the food and sides were average at best.  When my order was rung up at the restaurant, I was charged almost five dollars more than the price from my online order.  I showed the price of the online order, on my phone, to the person ringing me up (wearing a shirt that said manager on it) and was informed that there must be something wrong with "my app".  Then a second person, wearing a shirt that also said manager on it, offered his bit of intelligence saying " I know the order is right because I took it".  Supreme confidence I guess. I argued for a second saying it's not "my app" but yours which was met with more intelligent rebuttal and being really hungry decided to just pay and leave.
author: steven a.

description: This place is great!   Can't go wrong with the regular Philly or if you want to mix it up (and go healthy) you can do the BBQ chicken.
author: Chad W.

description:
Amoroso rolls... the original Tasty Cake... where is the Cheese Whiz?

This place is usually packed - so it takes 15 to 20 minutes to get your food after you've ordered it. If you are really hungry, call ahead - and then pick up. Eat there if you wish, but that way, you'll get your food once you get there!

And don't forget that Tuesday's are double stamp days.
author: Judy L.

description: Best cheesesteaks in the city. My fav is the Mushroom with sweet and hot peppers. Love that they give you a frequent buyer card if you ask to start earning towards that free one. Habit forming? YES!
author: Ro M.

description:
If you like Philly cheese steaks as much as I do,  I suggest you come here to the Cheese Steak Shop when you go in there are pictures of Celebrities on the wall like a poster of HOOK signed by Robin Williams and it says Best Cheese Steak in town.  They got better Philly Cheese Steaks than HOOTERS.  
I remember whenever my mom and I would take my grandpa to the doctors we'd wait two hours or more to see the doctor but while we would wait to see the doctor my mom and I would walk one block to The Cheese Steak Shop, I would have the BBQ Cheese Steak and get Curly Fries and Pepsi, my grandpa would have the Mushroom Cheese Steak.  Oh how I miss my grandpa so much =( OMG I'm getting teary eyed just remembering him.  So if you like Philly Cheese Steaks, come on over to THE CHEESE STEAK SHOP! THE BEST CHEESE STEAK IN TOWN.
author: Emma R.

description:
Yes, yes, yes. 
I've been to Pat and Geno's in Philly and The Cheese Steak Shop could possibly beat them both. It's greasy, cheesy steak goodness drips everywhere. I like mine with mushrooms, onions, spinach. 
It's not clean nor does it have any decor, but all I need is a giant cheese steak in my gut and I'm a happy camper.
If you're in the neighborhood and hungry this will satisfy you. Get ready to put on the pounds once you're  hooked.
author: Jules T.

description:
Decent. But not a philly cheesesteak.

First of all... of course.... a true philly cheesesteak contains cheese whiz. Yes, of course, cheesesteak places in philly does have the option of american cheese...  and at least american cheese is better than say... swiss... which i have seen next to the name "philly cheese steak" which is just an atrocity.

Second... Philly cheesesteaks are greasy. The onions cook in the grease... and the cheese just gets in with all the grease and just makes the most delicious mess in the world.

Third... You go to a philly cheesesteak place, you come out and everyone that passes by you knows that you've had a cheesesteak. You smell of greasey onions - a fine line between this smell, and a fat guy that just ran its first marathon, and hasn't bathed in several days. But for some reason the smell is good.

And if you bring the cheese steak into your car... forget about it! Your car will smell like that .... fat guy that just ran its first marathon and hasn't bathed in several days... for about a week. 

And this just induces your desire for more cheesesteaks.

Anyways, back to this place. Decent.... as any sandwich with steak and cheese product would be. But not a philly cheesesteak.
author: Bonnie H.

description: There are few things greater than a hot, greasy Philly cheese steak. Load on some hot peppers and we're good to go. However, The Cheese Steak Shop is only mediocre, so I'm a little surprised by all the great reviews. The meat quality doesn't seem that great, and my fries were lukewarm. The philly didn't have much flavor either. But even a bad philly cheese steak is still A-OK, so 3 stars.
author: David D.

description:
I can't say anything that Chad T. didn't already... in fact it was because of his review that I went here tonight.  I love me some Jay's, but Jay's is the Papalote of cheese steaks... and when you're craving the real thing, Jay's just don't cut it.   I had in fact sworn off cheese steaks in San Fran because every time I had one here, no matter how good it was, I could only think of what I was missing.

Hot Peppers, cheese, wiff or wiffout onions... zaa sauce.... only homer Simpson has the word to describe that... ahaghghhhhhhhh....  top it off with some peanut butter tasty cakes... That's a recipe for some serious itis!

I got the frequent diner card... I suggest you do the same, 10 steaks = a free one... I plan on claiming that in oh, 9 more days.  And the money I save on the free steak will definitely help pay for the new larger pants that will go with it.  Life is good when full of steak.
author: Darren R.

description:
This place is the real deal.
No reason to go anywhere else in the city for a real cheesesteak. 
They use Niman Ranch meat as well, which never hurts...
author: Nicolas H.

description:
I've been coming here as long as i can remember. my mom used to work at Mt Zion hospital across the street and used to take me there after work sometimes.  so this place holds a special place in my heart.  

Besides that, their cheesesteaks are incredible.  even their chicken cheesesteaks are great too. there are a lot of options when it comes to dressing up your cheesesteak: mushrooms, garlic, peppers, bacon (even though i don't eat pork), pizza suace, etc...

this is by far the best place to get a cheesesteak in the city. don't bother going anywhere else. oh and be sure to go on tuesdays, it's double stamp day....you hard core heads know what im talking about
author: Lalo G.

description:
As I am about to fall asleep from rigorous last mintue midterm studying, my cousin Ed calls, seeing if I want to go grab a cheesesteak with our other cousin Alex.  Seeing that I was starving my brains out, I obliged. 

I had been here before a while back and the sandwich as I had remembered was decent, borderline good. I was more amused with their wacky promotions that they advertise inside. (Wild Wednesdays - buy 3 get one 3, Double Stamp Thursdays)

I get inside and there are quite a few people inside, despite it raining and freezing outside. Good sign. A quick glance to my left and I see the fountain on the outside of the registers, signaling free refills. Plus 2 for unlimited Dr. Pepper. 

I ordered the standard Philly with Provolone instead of American. When I first got the sandwich, I was surprised at how little meat there was. But all that changed when I had my first bite, which was full of steak and cheese. Delicious. Also ordered steak fries. Ehh. They were ok.

As I was eating my sandwich, couldn't help but notice the other patrons in the shop. There was a family of 4 to my left and another family of 4 behind us. And then there were individuals scattered throughout the tables, all while people came in and out doing pick-ups. All in the pouring rain. All for cheesesteaks.

Great place for cheesesteaks. I would stick with the 10 incher unless extremely hungry, then aim for 15.
author: Rich H.

description:
I love these cheese steaks... they are the best.  Double stamp tuesdays!!!!

Get the classic cheesesteak with everything on it... and get curly fries... and lots of ketchup.

Then... don't eat again for 2 days.  Do this every week to reach enlightenment.
author: Andrew G.

description:
The best.  I was taken here by a philly native who raved about the place, and she was right.

I've also had the pleasure of visiting Philly for the weekend, and  ate  at Jim's and Gino's (two of the classics).  I like the cheese steak shop better as the chop their onions a little smaller, and grill them a little more to make them meld into the sandwich better.  I know cheese whiz is a philly staple, but I also like the better quality cheese.

Other reviewers are right on with the Amaroso rolls, and the tasty cakes.
author: Dan G.

description:
I am going to second all the good comments that everyone else has already said. 
I have never had a Philly Cheese Steak, so this being my first ever- I was very impressed. 
This place reminds me of a local spot that Man vs. Food would indulge in. Very neighborhood friendly and very tasty.
I got my frequent "habit forming" card so I will surely be back!
author: Janell D.

description:
You will just keep eating, and eating, and eating.  These sandwitches are ALLL deliciouso, and omg.  10 inches just gets clobbered in a second.  15, ehh maybe. 

So you can choose your flavor of cheese steak-- I chose the garlic one.  Supposedly these taste the best with all the peppers on it... sooo I hesitated, but got those just for the experience.  Man, I ate the sandwitch like a t-rex dino would chomp on their food.  

incredibly tired after.  food coma.

later that night, well my itty bitty stomach cannot handle too much caffeine or spicy foods...  \poor me suffered all night long.  

Was it worth it?  hmmm I'd have to say so!
author: Michelle N.

description:
"Caution: may be habbit forming"
i've been weening myself off my addiction, i've got a full frequent customer card to prove it, but had break of will power. On the plus side i get a free 10" on my next visit. As I succumb to the delectable 10 and 15 inch logs of meat, cheese, and peppers, I roll my eyes in pleasure. This happens everytime I go and i'm glad.  

It's so delicious that you'll want a 15" but it'll be a battle to fit it inside your stomach. It's a battle i would be happy to fight over and over again. The place isn't much to look at but damn that's a tasty cheese steak.
author: Ed H.

description: My sandwich could have used more cheese and my bread could have been less soggy, other than that I was pleased with my selection.  I ordered a 10" and split a large order of Steak Fries, with the notion that I'd eat half of my sandwich and have the other half for morning/lunch nutritional needs.  Wrong!  I devoured the whole thing in it's steak-filled goodness in about 10-15 minutes.  The duration of my evening was spent in a food coma as I tried to figure out how I allowed myself to live up to the American stereotype of overindulging.
author: Michael G.

description: Order on the phone and get the pizza cheese steak with light onions and peppers. It's the best and only cheese steak in town.its been over 10 years and my mouth still waters at the thought of it.
author: savannah g.

description:
WARNING: Do not order here and expect to get you food in 15 mins!!!!! Always order ahead by phone.

1st time I went here during my lunch break. It took 45 Mins from the time I entered the door until I got my order! Ridiculous. There is usually 1 guy at the register working the order line, phone order pick up line, AND the phone line!!!!!!

Now that I've learned my lesson, I laugh deep inside at the people in line as I pay and get my food in the shorter phone order line. There's been times when people just leave when the line has not moved for 10 mins.

Good food, good drinks, and the have a frequent eater stamp card. Just remember, CALL AHEAD!!!!

4 stars for the food.
Minus 1 star for slow service.
author: Alex A.

description: This is the best in town. Don't for get to go on Tuesday for double stamp day !
author: derek l.

description:
I am a Philly Native, born & raised and I love this place!  Totally hate all of the 'poser' philly cheesesteaks that claim the 'philly' status and yet they have green peppers on 'em..  wtf!?!  this place is the closest to home for me with Amoroso Rolls and Cheez Whiz...
I always order the Mushroom Cheesesteak with Extra Meat and Side o' Whiz...  MMMMmmmm.....
LOVE IT!
author: Rose C R.

description:
I've been to Pat's. I've been to Gino's. I've been to Jim's (Jim's kinda sucks) I've even had em from a pushcart in a park in Philly (the best!). I've had em in New York, in Boston, in San Jose, sh*t I even tried one in Texas (meh). I've eaten a lot of cheesesteaks. Its my guiltiest pleasure next to crying inappropriately during bad movies (I swear, Hellboy made me cry, then again, so did Chronicles of Riddick). Whatever.

Gimme a large classic philly and I am happy. Happy until I realize just how bad that was for me. Again, whatever. Life is short. Shorter still because of these.

The Cheesesteak Shop is pretty good. The one in Berkeley is equally good. I wish I could live in a parallel universe where these were health food.
author: Zac H.

description:
Not really sure what the hype is here... 

The food is decent but the places closes early and it is pretty overpriced considering it is just cheese, meat, peppers and bread.

Philly's fall into my "drunk food" category, so closing early is a big mistake.
author: Adam O.

description:
I went here one day craving some good eats and drove out just to get me some delicious Philly Cheese Steak Sandwich.  Maybe my expectations were too high and we were really let down.  

For pics and full review go to http://www.kats9lives.com/2008/05/let-down.html

We came and picked up a huge sub.  I got the one with lots of garlic but it was just really bland.  We went home and pulled out all the spices and seasonings in the cabinet.  I am sorry to say it was a huge disappointment.  Luckily my sister was with me and she was able to finish it because I just didn't want to waste the calories.

Maybe I will eventually give it one more try, but I don't know if it will make a difference.
author: Kat L.

description: Best Cheese Steak sandwich around, uses authentic Amoroso rolls. A little "course knowledge": call in your order or prepare for long lines; if driving, bring someone who can run in and pick up your order while you circle the block (parking is impossible); eat your sandwich when you get it...wait too long and the bread might dissolve; keep your eyes peeled for a certain SF celebrity who is known to frequent; finally, accept the fact that you will become addicted to eating these sandwiches.  The BEST!
author: Tony C.

description:
Is it too much to expect some steak on a cheesesteak?  From a place called the cheese steak shop?  

I went highly expectant after reading all the wonderful reviews here.  The place looked the part of somewhere that'll dole out a great cheesesteak - it looked bare, it had a straightforward menu, and it was packed at 2pm on a Sunday afternoon.  But after waiting 15 minutes for two original Philly Cheese steaks, what did I get?  Tiny scraps of steak scattered in the middle of my 7'' bun.  I've not seen anything fit so well inside a bun as that cheese steak plus all its onion and pepper topping.  With a good two inches of space at the end of my sandwich.  And our large order of twisty fries was mostly broken and dry pieces.  

Where did it go wrong?  I have no idea.  Obviously most of you have had way better experiences.  But based on my experience, I have to give it a one star, plus the title of worst cheesesteak I've ever had.
author: Wendy C.

description:
Meat, cheese, bread, hot peppers... what else could you ask for?  steak fries... i'm happy when i have steak fries. 

forget about your diet when you come here.
author: Alice C.

description:
Yelp, you should allow half stars because I give this place 3.5 stars.

I'm from Philadelphia--South Philadelphia to be exact.  For those of you who don't know what that means, that's where Pat's Steaks is (there is an old picture of it hanging the wall).  So, I know a good cheese steak and what makes a good cheese steak.  

With that said, this place is getting my 3.5 stars because...

*They do the chopped up steak instead of strips of steak that are cut thick (don't ever order a "philly cheese steak" in FL..yeah, i know, my fault).

*They have Tastykakes.

::Those two reasons alone should guarantee at least a 4 star rating, but...::

*Unfortunately, there wasn't a lot of meat (compared to Philly ones).

*Refridgerated Tastykakes...not so tasty anymore :( and it's a tad over-priced, but hey, I'll dish out the extra loot to have a taste of home...but yeah, refridgerated Tastykakes are a no no.  They're dry and dense then.

Well, anywho, I'm still very happy with this little place.  I love the pictures and it really does give this S. Philly girl a case of homesickness, but in a good way.  I'll definitely be back!
author: Sally T.

description:
Yummy.  I was in  the neighborhood yesterday, and had read the great reviews.  (As a side note, Divsadero seems to have many more cheaper good  options than Filmore)  I  got the 7 inch garlic steak with everything and twister fries I'm a small girl, and it was a  perfect size for me.    Since I live across town, of course I ate there.  It was REALLY good.  Everything was flavorful,.   The meat was juicy, the mix of hot and sweet peppers was perfect.  The mushrooms were to die for, but for some reason  were only distibuted on one side of the sandwich.  I liked the cheese, but the next time i go (and there will be a next time time ) I will get extra cheese.   These are MINISCULE gripes though.  It was ridiculously good overall. 

I happened to go at the height of lunch time, and it took about 15 minutes to get my food. (and the cashier told me how long when I was ordering, so that was nice to know.)  It was a small place, but I found a tablle where my chair wasn't blocking people.  Using  a chair or not, I definitely would not stay here with a group to eat.  Most people were taking their orders to go though. My cashier was great about bringing my order out, and even got me some water. (I was going someplace else for coffee after.) 
I'm actually glad I live across town because I would become blimp Sascha otherwise!
author: Sascha B.

description:
I'm a little embarrassed giving this place 5 stars, when I have never even had their Philly Cheese Steak here.  The first time I went I tried the Chicken & Garlic Sandwich, which has the chicken chopped up into small pieces like ground beef, and the garlic left in whole cloves of roasted garlic.  OH MY GOD.  (My mouth is watering just typing this.)

This sandwich, which I know is bad for me because the meat is in a lava flow of melted cheese, and on a roll that although as white bread as could be, is some kind of crazy bread that, as a west-coaster, I have never been exposed to.

I go back and back and back.  Be warned before you eat here...  Most people who visit this place develop an addiction, and I don't think there is a 12-step program that will help.
author: Trigby P.

description: This place is pretty good, but if you're looking for a big meal this is not for you.  It's a bit pricey considering you don't get very much and the 10" cheesesteak is about $9 plus $ for fries and $ a drink, not where I'd like to splurge my money.  Other than that it was a good philly.
author: Christina O.

description:
This place sucks ass! 20 pepper STEMS in our sandwich- tasted like bones.

No stars.
author: yvette l.

description:
I have never been to Philly, but if I was from there, I would probably weigh 350 lbs and sweat cheese steak grease. That's how good this stuff is.

A little known fact, only known to locals. Call your order ahead of time, and laugh "rookies", as you file past the line to the pick-up counter, and get your lovely cheese steak!

BOO-YAA

This stuffs as addictive as crack, and just as bad.
author: Danny S.

description: Delish! King is a must, garlic and mushrooms-great for hangovers and helping make me smile
author: Schmitty G.

description: LOVE THIS PLACE. So yummy, I never have had a cheese steak sandwich like this.  Great fast service, even better food.  Ever since I was there last week I have been craving it for every meal.
author: Krystal D.

description:
Had a hoagie style steak sandwich the other day and yup, still 5 stars, still down and dirty comfort food. 

Oh and learned that you can get frequent buyer cards. On Tuesdays and Sundays, you get double stamps. And they have some other specials posted on the walls too. Once you fill up your card, you'll get a free 10in sandwich. Shouldn't be too hard to do at my rate...
author: Yee-Shing W.

description:
dope.fresh.bomb.great.awesome. 

I had the Mushroom Philly and pretty much spent the next 10 minutes groaning with every bite. My best friend couldn't stop talking about how good the peppers were. "I LOVE THESE PEPPERS! They're sweet but spicy at the same time! how do they do it?!?!"

I just moved to Lower Pac Heights and I'm ecstatic that this place is just down the street and I don't just like this place because my name's also Philly ;)

I bet you say mmm after your first 5 bites.
author: Phil W.

description:
SOOOOO MEDIOCRE, SOOOOOOO MEDIOCRE



"Hey guy's, try a sip of my shake!"
-Michael J Fox
author: John B R.

description: first time here today at cheese steak shop... couldn't really tell where it was but i did see this yellow sign outside "CAUTION: may be habit forming" oh yeah there we are... walk inside there was 2 other customer so it wasn't that bad... place our order... king of philly and spinach/mushroom... love the mini jalapeño spicy and sweet, took about about 10 minutes to finish it... and i love it, hell yeah i would come back here again but i heard METRO is better :P
author: JessePanda C.

description:
I've never had a real cheese steak sandwich nor have I ever been to Phiily. I'd imagine that these logs of meltey heart stopping goodness are better then theirs ("Our Cheesteak brings all the boys in the yard , damn right is better than yours. I could eat you and you'd have to charge" sung to Milkshake). I know I will never eat it in one sitting but I always get the 12 incher with a side of large curly fries. 

Somehow letting these magical mounds of meat, pepper and cheese marinate amongst themselves on the ride home makes them taste better, and the soggy bun I get at home is sooo delectable. Eating them on the spot is nice too. I have at least 9 yellow frequent "cheesteak as crack addict" buyer cards floating in my wallet. It's an evil plan to take over the world I tell ya! One frequent buyer at a time.
author: Alia D.

description:
I've been to Philadelphia twice and tried three of the supposedly best places in the city (Pat's, Gino's and one other I can't remember) for cheese steak and was disappointed all three times.  Maybe I had really high expectations.  I found the bread dry and also the meat.  Is this how a good cheese steak is suppose to taste?

But then I went to The Cheese Steak Shop and realized I wasn't crazy.  Boy do they deliver with a cheese steak that just melts in your mouth.  The bread was soft and the meat was nice an greasy.  Not a place for those that are health conscious.  And they really do live up to their motto of "Caution: It may be habit forming" because I seriously wanted to eat another 10 inch sandwich.  Never fear though, I will be back for my love.
author: Ben M.

description:
I have like 5 fully stamped yellow cards...because of double Tuesdays!  When I used to live in the area, it was the place to go...for lunch, dinner, and rarely enough, breakfast.  *Looking for yellow cards*  I think I used them all.  

Besides the actual Philly sammiches, this small chain portrays great and awesome employees...which ever one you go to.  The funny thing that I noticed was that the guy that takes your order looks the same at each one I go to.  Maybe they're twins.  

As for the sammiches, the meat is cooked meatly and the messy it is, the better it tastes.  I've tried the BBQ, pizza, and plain.  All good.  It doesn't matter which one you go to...they always taste great...no matter which one you go to.  

*DROOL*
author: Joey H.

description: Like the 49ers of 2010, The Cheese Steak Shop is quite overrated. Now they might not be as pathetic as the 49ers but the hype is undeserved. This hole in the wall on Divisadero offers cheese steak sandwiches similar to most basic shops, offering the meat and bread while you choose your toppings and cheese type. It's not expensive but I also feel you get mediocre quality ingredients. Neither the bread, meat or cheese really stood out with great flavors. To me, it was just another greasy sandwich with overcooked beef. The beef was chopped up like ground burger meat which I don't think was a steak to begin with. Not bad but I would recommend Phat Philly for a solid cheese steak experience.
author: Ed L.

description:
The Cheese Steak Shop is the best! You get a quality old-fashioned Philly cheese steak. It's greasy, oily, heart-clogging goodness that you won't feel bad about at the end of the day.  What the hell... why don't you order a side of curly fries as well. Just do it! It feels good! Don't think twice about it because you will one day be back for more.

This place is definitely habit-forming! 

note: ask them to add the whole roasted garlic cloves. delicious!
author: Young P.

description:
Wow, what a disappointment. 

"Steak Fries" were totally mushy, yucky generic mushy ground potatoes. Nothing to recommend them. Minus one star.

Took over 20 minutes to get a sandwich, and they were not even busy. I've gone to plenty of "made to order" fresh places, and it was nowhere near this long. I had to change from "here" to "to-go" because my parking meter was going to expire. Minus a star.

The sandwich? Well, it was supposed to be a "zesty vegetarian" and it was not zesty, it was just.... warm.. and.... moist... that's about it. No flavor, no zest, no nothing. Minus two stars.

I really wanted to like this place, and maybe this should only be a review for vegetarians, but I can't recommend it. If I had walked in, and there were no vegetarian options on the menu, I would have totally understood, as it was a cheesesteak shop, so I'll give them one star back.

 But if you are going to offer a vegetarian cheesy sandwich, do it correctly. Plenty of places in the world do veggie sandwiches with flavor and effort. This was an also-ran.
author: Chris F.

description:
Best traditional Philly cheesesteaks in SF !
However, today I had an early lunch here and the dining area was filthy!
author: Jim C.

description:
i'm not an expert in cheese steak sandwiches, and i don't pretend to be.

i've eaten at two cheesesteak places in sf, this place and the 'v cafe'. i prefer the v.  my sandwich was either suffering from the same recession as my bank account, or perhaps i set my meat/bread mix higher than others.

prices are good, service is what you'd expect, i wouldn't hate you for bringing me something from here -but i may not crave or seek to eat here.
author: Ameer N.

description:
This is it, the best 'steak I've had in California, hands down.
My only complaint is that there isn't one closer to my house. or in rather, in my house. Yes. That would be ideal.
author: Victoria A.

description: Freakin Great!!!!!   Terrific  food!!!! The king of cheese steaks in sf !  great service,friendly, authentic philly style !   Try the twister fries with cheese sauce! totally rockin!!!!!!!!!!!! Try the tasty cakes for your sweet fix!!!! The place is filled with pic of philly and different cheese steak places there. You get a good size sandwich with lots of meat and cheese,I always get extra cheese,however you get it you will like it.Also deli type sandwiches as well!!
author: Bill J.

description:
You want cheese steak! You've got to go here!

Definitely the best cheese steak in town. Prices are great too. I highly recommend the cheese steak with the works. Sweet peppers, onions, meat and cheese on sourdough call my name often! Don't forget the fries!
author: June C.

description:
Pretty goddamn good.  Got the 10" sandwich but quickly found out that 7" is enough  (that's what she said). Will definitely go back. 

Highly recommended for those that want to something tasty and do not care to die a slow (yet delicious) death.
author: l v.

description: I really like this place i got to school pretty close so for the 5 days i am at school 3-2 times a week ill be there. i love the cheese steak and the curly fires. There pretty friendly. The portion of the meat could be a little more for $11 dollars with a drink and fires but that's about it.
author: philip g.

description:
I'll make it really simple. 

As being born and raised in SF, The Cheese Steak Shop was my first (and only) experience with this Philly staple. Throughout the years, I met several people from Philly either bashing the place or reminiscing on how this was close to that they may be familiar with. 

That's fine, I accept that. It's just like how maybe I judge different taquerias around the Bay Area and whining that there are no good ones outside the state of California. Sometimes I find one "close to that of SF" in say NYC. And I'd share it. Why not, I'm not that much of an ass. (That is, share the knowledge and not my food...on that part, I am an ass).

Now I noticed more and more cheese steak houses opening up around town. Some are good, and some are just average. The Cheese Steak Shop to me is just plain consistent - and the good side. My personal fave is w/spinach and mushrooms.
author: Ted P.

description: My husband and I were in the city to go to UCSF and asked a couple of people what they would recommend and this one was recommended by 2 people. The cheese steak was amazing! We got a side of zucchini sticks rather than fries and they were awesome as well. Staff was super friendly and the food was very reasonably priced and we were very satisfied. I would love to see one of these open up where we live in Carson City, NV.
author: Anna W.

description:
The best in SF hands down! Real Cheese melted with grinded steak or chicken, good bread, grilled onions, sweet peppers 
( hot is really hot)....yummy! Love it.
author: Karen H.

description:
SO GOOD. Oh my cheese. this place is so good i cant even describe it. 

its so simple and so cheesy and hot. you can get a foot long PCS which is pretty sweet. they serve it with bell peppers that are perfectly sauteed and the cheese is so cheesy and stays that way the whole time. wtf how do they do that! it kinda takes a while for food, we called in and picked it up 20 mins later and it still wasnt ready. the curly fries are pretty good too. someone told me the curly fries across the street are better but whatever they are just fries.
author: andree t.

description:
Never been to Philly so I don't know what a real cheese steak taste's like. As far as this place I like the original Philly Cheese Steak with peppers which comes with your choice of  7, 10 or 15 inch size depending on how hungry you are.  They are very generous with the peppers and kinda skimpy on the steak. I also order a side of twister fries and 2 sides of cheese whiz for good luck. 

For under 10 bucks you can get a little piece of Philly. I'm getting hungry writing this
author: Robert M.

description:
It was a good sandwich.  Nothing super amazing, but it reminded me of home.  Just a normal old sandwich joint that seems so hard to find here in the city.  No I dont want avocado on my sandwich... just some grease and cheese.  Thank you!

I also loved the fact that they had Tasty Kakes!!! mmmmm butterscotch krimpets!

I would go back
author: Vinny M.

description:
Cheese steaks are my thing.  90% of the time I eat healthy; salads, soups, etc.  But when I have a caloric splurge, I need it to be top knotch.  
Unfortunately the Cheesesteak shop fell short of my expectations.  I got a 7'' mushroom cheesesteak with the sweet peppers and onions.  
It arrived in a matter of minutes, cut in half.  The meat was not the usual larger strips of meat but rather paltry, small chunks.  Same goes for the onions and mushrooms that were seemingly sparse due to their diminutive size.  
Though it was tasty, the service friendly, I like to have a bit more subsidence in my philly cheese steak.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
I will admit it... I'm not from Philly. And I don't like Cheez Whiz that much. Thankfully, this place uses doesn't use the Whiz by default. Other than that, I think they make a terrific cheese steak... whether it's "authentic" or not, I'll let the Philadelphians argue while I enjoy my sandwich (steak with mushrooms, sometimes sweet peppers).  They also have some of the best onion rings.  

This does get close to hole-in-the-wall status.  The dining room is unassuming, and the bathrooms seem very prison-esque.

Oh yes, they apparently fly in their bread daily from PA.
author: Johnny N.

description:
Love Love Love this place!!!  Don't forget your frequent buyer card... I believe you can get a free sub if you fill out your card.  The fries are great, the cheese steak are great (I had the chicken with mushroom)...mmmm mmmm....  The flavors and textures were right... as if the cheesesteak just wants to make love with my tongue...

did I say mmmmm?
author: Grace M.

description:
As the 314th person to review this place, I'll have to give it the big thumbs up.  My experience with cheese steaks on the west coast has been very boom/bust, and here I found nice, soft bread, smoothly shredded steak, and light cheese.  Order took under 10 minutes so can't complain there, but might wanna call ahead if you live in the area.

Word of caution - they'll throw a few jalapenos on by default, which might not be for everybody.  I love em, but made the mistake of brushing my eye right after eating.  Owwwww
author: John H.

description:
You want a philly cheese steak that taste like the ones from Philadelphia? I know that the likes of Jim's, Pat's, and Gino's(for you Philly folks)  isn't around but hey, the Cheese Steak Shop is the closest thing to it.  

A nice little restaurant off Divisadero, Cheese Steak Shop offers a good amount of 'steaks that's freshly made and messy as it should be.   They offer simply the basic cheesesteaks like the mushroom steak and BBQ steak(which is my fav.). The 'steaks take about five minutes to make depending on the number of customers waiting for theirs.  When you get that 'steak, just almost like cheesesteak heaven, which seems like a place to eat as well!!!

The restaurant displays pictures from Philly including the numerous cheesesteaks places.  Besides that, the place isn't overly spectacular but is doesn't have be since that 'steaks is all you need to know over there.  

Their slogan is "Caution: May Be Habit Forming!!!."  I think that's true because I want one right now!!!!
author: Kris A.

description:
I eat here more than I should. But that's because it's just down the street from my house.

I refuse to carry my frequent diner card... though the idea of getting a free sandwich is appealing, I don't really want any additional incentives to go here. Really, I should get off my lazy ass and travel to get a good cheesesteak.

The curly fries are pretty good though. It's a nice touch. Oh and they have a chicken option which isn't half bad.
author: Rhett G.

description: Cheese Steak Hoagie with onions and sweet peppers. Definitely habit forming.
author: K L.

description:
this place isn't for you if you are carb watching, calorie counting or vegan loving.  if you want a good cheesesteak that tastes like it came from the east coast this is the place to go.  i usually go with the 10 inch king philly with onion rings and a tasty cake and i am one happy foodie! 

pros:  GREAT COMFORT STYLE FOOD especially when you go all out, good seating, and i love the guys there :)  

cons: location.  if you go on a busy bad day, parking isn't ideal also this place can get packed, but then again that negates itself as a con because it's packed for a reason obviously.  

yes, habit forming!
author: Daniella J.

description:
I grew up just outside Philadelphia, I go back to Philly to visit quite frequently, and yet The Cheese Steak Shop in San Francisco still rates as the best cheese steak I've ever had.  Ignore those fools who tell you not to try the pizza steak -- it's all about the pizza steak, if you ask me.  Flavorful meat, real Amoroso's rolls flown in from Philly, even the staff is authentically Philadelphian with that slightly rough edge.  I've also tried the sister restaurants in Berkeley and Pleasanton, and both keep it real.

The Cheese Steak Shop has the best cheese steaks in the Bay Area, easily, and possibly even the best in the nation.
author: Marco C.

description:
3.5 stars (when will yelp do a half star system?)

$6.81. I do believe I am having the cheapest meal in SF ever. 

I even said this to the cashier. He laughed. 

What does this meager amount of money get you? 
1. one small (7") mushroom cheesesteak
2. one small order of fries

Was I full? Yes. Could I eat more? Yes, but I'm a piggy. I wasn't stuffed full. I didn't feel like I ate a brick of meat and would regret it in the morning (sorry cube mates). 

Food: (4) Very good. The bread was a soft, gooey mixture with the cheese and the soft meat. Yes, that's two "softs", but it wasn't like I was an  old man eating wet food. The bread was soft and the meat was tender and tasty. The cheese was the salty bridge to melt the two together. Very good. I got the steak fries. Twist my arm, but if it's a choice between fat potato fries and extra tasty curly fries, I'll take the taste of potato over the taste of delicious batter. Good fries, but I wish I had some ranch. That would have made it perfect. 

Sorry I didn't take pictures of my food. I'm not quite sure how you people have the will power to not devour good food instantly. But I did take out. This allowed time for the cheese and bread and steak to melt together a little longer. Yum. My dog agrees - time and eating in front of her allows her to have some food and allowed the flavors to mix better (she told me this in a sequence of barks and whimpers). 

One complaint, it was messy. Not sure what produced the wetness - I guess the steak - but it became quite messy in it's foil clothing. 

Atmosphere: (2) This is a cheese steak place. It has tables and chairs and I think that's all you can ask for. The cashier was nice and if you stand in the right place you can see them grilling up your sandwich. It took them a bit of time to make my small-ish cheesesteak and I felt a bit bad for my pooch that was waiting outside. 

Price: (4) Did I mention my meal was $6.81? I'm still in shock over this. I guess if you add a drink you might get to 8 bucks. 

Over all 3.5. I would like a little more in my cheesesteak. I guess I could be a major pig and be the only girl ordering the large size. Hm....
author: Tray I.

description:
My girlfriends and I went here today after we got a massage.  All the restaurants around were closed because of the Bay to Breakers.  This place got packed.

I ordered a 7 inch mushroom and cheese steak sandwich.  Yes, it was good, but I don't think it was anything special or to die for.  I ordered the deep fried mushrooms.  My friends thought they were good; I thought they were just ok.  The curly fries were delicious though.
author: Victoria R.

description:
You know the way Homer drools after someone mentions some good ass food? That is now what my reaction will be when someone says The Cheese Steak Shop.

Fresh, flavorful, and delicious. The prices are beyond fair, too. Bought a 15 inch so I have leftovers for tomorrow!
author: Shaddie J.

description: Nothing too special about this place and I expected larger portions. If you do order from here, make sure to get at least the 10 inch sandwich or you'll leave hungry. Satisfies the philly cheesesteak craving but would rather drive to a better spot than come back here.
author: Mel R.

description: I love this place. Its been in its present location for over 31 years.  The slogan  " maybe habit forming" is right. I could eat those Cheese Steaks , till there coming out my ears.  The place is small and casual , you go for the cheese stakes not the atmosphere. Try going before noon or after 1 otherwise you will have to wait a bit. But its worth waiting.
author: Susie S.

description:
4 stars if you disregard the chaotic service.  Went here for lunch with a couple of co-workers.  Dropped them off and circled around looking for parking. Was worried I'd missed out on the hot sandwhiches, so coughed up $3.00 for parking, only to find out they were still waiting for the order.  Apparently the guy at the counter was senile and has problems taking orders.  Massive confusion.  The ended up not giving me my fries.

The cheese steaks were good, though.  Very basic - cheese, meat on a soft sandwhich.  And the PEPPERS.  The peppers really give the sandwhiches that extra piquancy.
author: Tinou B.

description:
An excellent Philly Cheese steak spot:
Cheese Steak with Whole Garlic = WOW + stank breath (oh well)!

It is 2 steps above Jay's Cheese Steaks. Do call ahead of time and order via telephone to avoid the long wait especially during the lunch time hours (11-1).
author: ronzilla x.

description:
First of all, they have not 1 veggie sandwich, but 2! And they are actually different from each other - not just same ingredients listed in a different order. We had one of each and loved them both. 

Of course we got the twisted fries. Always spring the extra for curly fries. They were fried to perfection here and after my Ploy experience, I no longer underestimate the ability to properly deep fry.

I also noticed how clean the place was, especially given how messy the food can be. Nice to see a place that's on top of things, even when it's a casual joint. Did I mention our dinner was $11?

I also want to rave about their fountain drink machine. First off, I rarely even get a fountain drink when that's the only option (can I get a cup for water?) bc the ratio of syrup and carbonation is always off. It ruins my fun with a beverage I shouldn't be drinking and then I wind up wasting calories on something I didn't even want.

My man loves the FD. He proceeded with his Big Gulp size cup and brought back... Dr Pepper! This is a rare find in these parts. I was enticed to take a sip. Lo and behold - it was the best FD I've ever had. Cold, crisp and Dr Peppery. Excellent!!!!
author: Shal J.

description:
Yes, I was here during the noon hour but it took 30 minutes from when I got in line until I received my sandwich. If you only have an hour lunch break that doesn't leave much time to eat and get back to work (and potty, reapply lipstick, etc).
I don't mind waiting for good food (and it was good ) but what I do mind is when the person running the counter appears to be dinking around and is not interested in breaking a sweat to get his job done. He certainly wasn't going to do anything at any sort of break-neck speed. The two making the sandwiches however were great, and also made a great sandwich (wasn't their fault they were told I ordered peppers when I really ordered onions, which I'll never let happen again since the onions have an icky pickly taste to them). No ambience whatsoever so I don't know why everyone wasn't getting it to go?
author: Sara B.

description:
Okay so I heard from a few people that this is the place for cheese steaks in SF.  Also been told that it's better than Gambinos (which I personally love).  What can I say, besides the fact that it's a hole in the wall and when I went the clinetelle as well.. lack luster, the cheese steaks are great! You should also take into consideration that I had the worst stomach ache EVER when I ate here.  And even still, I loved it.

Would I go back? Absolutely.
author: Serge S.

description:
After a year of going to Jake's Steaks on Buchanan and Lombard I decided to venture out in search of a better cheesesteak. I was told by my boyfriend that I had been missing out on the best place in San Francisco for a cheesesteak. When we pulled up to the Cheese Steak Shop I laughed, the place was pretty grundgy looking and kinda stunk inside. I went up to the counter order some cheese friends and my cheesesteak sandwhich and waited for a bit, it was a pretty busy late afternoon and boy was it worth the wait!!!! It was hot, full of meat , mushrooms and cheese and the bread is really good. I highly recommend this place to anyone who has a love of a real cheesesteak, you even get a frequent buyer punchcard.

Needless to say Jake's steaks is no longer my cheesesteak place... =P
author: Lisette E.

description:
I grew up on The Cheese Steak Shop in Concord. My family was fervently against vegetables or food that may have been healthy in any way, shape or form. It was the white trash way.

I've been to several of The Cheese Steak Shop locations in the bay area and have to say, as a certified member of the white trash kinship, the SF location is junk food at it's finest. I'm all about the 15" chicken n' cheese w/ onions no peppers.
author: Ricky J.

description:
oh my, i cant believe i recognized this place. 
I have been here ONCE about three years ago, and i swear i remember how good this place is!! 

I love love this place. and I cannot wait to go back to San Francisco (when and if i do) and go again!! 

5 stars for what i remember was the tastiest philly cheesesteak in the bay, hopefully it still tastes as good!!
author: Sarah C.

description:
I thought this place was good but not terrific.  It might of been due to my best friend hyping it up so big. If you like soft philly cheese steaks, then you might love this place.  The cheese was gooey (maybe I should of gotten a different type of cheese) but the meat just didn't have that OOMPH to it. I've been there twice and although it was good, the flavor just didn't get to me.  I guess the initial taste of softness just really didn't have my palette anticipating anything more.

Everything tasted a little too soft and spongey for me. I like a little crispness somewhere.

I would of gave 4 stars but I been there twice (between a 4 month time span) and it smells like pee.  The last time I went was September of 2007 and it has this HORRIBLE and I MEAN HORRIBLE Urine stench (I think from the homeless people).  The first time we thought it was just a bum who made his way in but months later.. the second time we went.. we came right when the shop opened in the morning and it still smelled like pee.

I had the 10" mushroom and split with my friend (better value that way).

I really liked the Yellow Submarine shop on Fifth near UCSF a little better.
author: K D.

description:
until visiting this establishment, i've never had a cheese steak.  - - quite hard to believe, given my affinity to dishes bestowed upon us by the greasy gods.

first impression?
gritty and juiceless.

(and i believe that i had consumed some alcohol beforehand.  ...says something if my boozy stomach didn't even like it.)

'this can't be an accurate representation of a philly cheese steak,' i thought.

fortunately, after this experience, i had a tasty cheese steak (at a restaurant in chicago) that lived up to its name.
author: Ting A.

description: Adore this place. Kinda run-down inside but the food is sooo good! The service is usually fast and friendly as well.
author: Raychul M.

description:
Want a cheese steak?  Know what a cheese steak is supposed to taste like?  Go here.

The bread is right.  The meat is quality.  The cheese is cheesy.  The fries are good too, but that's not really what we're here for.

Let me put it this way.  I only go to other cheese steak places when the Cheese Steak Shop is closed.
author: Mad S.

description: the wait here can be bad at times, but the sandwiches here are pretty good. the atmosphere isnt great and parking can be a hassle but nothing beats a 15-inch philly cheese steak to regain the calories lost after saturday morning practice. You can also call in ahead of time (to go order) and pick it up to avoid the lines.
author: Robert Y.

description: This place is great! I went there for the first time today and I had high expectations because my friend was raving about how great it was. I don't eat too many Philly cheese steak sandwiches but for some reason, they were just sounding extra great today! I had the original 7" cheese steak sandwich and it was oh-so good! It was the perfect portion for me. They have choices of 7", 10", and 15" ... so depending on how hungry you are ... it's perfect! The staff was pretty friendly, they looked pretty clean (they got a 100 on their inspection) ... and overall I had a pretty good (although, short) experience. I can't wait to go again! (:
author: Chrisy Y.

description: Just finished my sandwich. Pretty good. Got what I expected for less than I expected truthfully. I was pleasantly surprised when they only asked for $7 and change in exchange for a 10" sandwich. It wasn't the biggest 10" sandwich but It was by no means skimpy either. Ordered to-go and even though the meat was juicy the bread didn't get all soggy!!!
