I don't know if I just got lucky but the cheese was on the bottom of the sandwich protecting the bread from absorbing too much liquid. Nice... Their slogan might end up being true. This might be habit forming. Bonus points for having a frequent buyer card.
author: Jack S.

description:
Well, its been my general experience that San Francisco is not the best place in the world to get a cheese steak.  And while I have found an exception, The Cheese Steak Shop is not it.  I walked into this place for the first time when I was in the neighborhood checking out a room to live in, and have tried it once more since then.  Both times were basically the same experience: Meh.  
My least favorite part of their cheese steaks is the bun which is small, squishy, and tastes recently defrosted.  The meat both times was overdone and rather chewy, and the whole sandwich itself struck me as small and forgettable.  If you order peppers on your cheese steak prepare to get a soggy, canned-peppers sandwich with a bit of meat and cheese on it.
Some of my roomies swear by this place, which I find strange since Pete's Deli, right across the street, serves up what I believe to be the best cheese steak in town!  A 10 inch cheese steak at The Cheese Steak Shop is considerably smaller than a 7 inch at Pete's, due to the small crappy bun and skimpy meat portions.
All in all I see no reason to go back to this place except the curly fries, which are delicious.  Problem is that Pete's isn't open on Sunday, which, come football season, means I won't be able to get a good cheese steak and watch the game.  But I digress; The Cheese Steak Shop is overrated at best, and the only "habit" I'm "forming" is walking right past it.
author: Sam C.

description:
The first Philly cheesesteak I can remember eating was at The Cheesesteak Shop.  Despite never having had one before, I knew the moment I bit into the oozing gooey sandwich that I had fallen in love for life.  And I don't even like cheese that much!  Since then I've eaten quite a few phillies at other restaurants but I always come back to this place because they are simply the best.  In my case, the first one was definitely the right one. ;)

The bread is buttery soft and fresh and just right.  I always get the mushroom cheesesteak and the meat/cheese/mushroom combo is the perfect combination of salty/creamy/fatty goodness.  On regular days I get the 7", hungry days the 10" is required.  The 15" is appropriate for large construction workers, sharing, or another delicious meal later in the day.  The steak fries are good but the curly fries are better.  Make sure you get a frequent buyer card (it's free!) to hasten your slide into addiction.  That reminds me...I have a full card which means I've earned a free philly!  So please excuse me for cutting this review short and leaving now...I've got a date with a really hot...sandwich. ;)
author: Helen T.

description:
Seriously, this place is going to kill me. I'm pretty sure I can feel my heart slowing after I eat one of these things but, but, BUT DAMN I CAN'T STOP! 

Best cheesesteak I've had, period. They even come in three sizes; 7 inch (lame-o), 10 inch (admirable) and 15 inch! (awesomely awesome). The only thing that makes a 15 inch cheesesteak better is bacon. Yes, that's right, they got you covered. I

They even have a member card! 12 stamps gets you a free 10 incher!

'm not responsible for any health issues that spring up from a cheesesteak habit. I'm just sayin'.
author: Andy A.

description:
I like these cheesesteaks better than most of the ones I've had in Philly, including ones from Pat's and Geno's.  Maybe I just prefer chopped steak to steak-ums.  I'm not a whiz guy either so I guess I'm not a purist.  The Philly Cheese Steak Shop is hands down the best cheesesteak joint I've been to in the bay area.

10" spinach and mushroom cheesesteak w/ onions, ketchup, and mayo.  side of twister fries, please.
author: Kumar D.

description:
OMG OMG OMG

THE BEST SANDWICH IN THE WORLD!!!

I ALWAYS get the chicken w/ mushrooms that comes on a soft roll with sauteed onions, white american cheese...AND THATS IT!!!

SOOOO GOOD!!!

Best hangover food of all time.
author: Keila E.

description:
Phillie Cheesesteak Shop on Divis offers a very tasty, greasy steak, just as it should be.  I'm a Cali girl, so can't speak for the authenticity of the steak, though others have.  I do know they import Tasty Kakes and Amoroso's rolls from Phillie-- that's hardcore.  

I know what I like and this is GOOD.  Try the pepper cheesesteak for a spicy change of pace.The Onion Rings are also excellent and the frequency card will keep you coming back for more, with one box stamped for every $6 spent, they stack up fast and are a godsend on the day before payday.  The free steaks just seem to taste better, yaknow?

Parking here is a problem.  Consider walking to defray the caloric cost of your cheesesteak.  Otherwise bring a getaway driver.  The parking-in-a-bus-stop ticket will cost you an arm and a leg, so don't do it.  Be sure to phone it in so you can skate smugly to the head of the line.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
CSS Employee : What can I get you?

I : Lemme get a philly cheesesteak, a 10 incher.

CSS Employee : Grilled onions? Hot and/or Sweet Peppers?

I : Just grilled onions, no peppers...add an order of large steak fries with that!

CSS Employee : Blah Blah Blah....*gives receipt*


Holy shit.  This was good.  Not best in the world good, but good enough that after having my first one here 3 days ago, I've had one everyday since.  I've never had what some call an authentic philly steak using cheese wiz, but why would I? Real cheese or cheese wiz, hmmm give me a minute to think about it. 

00m:59s

00m:58s

Uhh...real cheese pleese!
The cheesesteaks here have a great balance of bread to meat to melty cheesey ratio.  The queso is a warm ooey & gooey goodness bringing the whole artery-clogging choleterol-filling experience together. The onions are in nice little slivers cooked down nice and mixed in with the RrRReeEeDddeadD MeeEeaAttTt.  Don't be fooled by the length of the sandwiches you have to choose from... they're on the smaller side diameter wise but still super filling.  I'm just glad I have to go out of my way to come here otherwise Cheesesteak shop's going to post my picture as customer of the year on the wall.

They have this slogan in big print in front of the store...wise guys.

"CAUTION : MAY BE HABIT FORMING!"

I guess they gave me a fair warning...

BTW the fries were perfect too.
author: Eric W.

description:
Yes, it is a REAL cheese steak. Amaroso rolls and tastykakes!!! Come on, we grew up eating those super chocolate'y cakes!

The only complaint I have, is that over the years, the sandwiches seem to get smaller, and more expensive. Maybe it's my appetite growing? Not sure. I can reason that gas is rising, and I grew, so maybe it is just me.  Oh yes, Why not offer cheese whiz on the sandwich? Ugh!!!

I never order fries, or anything else here. I always just get the sandwich.

The place is usually packed, so do yourself a favor, and order ahead of time.

It's not the cleanest place in the world, but it's not the worst. It's SF'ish.

Well, you know where to find the best cheese steaks in SF. Just don't expect any cheese whiz on your sandwich (-1 star for that).
author: Charles K.

description:
Some of us at work were hungry for something "different" than the usual places we frequent.  I did a little searching on Yelp, and finally settled on The Cheese Steak Shop.  

All of us except one got the 10 incher....I personally got the 10 incher with mushrooms, American cheese, grilled onions, and the sweet/hot pepper mix.  It took about 5 minutes to get my order, and it was served up piping hot in a tasty roll (which I hear they bring in from Philly).  

I thought the pepper mix was a unique taste and went well with the meat.  The meat itself was tender and suprisingly not overbearingly greasy.

I was the only one that got curly fries, and I thought they were much better than the regular steak fries.

Overall, I very much liked the sandwich, but didn't LOOOOVE it.  All of us thought the sandwich could have come with a little more meat, and a quick survey revealed we all could have easily polished off the 15 incher.  Maybe we are just fat asses, I am not sure.  =)

I would definitely come back, but I don't know if I would crave this.  I am going to try other cheese steak places and compare them.
author: Wade Y.

description:
Everyone kept telling me this place was the bomb. Even some skinny little girls that I didn't think would be the type to eat such greasy ghetto food. Authentic? Who cares? It WAS the bomb. I got the regular 10" Philly steak with onions, sweet, and hot peppers. The grease was dripping all over the plate and I was slurping up all of it.

One thing was suspicious though. Their health inspection card said 96 points. If that's 96 out of 100 then they must have known what day the inspector was coming and it wasn't the day I went in. If it was 96 out of 300 then I can understand but I didn't care. I turned a blind eye to the greasy tables and crumb laden floors and I enjoyed my sandwich.
author: Hunter G.

description:
This review is for their chicken cheese steaks, which I feel are the best I've had outside Philadelphia, where I went to college.  The chicken is totally chopped up into miniscule pieces - just like I remember it - and they even use Amoroso bread.  I agree with other Yelpers that the sandwiches could use more meat, but still... they have the perfect balance of bread, meat, onions, cheese, and grease.  

If you've never eaten a cheese steak, you'll probably wonder what the big deal is after you've tried it.  Think of it as east coast comfort food.
author: ML P.

description:
Get cheese fries and a regular cheesesteak. You're set.

Service is pretty slow, but it's a better value than Jay's and doesn't come cluttered with a salad stuffed between you and that delicious, thinly sliced beef.

Not totally traditional, but, hey, nothing is in California. Still, really tasty and reasonably priced. I'm feeeeeeelin' it, man!
author: Cameron O.

description: being from the philadelphia area, it is hard to find a place that makes good cheesesteaks. little did i know that visiting san francisco i would find a place that is as close to home as i can get. this place has great cheesesteaks using the classic amorosa rolls that are great for cheesesteaks. definitely a huge fan of this place and truly recommend it. close to 5 stars (typically reserve that for places in philly).
author: Anish P.

description: I've been here a few times and the cheese steak sammys were good but not great! I've had better in the mall, you know where I'm talking about! If not read my next review.
author: Karen T.

description: This place certainly deserves the word "The" before its name. Some seriously yummy cheese steaks. I go for the one with marinara and some curly fries. This place certainly satisfies one's craving for a sandwich of deliciousness made up of meat, cheese and bread. I swear somehow it makes the soda taste better too. Great for a lunchtime sandwich, plus the decor is awesome.
author: Rebecca D.

description: Yesterday I wanted to settle this once and for all. I compared both Jakes and the Cheese Steak Shops sandwiches. And the winner clearly is CSS. I wish I had more time to write a more clever review but don't have time. Perhaps later.
author: Kato D.

description:
Pathetic. With a capital P.
Granted- I'm from Philly, and we transplants can be kind of picky about our cheesesteaks.  And I've definately had much worse. That being said-
Pathetic.

The meat was good- chopped up nice, decent amount of cheese and onions.  But not nearly enough of it.  I shouldn't be left with empty bun at the end.  
And about that bun- are you kidding me?  Really?  I don't care if it's authentic Amoroso's- it was miniture like a hot dog bun.  Seriously.  Really?
If you're gonna serve a 7" cheesesteak, get a full size hoagie roll and slice it in half.  And put some more meat in it for god's sake.

I've been here before and wasn't impressed, but I was in the neighborhood and starving.  Quite frankly, I should have walked the 20 blocks to Jake's.
author: Danielle I.

description: Oh. my. I have been there like 45354 times since I first discovered this place...which was like a couple weeks ago lol. Delicious..not so nutritious =)
author: Dana S.

description: Best cheese steaks in town, hands down.  The staff is very nice and the food is just delicious.
author: Eric W.

description:
this place never gets old!!! Love the customer service and the quality.. 

only receive 4 stars because the place likes to close 30mins early prior to the closing time  ;(
author: LoLa L.

description:
I had this dream, it was about this dish that combined five of my favorite things....

1. Steak
2. Cheese
3. Peppers
4. Mushrooms
5. Bread

I then woke to find that this does exit - At the Cheese Steak Shop. 

(that covers most of the food groups-right?)
author: Julia P.

description:
Before we talk about how good the cheese steaks are, and they are very good, this place pins the sports page to its side wall. it's like when you decide to get the skirt steak over a comparable entree, solely based on the side dish.  This is universal and can't be disputed. 

Call ahead and order your steak: Especially during lunch hour. You can wait up to 15 minutes for a sandwich cuz there's a ton of traffic, so if you call ahead you'll avoid the waiting time. But if you don't, never fear as the aforementioned walled sports page gives you something to read while waiting. 

Taste: If you've had a lot of cheese steaks, and I have, this one just tastes more hearty. I go to Philly for work a ton and get them there all the time, and I'd put this one up against anything  Philly has to offer. Keep in mind I am from Oregon though and not the East Coast.
author: Colin C.

description:
The cheese steaks are amazing and the staff is great. They keep giving me those stamp cards and I keep collecting them. It almost seems wrong to use them when the food is this good. I order the chicken with onions, no peppers, and regular cheese. And then...drum roll please...I order double the fillings. 

My cheese steak never makes it home. I drive and eat at the same time. Undignified, I know, but completely understandable if you ever eaten one. The curly fries are good but I double have much room left after the double-filling.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Relatively good, the cheese was mixed melted pretty good with the meat.

I'm not from Philadelphia, but how I like my cheesesteaks are cheesy mixed into the folds of the beef matched by a light airy roll.  Some onions here and there and that's it.  

It's not the best I've had, but it's the best around the area...so far.  

I don't really like the hot jalapenos in the sandwich, I like'em purely steak, cheese and onions.  I'm a purist at heart and never was much into the addition of multiple things.  I like my steaks with just salt and pepper, and my fries with salt.  Maybe ranch with tabasco.  

I'm still waiting on Calvins in San jose, supposedly was a legend back when I was a baby, but...legends often are better in the past then when they return.
author: Kevin C.

description:
I have family in Philadelphia, and I go back there about once a year. Each week-long visit entails several trips to various cheese steak shops: Pats, Geno's, Pizza City, etc. They're good. But they're not...

The Cheese Steak Shop

This grungy little place on Divisadaro serves the best cheese steak I have ever had, hands down. They import the Amoroso rolls (the mark of an authentic Philly steak), the meat (east coast cows have a different kind of fat than their west coast sisters), and the Tastykake snack cakes that you will be unable to eat after finishing your cheese steak. That's because you will not back down, and you will order the 15". Grilled onions and hot peppers on the side is my personal favorite, although the pizza steak and chicken steak are also winners. Get some root beer in a bottle as well, its a good combo.

On another note, the atmosphere of the place is about on par with McDonalds. But you came for the heart-stopping greasy goodness that is San Francisco's greatest cheese steak. It's next to Mt. Zion hospital for a reason.
author: Jackson G.

description:
Stamps, stamps, and more stamps. 
Tuesday- double stamp day.
mmmmmmm.... i just realized I'm reviewing this on a Tuesday... uh oh. 
Wednesday is half off sides... oh who cares?
I would pay full price for all of it double stamps or not. 
The staff is awesome, and the food is AMAZING. 
I love this place, and I will not turn my back on it ever, in fact my wedding will one day be catered by the cheese steak shop.
author: Jessica O.

description:
The ultimate in Cheesesteakery goodness!

If you are having a corporate party, call in the morning and order a bunch of sandwiches and be a true hero. Just make sure to get your card stamped for all of them! :)
author: Chris B.

description:
Far and away better than all of the competition, especially that cheese steak place in the Marina, blakes or fakes, whatever.

Anyway, the curly fries here are amazing, and you don't have to pay extra for every little thing you want to add to your sandwich.

I must agree, this place is indeed habit forming.
author: Oliver D.

description: Juicy, tender chopped up steak, mushrooms and peppers! What more can you ask for? Absolutely delicious! Also had the curly fries, onion rings and corn fritters. I love this place and can't wait to go back!
author: HENRY M.

description:
i've tried all there cheese steaks and i'm definitely a fan.

they have specials...i think it goes like this.  

buy three get on free on wednesdays.

on tuesdays and sundays, if you buy a cheesesteak you get a double stamp on your card towards a free cheese steak.

its a bit greasy but thats how a real philly style cheese steak is supposed to be.

i've fallen in love with their onion rings for some reason to go with the cheese steak...and of all the cheese steaks i'll always get the regular with the sweet peppers.  I never used to do the pepper thing but this place changed me FOREVER.

the other thing i always order is the pizza cheese steak.  i love the sauce the have for it and for dipping the onion rings.

if you don't like greasy don't come here because when you walk in you can feel the grease in the air.  the thing is, i haven't gained a pound in here.  i don't feel bloated or feel my skin stretch as i eat.  this place FEELS 100% HEALTHY.  So what can i say?  If it doesn't make you feel bad, why not eat it?
author: Bing D.

description:
Good spot. I wasn't amazed but I wasn't disappointed. The cheese steak I ordered was pretty solid and its obvious the food is pretty fresh because they're cooking it up for you right there and then and not serving up stuff that's been hanging out for awhile.  With that comes a bit of a wait - so don't make the same mistake I did and skimp on the parking meter.  Ouch.

I plan to go back again when I'm craving some steak, cheese and peppers on a toasty roll.  If you're really hungry, order more than the 7incher because they skimp a bit on the steak.
author: Miss M G.

description: If craving for greasy food this is the place to load some calories, but it's really good. Don't forget to ask for the yellow frequent card and get it stamped so you can get a free sandwich.
author: Albert F.

description:
Very disappointing!  I've wanted to try this place for years after hearing so many glowing reviews that it was the best - even saw it featured on a show on the Food Network once.  

Let's put it this way, I can make a better, and cheaper cheese steak at home with some Steak-Umm and Soft rolls from Safeway and definitely get more than a child's size portion of meat.  

It looked as if they had left plenty of room on my sandwich for the  toppings that I did not order.  I don't want peppers or any of that, just some more meat to go with my huge roll of bread.

I'd contemplated going out of my way several times to make a trip here - and I mean out of my way since I do not have a car and would have to take a cab or bus - I am glad that I did not.  

If you are looking for a sandwich that will fill you up, don't come here, you will be disappointed. Something tells me that people who are willing to eat cheese steaks, in all their fattening and greasy glory, are not concerned so much with portion control so pile on the meat already - I want to make my indulgence worthwhile!
author: Cynthia H.

description:
God I love this place!!

the meat on the Philly cheese steak is shredded just right not chewy like other places I've tried. The peppers on the sandwich are on the sweet side and not too spicy.  Love their curly fries and their humorous cooks.Even after your full and while driving back home, you start thinking I should have bought another one for lunch tomorrow. Mouth watering already while typing in this review. Only disappointment is they don't have one in daly city or south san francisco.
author: Arthur C.

description:
Hi, this is my first review of Yelp! :)

Some of my friends who are also on yelp has already tried this place and they really enjoyed it, and they kept encouraging me to go and try it with them, and to no surprise, after their really good compliments, it was very good.

The overall taste was really good, nicely melted cheese, not overdosed, great amount of steak, and big pieces of peppers, the only thing that was not perfect for me is the size of the grilled onion, therefore a 4 star, because compared to all the other ingredients, the grilled onion is nearly invisible, if the grilled onions was a little bit bigger in piece size, it would've received a 5.

The last time I had a good Philly Cheese steak this good was about 4 years ago, I don't even remember where I got that one. So I recommend anyone that have not tried this place out yet, you'll get your money's worth! 

Thank you for reading!
author: Billy L.

description:
I'm glad people love the cheesesteak, but folks should know that the BBQ chicken sandwhich is also very good. 

I love the fact that you can order extra meet and that the sandwhiches come in three sizes.
author: Bay G.

description: This is a good place to go if you like to eat greasy cheese steak sandwiches. The mushroom philly is my favorite. The steak fries are a must have when eating any sandwich from here. The service here is fast and friendly.
author: Marty M.

description: The best cheese steak I have ever had.  Totally killer.  The ambiance is completely lacking, but who cares?
author: Patrick B.

description: I can't give it the full 5 stars because I'm not addicted to their cheese steaks as the slogan might suggest you become. It's a very good cheese steak that could use a little more cheese and a little more steak. I appreciate an imbalanced ratio of meat & cheese to my roll. Speaking of their roll, their bread is really good. It's the right texture and softness. One of the best places for cheesesteak, just not quite a grand slam of a place.
author: Arick R.

description:
This is really a working man's kinda place.  The moving van guys are here, folks from the local hospitals (one guy came in with a stethoscope draped over his neck and picked up 7 sandwiches to the tune of $76), construction workers, etc.  I thought I'd stray from the main road and try a chicken Philly cheese this time and it was very good.  I shouldn't have told the guy to leave out the peppers because the grilled onions alone didn't feel like enough vegts were in the sandwich. 
The Amoroso soft rolls were just great and each sandwich is wrapped in foil, followed by a paper wrap to keep it doubly warm, all the way home.
Seriously a 7"  sandwich ($3.99-$4.69) is NOT enough but I was trying to control myself.  You'd need at least a 10" ($6.19-$6.59) to feel satiated.  And if meat is what you desire, you can "King" it for an additional $2 for more meat and cheese.  Or, you can pick up a 15" ($9.19-$10.79). 

They ran out of their frequent buyer cards and hope to get a stock in soon, but will stamp your receipt so that next time they'll transfer it onto the card.  I wish they would remodel the place 'tho.  The dine-in facility is gross and I swore as I sat there waiting for my sandwiches, it smelled like a urine-stained stairwell until they started cooking up a bunch of sandwiches and the malodorous stench was covered up.  Take-out is the way to go.
author: Ry T.

description: Not much to say here, other then that this place is the best Cheese steak sandwich shop you'll eat outside of Philly.  I recommend the cheese steak hogie, with double meat.  Enjoy!
author: Brian B.

description: Cheese steak is pretty good, but I've had better.  I ordered the battered mushrooms and waited about 5 minutes for it to cool off and then as I bit into one, HOT OIL popped out and burned my lip!  Ruined my day!  But cheesesteak was ok, i wish it wasn't sooo watery.
author: Joseph C.

description: 7" mushroom & spinach cheesesteak w/ extra sweet peppers :) I love love love this place, no doubt, very habit forming-- actually it sets a standard for cheesesteaks-- I decided to write this review because i just tried Phat Phillys last night @ mission and i can tell you now, other than the tastykakes, everything @ Phat was mediocre--- I am even more confident now that this place is the best to get cheesesteak-- BTW-- even cold these yumster and the best you can find... TRUST :)
author: Shirlene M.

description:
Update 5-2-08

I understand this is a fast food restaurant and not fine dining but the employees could be a little friendlier.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I've never tried anything other than the philly cheese steak sandwich.  So worth the long ass lunch line wait and clogged arteries!
author: C C.

description: being from philly, this is tough.  it is one of the best i've had out here.  i still think i prefer jake's steaks.  definitely a good sandwich though.  good stuff.  and they're friendly and fast.
author: Hammer Time H.

description: The BEST Philly Cheese Steak around...ive been lookin and nothing compares...just try it...you'll never give it up =]
author: Sarah F.

description: They do not lie - VERY HABIT FORMING! Love the sandwiches here. Very tasty, not too greasy (Phat Philly). The only reason I give them a 4 is the parking kinda sucks, and there can be a mad line, but totally worth it! The chicken mushroom is very good as well as the other cheese steaks. Take advantages of their daily coupons and promos. Keep up the good cookin'!!
author: Allison A.

description: Filthy inside, boring 1980s decor.  Great variety of steaks and excellent fries.  Love the amoroso rolls.  Sandwiches come in 3 sizes to suit your hunger status.  Excellent fries.
author: Dong T.

description: I hate both Geno's & Pats so I might not be the best critic for cheese steaks but this chain always seems to work for me. It reminds me more of the steak-um sandwiches of my youth than of Philadelphia but there's nothing wrong with that ;)
author: Heather P.

description: Okay, we're going to ease them back to their former status if subsequent trips prove as satisfactory as this last one. I know I swore never to return, but I was right there, had a lapse of memory, and had placed my order before it all started coming back. However, I must say the portions have returned to their former standards and all-in-all the trip was worthwhile (even if I did just drop in instead of calling--that's my own fault, I know better).
author: Robert M.

description: I love you and your bacon philly!  YOur heart stopping, artery clogging, short breath inducing, diabolical, creation!
author: Spanky M.

description:
Their slogan that it may be habit forming is correct. I attended school nearby and since I tasted a bbq chicken (yes not beef!) cheesesteak, I have made it a point to always return there for a delicious meal. For a small shop their customer base has grown gigantic, resulting in the waiting times and delayed delivery. You can see why once you try the shop! Delicious sandwiches, great fries and friendly workers. Now if only they would move into a larger space!

The best tips I can give you are to save their stampcards, order on tuesday and order in advance. See if you can arrange to call half a hour in advance of the lunchtime rush and you'll enjoy a great sandwich just as you begin your lunch break. I have been to Philly and I can say that this is the closest San Francisco will get to a good philly cheesesteak.
author: Nick C.

description:
The cheese steak with garlic is AMAZING...in fact...HEAVENLY! The side of curly fries are fried just perfectly with a crispy outside and soft inside. Their slogan is " Caution: Might be habit forming" and if I didn't have to watch my figure or arteries, I'd be eating here all the time. I think I read that there are 1000 calories in the 15" and although it's horrible for you, their cheese steaks melt in your mouth and somehow, never leave you wanting just one.

Tuesdays are double stamp days and if you fill up a whole card, I believe you get a free cheese steak.

GO HERE if you live in SF.

PS. Their hot and sweet peppers are a must!!!
author: 3beeskitchen ..

description:
My bf and I were walking down Divisidero  to go to the UCSF Medical building and we saw a sign that read "Caution: May be Habit Forming" so we went to The Cheese Steak Shop and had lunch. I ordered the Zesty Vegetarian Sandwich and he had the Original Philly Steak. 
After having the luxury of eating at Ikes Place in SF and Busy Bee in Pedro, I'm a bit spoiled when it comes to sandwiches. This place has some huge shoes to fill. When we were eating the sandwiches, my bf looked at me and said "I'll stick to biting my nails" in reference to the habit forming sign posted out front. I'd have to agree.  The sandwiches are  smail and there's nothing special about this place.
author: Lucy G.

description: dee greatest fifteen-inch cheese steak wonders...order of original and sweet peppers....fantastic combination of cheese and sweet peppers loaded....toasty crunch roll split...loaded steak bite and bite...all glorious fifteen inches almost neverending joy....this once say that bigger is better....satisfying the fat kid inside...best california philly cheese steak experienced....munch of cheese steak and liquor store 33.9 oz. asahi can inside parked car....dining in dingy restaurant only before 9:30pm....
author: Hen A.

description: I really do love about 75% of this place. I love the rolls, and the cheesy, meaty goodness. I love the price. So what do I not love? I hate that they throw the peppers on it and you get tons on stems (gross), and I never feel this place is up par on cleanliness.......everything is old, outdated and all the tables and chairs are always sticky.
author: Adrienne G.

description:
This place is dope. Surely one of the first names you'll hear if you ask any SFer about cheese steaks. I have yet to try the other big ones, but its hard to imagine them being a whole lot better than this place. Their meat is tender and delicious (that's what she said) and the cheese is perfect, although on one recent trip I decided to try one without cheese and it was still good. My favorite part is the sweet peppers, which I would probably put on every sandwhich for the rest of my life if I had a choice.

The decor of the place is cool, exactly the type of place you would want to sit, chill, and fuckin eat a cheese steak. Very nice people working here. I live about a 5 minute walk from this place, so the only reason I don't come here more often is so as to avoid any heart problems that would surely entail. But, hypothetically, if I didn't give a damn about my health, I would no doubt be in here at least once a week. I meant that last part as a compliment.
author: Alex K.

description: Absolutely the best cheese steaks and italian grinders in the SF Bay Area, I thought I was back in Philly! If you are craving a birch beer and a tasty-cake prepare to be delighted they have those too. Now if they would only deliver.....
author: Maggie M.

description: this is indeed the best Cheese Steak Shop location in the entire Bay Area. i've been to several others in the South Bay, and it's just not the same as this one!
author: Ms. Good K.

description:
So Yelp asked me to update my review of Phat Philly, which I did, and then the Phat Philly folks complained that I was being biased what with my 2-star review, and said (I paraphrase) that if I like The Cheese Steak Shop so much why don't I review it?

I would give TCSS 5 stars but for 2 reasons:
1) No Whiz
2) Closes too early on Thurs-Fri-Sat.

Other than that, it's the best cheesesteak you'll find in California (and likely Oregon and Washington).  Amoroso rolls; the cooks are educated in how to make a proper cheesesteak; juicy without being a soppy mess; and their onions and peppers are the proper size for a good cheesesteak (chopped, not just sliced).

And the price is right.

So there.
author: peter s.

description:
Kumar, man.   Geno's and Pat's do not use steak-ums in their steaks.  That's hand-sliced ribeye!  The fact that you can't tell the difference makes your cheesesteak review quite suspect.

However, I will concur that the cheesesteaks at this place are pretty good and authentic for an average Philly cheesesteak.  Other than the quality of the hand-sliced meat, the thing that makes Geno's, Pat's, and Tony Luke's a cut better in Philly is the quality of their bread.  This place uses amoroso rolls which are mass-produced philly breads used by most sandwich shops.  So they are certainly authentic of the philly cheesesteak you get at most places.
author: James C.

description:
5 stars, best cheese Steak in SF.  

I have Had Jakes, Had Busters, Had all the other contenders. This is a Real Philly  Cheese Steak. 

stay away from 1130 to 130 any day of the week 20 minute wait.
author: Mo G.

description:
Meh.

I've had way better, but I've had much worse.  The cheesesteak sandwiches are decent, but I really like Italian Hoagies.  Yum.

Minus 2 stars for the service.  If you call in an order, be prepared to wait on hold for a LONG time, even if it's late in the afternoon.  I've waited no less than seven minutes the last 3 times I've called, and I have simply hung up multiple times.  

And they could care less.  I guess they don't want my money...
author: J. B.

description:
I came here with some doubts and hunger pangs as my friend and I paced the city after a long day of filming.  It was a pleasant surprise; though horribly overpriced, the cheesesteak really had the creamy, simplistic gestalt that one seeks.
Cheesesteak: A
Curly Fries: B
Service: B-
Environment: B+
author: Aaron S.

description: Erm, OK I guess, but the 7" is pretty small. Would take Jay's or Metro Cafe over this. Meat is reasonable, peppers are pickled.
author: David Y.

description: This place is the bomb!!! Every time I am in the city I have to stop and get a sandwich.
author: Kyle J.

description: This place is CRAAAACKIN!!! Greasy goodness. I mean what more can you ask for, you got your protein, carbs and veggies LOL. 10 inch cheese steak with mushrooms +++++ fries and cheese sauce+++++++++ must have cheese sauce. Love the fact that its just so simple there - order (must not order while you are on the phone, check the sign- its funny but so true), eat and go!
author: Trisha C.

description: This place is a favorite of my wife and I.  Have a cheesesteak with a combination of hot and sweet peppers with onions. Outstanding and habit forming. Even though we live on the peninsula we try and get here at least once a month.
author: Mike C.

description: Too bad there is not a way to rate a zero on Yelp because the cheese steak sandwiches are horrible. First, it is ground meat, loose with no texture of the thinly sliced meat of a REAL East Coast steak sandwich and the bread rolls was soft and gushy. The cheese was white but was the texture of a movie house cheese nachos, like a cheese wiz, yyuckky. It was like everything was thrown into a blender, cooked and stuffed into the bread roll. The "grilled" onions were cooked but not really grilled, but the sweet peppers were ok, not great but ok. I don't know any place that would call themselves a cheese steak sandwich and sell this, just doesn't make sense. I grew up on the real deal, so I'm just not getting it this version of a cheese steak sandwich. 1st visit today and it'll be my last.
author: Deborah D.

description:
I have had two cheesesteak sandwiches in the past month. One in Chicago and one here at the Cheesesteak Shop. I am not even going to waste my time to complain about the one in Chicago that had lettuce in it (ew!), but I WILL rave on how yummy the cheesesteak sandwich from the Cheesesteak Shop was! It had solid bread, meaning it was strong and firm enough to hold all the contents of the sandwich together, while at the same time being soft. It had a good meat to cheese ratio, and did not make me feel like crap after eating it. Two probably would have, but I decided to hold back on this particular day to save room in my stomach for a fabulous dinner. It was soooo good!
We didn't eat our sandwiches at the shop as we perferred to stay in, but I know for a fact that the shop is clean and is definitely not a hole in the wall place infested with bugs. I would eat in, out, morning and night from there.
author: Maureen B.

description: The awning above the entrance reads: "Caution: May be habit forming".  Yeah, if your habit is waiting for your sandwich.  Didn't anybody else notice the 33 minute delivery time on their order?  Sure, the cheesesteak is awesome, but not worth the loooooong time it takes to get your order.  And steak fries are a great idea, you just have to cook them all the way.
author: Rick H.

description:
if you're fat like me, always hungry like me and loves beaten to death pieces of meat put between a piece of bread, then this place is for you!

nooow, they say they're a legit Philly cheese steak joint but i didn't see cheese wiz anywhere on the menu, and i was really looking forward to it, but other than that, if you aren't from Philly and aint biased as hell, then this place is still damn good.

i ordered the 10 inch and i kinda wished i got the 15 inch since i felt 10 just wasn't big enough. sure it will fill you up, but if you're stomach can hold 2 gallons of milk like mine can, then get 2 of the 15 inches and you're set. 

they got sweet peppers on the sandwiches too, its great cause before going to the cheese steak shop, i never had a sweet pepper before in my life and i took a bite thinking id be running for the soda machine due to extreme spicyness, but nah, it was great.  

my only gripe about this joint is how they make you wait. 3 people in line seems like traffic during rush hour. im definitely going to visit this place more often and try everything, because in the end, its really worth the wait (and traffic).
author: Jeffrey B.

description: It's the real Philly deal. The only fusion here is this sammitch to my face until it's gone. I go with a basic beef stacked with sweet/hot peppers, garlic and onions. Any objection from a kissing partner is quelled when you give 'em the other half. Habit-forming? Who cares? There's a hospital across the street!
author: Andy R.

description: I went all out and got their 15" with extra meat and cheese.  It was a major mistake!   I was so full that I went into a deep food coma.  We're talking about the whole nine yards, curled up in a fetal position, napping like a baby at work...I would not advise eating this entire sandwich in one setting unless you're a 250 lb. lineman.  Next time, I'll play it safe and save half of it for dinner.
author: Jeff H.

description: I know this is a chain restaurant but this location isn't so good anymore. They aren't as meaty or filling. I used to eat here several times a semester but after last night's sandwich, they've lost quality at this shop. The sandwich wasn't as good as they used to be, it seemed smaller than usual, and they messed up my order. I'll give it another chance but if they continue to serve less in their sandwiches I wouldn't recommend this location.
author: Alex E.

description:
not a real philly cheese steak, nothing ever is really a _______(enter city) ______(enter dish) outside of the place its from. no matter what they say you dont get a chitown dog outside of chitown. 

the cheese steak shop is probably the closest thing youll get in the city to a philly cheese steak, and its pretty damn good. after starving all morning so i get "correct" results, peeing into a cup and being used  as a pin cushion by some incompetent nurse, i ran to cheese steak shop. i snorted an order of onion rings and inhailed a 10 inchers.... umm i mean a 10 inch cheese steak. pretty damn good. 

service could use some work, but its not for a lack of polite service, its more a procedure thing. it shouldnt take so long for you to get your order. than again, they do take their time to make sure you get a good cheese steak. 

uggg but i i always feel like a nap after i eat one. time for my noon nap.
author: Euge L.

description:
I've been frequenting this place for years. The phrase, "caution: may be habit forming" has even definitely applied to me, as proof was the time I got a $300 ticket for parking in the bus zone running in for a cheesesteak to go (they are good, but not THAT good). There is something truly authentic about this particular franchise over their other locations, I'm not sure if it's the persistent smell of fried beef, onions and cheese that lofts the air, the photos of their many other locations in neighborhoods around the states, or the daily sports sections of the newspaper posted up over the bar counters and in the bathrooms. 
The best part about the food here is that they import the buns directly from Philly. I've had cheesesteaks in Philly before, and this place is one of the closest you can find to what you can get out there. If you start coming to this place a lot like I do, get a VIP card and watch out for double stamp days. Then you can time your next visit to order a spinach, mushroom, and beef cheesesteak at no extra cost over an original cheesesteak.
author: Mark Y.

description: I've been going to THE Cheese Steak Shop since the late 80's... about two decades.  I don't go to any other spot in City... when I want a cheese steak, I go there - period.  It's not that I'm not open-minded, but there's absolutely no point in going anywhere else - NONE.  Don't do it - you'll be disappointed.  The food is a celebration, complete and utter gluttony.  If you don't care about the risk of a self-induced heart-attack, then this spot is bliss - double meat and cheese on the six inch, jalapeno poppers, curly fries and a side of nacho cheese, just under twenty dollars - FUCK. YES.
author: Daniel O.

description:
I made a to go order for a cheesesteak with peppers & onions.  From other reviews and Eli G's pic, I was concerned that the meat portions would be minimal.  I did not order "extra meat."  When your business is all about cheesesteaks, it should be a given that you don't skimp on the meat.

I get home, ready to dig in, and sure enough -the meat portion was very small.  I would say you get more meat at Subway.  Taste -was pretty good.  Cost -within a reasonable range.  Overall, would have been a 3/5 if the meat portion was larger.

My full disclosure: I've eaten at both Pat's and Geno's in Philly.  Locally, at Jake's Steaks, Amato's (San Jose), and Subway.

Conclusion: this is a little bit better than a Subway Steak & Cheese.
author: Bay Area T.

description: One of the best cheesesteaks I have ever tasted!!  I've eaten at the famous cheesesteak places in Philadelphia and their sandwiches still can go head to head with the best of them.  The bread is toasted slightly, the cheese is gooey and tasty, and there is a hint of spiciness/black pepper tastes.  Either that or I'm too ambitious to wait for the sandwich to cool off before eating it.  Sandwiches are fairly messy and it isn't the best for your health.  BTW I'm one of those people who works across the street at the cardiac cath lab so just head straight on over there after you eat here and check yourself in because you're gonna need it.  A subtraction of one star for the dining area which isn't the best.
author: patrick w j.

description: They sell great cheese steaks.  My only complaint is the interior has a smell. It smells like old wood or something.
author: Kel R.

description:
I am not from Philly.  Nor have I ever been to Philly.  But, I just have to hope that a "real" Philly cheese steak is much better than the stuff they serve at "The Cheese Steak Shop".

I don't touch the beef because the texture is gritty...much like sand in my mouth.  I don't like sand in my mouth.  The Chicken Garlic sandwich is my favorite.  But, this place lacks consistency.  One day my order may be correct, hot, perfectly made and really tasty.  The next, it may be all wrong, lukewarm and taste like crap.  


So, why do I keep going here?  Cuz when it's good, it's so, so, good and the place is usually filled with brothas.  I like brothas...and others!
author: Karla F.

description: good but def. not a real Philly. needs more cheese. great customer service and it's fast. they have a bunch of different options. there is a repeat customers punch card and fun specials on each say of the week. I recommend it if u want a quick tasty cheese steak :)
author: Elise B.

description: Completely authentic, down to the mild thuggishness in and around the place.  Philly is a tough city, and so is this neighborhood, by San Francisco standards at least.  Until I found a suitable cheesesteak spot in SoCal, going here was always a highlight of my visit to San Francisco.  The second best cheesesteak I've had outside of Philly, for sure.
author: Mike D.

description:
magically delicious!  these cats run this operation like a Navy Battleship, slow and steady, annihilating all appetites that come before them.  the menu has a lot of choices but you're gonna need to put a gun to my head to keep me away from the 15" chicken and bacon cheesesteak with HOT and SWEET peppers and onions.   the soft roll makes me feel like i am eating clouds.  visions of agustus gloop dance through my head when i suck down the gluey conglomeration of cheese meat cheese meat meat and cheese.  and meat.  if you are not a heavy drooler, watch the action in the kitchen and pay paticular attention to the syncopated beats meted out by the grillking.  poetry in motion.

locations all over the bay area, get your fix where you can.  heaven forbid you wear a JUICY TRACK SUIT in there and expect the maitre'd to pander to your noblesse, it's strictly linoleum floors and stackable metal chairs.   always fun to take yours home and make the roommates jealous.
author: W G.

description: I have been frequenting this San Francisco legend for about 13 years now and I am only 23 years old. What keeps me coming back? The consistently awesome Philly Cheese Steaks. There is no better place in the greater Bay Area to find a Cheese Steak sandwich.  While the guys at the counter can seem a little rough, they put plenty of love into their great sandwiches, which are delivered hot and on time. Far better than anything I managed to find in their hometown of Philly even. The only reason this place got 4 stars is because A. prices have risen and B. the things are quite simply not healthy. Oh well, this is the best place for hangover food and an all around solid choice for a Cheese Steak lunch. Enjoy.
author: Sven S.

description:
working in some of the polished medical/research buildings along this stretch of divis, it's easy to forget that you're smack dab in the ghetto...until you walk into the cheesesteak shop, that is.  the first time i walked in here (broad daylight, peak lunch time, tuesday afternoon), i actually thought i might get mugged.  

instead, i had one of the most fantastic sandwiches i've had since srini and i got baked and had ib hoagies (from berkeley).  i actually didn't get the cheesesteak and opted for the warm italian hoagie instead (more "stuff" on it :P).  the twisty fries smell fabulous too, but i haven't tried them.  tuesdays are double stamp days (for their stamp card).  although you technically only get stamps for purchases of $6 or more (and that's a big ass sandwich you get for $6), laides be sure to bat your lashes a lot.  i got quadruple stamps two tuesdays in a row just for smiling :)  (yeah i'm a sucker for special treatment).  oh, and wednesdays you get three sandwiches for the price of two.

come here for fantastic food, and to emerge from whatever ivory towers you and i live in to rub elbows with the rest of the cityfolk, but of course be forewarned, that as threatened by any good cheesesteak, your order is of course instant heart disease!
author: Roshni R.

description: My mouth is watering just thinking of those cheese steak sandwiches.  Habit forming is right.  My friends and family might just have to roll me over the finish line in October's marathon if I keep eating here :).
author: Amanda P.

description: After temporarily living on the east coast last year, I was totally bummed that Gino's in Philly was a wistful memory.  But then my fab husband introduced me to the cheesesteak shop.  This place is mouth watering, wallet easy, want to order 2 but afraid of my LDL cholesterol fan-freaken-tabulous.  I tend to get a steak with onions and cheese fries which does a soul good.  Closest I've found to the original, which is a relief since I love SF.
author: Chris W J.

description: The only exception to the no mayo rule: the cheesesteak hoagie.  Oh my God, this thing melts in your mouth.  My friends--this is a totally true story, I swear-- went here after work to pick up a huge sandwich to split at a bar.  They picked up the sandwich, went to the bar, and as they were unwrapping it, dropped the thing on the floor.  They looked at each other, mouthed something about the five second rule, picked it up, and ate it.  Seriously.  It's that good.
author: Tangerine L.

description:
First of all this is not lower Pacific Heights.  It was the Fillmore up until the redevelopment agency decided gentrification was necessary. .  I grew up in this neighborhood before gentrification and it had a rich history. .  
Anyway they make the best Philly Cheese in town.  The four instead of five rating is because the parking is atrocious.
UPDATE:Something has changed here.  The place is different.  The flavor of the food is different.
author: ahsal a.

description: I was born and raised outside of Philadelphia. I've had a lot of cheese-steaks. This is better than Philly! Especially the Garlic steak. Awesome flavor, not greasy in the least (better than philly's in that regard), real provolone or cheese-it..my only complaint--no pickles. Pickles = philadelphia folks. Every single damn deli in that town has a huge barrel of dill pickles....so 1 point down. Also could use more of a variety of tasty cakes though I was happy they had my favorite peanut butter snack cakes. Sadly this place is like an hour from my house by bus and I don't own a car...carpool, anyone?
author: shanestar h.

description:
Love this place.  Although an old standby for me, this place has really provided me with some "comfort food" especially when waiting for friends who are in surgery at the nearby hospital.  They are always friendly.

Parking is hit or miss.  My friend doesn't like that there is no wiz cheese here, but my heart appreciates it.
author: Al Y.

description: Ohhhhhhhhh my goooooooooood.....I fricking love these babies! Sooo mouth-watering yummmy.... Get anything here, the cheese steak with the pepper AND the grilled onions is my favorite. I want one right now...(drooling)...the burgers are good too!
author: Robin B.

description: I finally came here after years of hearing about it from friends. I split the 15in mushroom cheesesteak w/o peppers and wished I didn't after taking my first bite. It's very simple and very good. The bread was really soft and light, meaning it's not very "bready". I could've probably finish the 15in since it's not super filling and the meat is thinly sliced. I didn't taste a lot of cheese in it, but it was still yum nevertheless. The 15in was about $10.50, not bad if you're splitting it with someone. My fiance scarfed down a 10in then promptly went back in line for another 7in. Go him.
author: Freckles H.

description: I work a few blocks away from this place.  My co-workers usually phone in the order for lunch since they are really busy during the lunch hour.  The usual order is a 10-inch mushroom cheese steak with hot peppers and sweet peppers with double meat.  Fries would also be a staple side order.  One of co-workers told me that they get so busy that there was this one time where he was waiting in line to order.  As he was in line, he used his cell phone to phone in the order.  By the time he got to the front, his order was finished.  What great timing...
author: Philip L.

description: I lived in Wilmington for three years and I've been to a good number of cheesesteak shops in Philly. While nothing can quite compare to Pat's or Gino's or Jim's, this is easily the closest you're going to get in San Francisco. They import Amoroso's rolls. They have Tastykakes. I still miss the real thing, but The Cheesesteak Shop is a whole lot cheaper than a flight to PA.
author: Jordan M.

description:
This place probably serves the most unhealthy sandwich in town. If not, it has to be close to the top.

Despite of/Because of this, these cheese steaks are so damn good. They aren't lying when they say they are habit forming. I had to stop eating there because I was going there twice a week and ended up gaining like 50 pounds. At least the process of getting super fat was super delicious.

I highly recommend this place, just in moderation. Tuesdays are double stamp days, Wednesdays are half off sides day. Hooray!
author: Alexis C.

description: The BEST cheesesteak in the city. This is your CURE to a hangover. It's so greasy and it will soak up all that acid from drinking last night. It's a lil pricey but if you want good cheesesteak this is the place to go. :)
author: Lana K.

description: I have been living in SF now for 5 years, and my one grief about the city was that there was no good place to get a cheesesteak. They're so easy to mess up - and I never found a place that did it for me. Then I discovered this place. I found out about it last week, and I have been 4 times already. It really is habit forming like they say it is. I get the 10" cheesesteak. It's as good as it gets.
author: Wade W.

description: This place is pretty damn bomb for cheese steaks.  The bread isn't that filling, but keeps all that juicy steak and cheese together.  The onions and peppers on these sandwiches are pretty damn fresh and taste good too.  Just make sure if you're a meat lover, that you tell them to "KING ME" for a double serving of meat on your sandwich.  I didn't know this until after I ate my sandwich.  And a 10 incher ain't all that big, if you're a heavy eatler like me, you're going to want to get that 15 incher.  It's finishable guys.  Trust me.  If Tera Patrick can finish 15 inches of polish sausage down her throat, then I'm sure you guys can finish 15 inches of cheese steak with no problem.  Just make sure you get a cup of water or soda to help wash it down the pipes.
author: Chris T.

description: Wow, I'm really going to have to keep myself from going here too often otherwise I'll be a fat pig.  For cheese steak, this shop is pretty crazy good, and the prices are great.  Plus, they have all kinds of deals during the week like 2 stamp Tuesdays and half-off Wednesdays.  I wish there had been a little more meat in my sandwich, but it was tasty nonetheless.  Enjoy!
author: Dubs W.

description: We passed on Subway sandwiches tonight to grab a cheese steak at the Cheese Steak Shop. We wanted something quick so we could catch Monday Night Football at home. It's been awhile since we've visited this spot but we knew what to expect. The bread is soft and delicious, the meat is thin sliced and is so scrumptious when you add onions and cheese (of course). Funny fact, they aren't overly filling-not to me anyway, it's almost like eating something to put in your tummy so you don't starve or pass out or both-or I could just be really hungry tonight, who knows? Usually we just order the sandwiches to go because it's not the greatest of environments to dine. By the way, the wait is a bit long even if there's just a handful of people inside but don't be put off by the delay, just read the sports pages that they display on the walls to bide the time.
author: Jessica D.

description: In order to get full here you need a large for $12.  Otherwise you will need to buy 2 regulars for $14.  The portions even for the small are relatively small.  Where's the beef?  The serviced can be slow waiting for them to cook your sandwich and throw it on a roll.  You can easily spend over $15 just on a sandwich, fries, and drink.  But if you are fat like me you need 2 larges, 2 drinks, and two fries.  I usually order the steak with mushrooms and grilled onions along with a chicken steak with mushrooms and grilled onions.  You can add sweet or hot peppers for free.  I recommend sweet if you decide to add peppers.  Have fun fattys.
author: Fatty A.

description:
It's hard to rate a place that combines steak and cheese below a 3. Taste-wise, this place earns about a 3-star. Portion-wise, it deserves a 2-star. The actual amount of steak (and I'd assume chicken but I've never had the chicken sandwich) in a sandwich is probably half the amount a traditional Philly cheesesteak should be. It was about 33.33% meat to 63.33% bread. The result is that you taste more bread and very little cheese and steak and other condiments you add. I guess it's an indication when you can pay more for double the meat. My expectation of sanwiches is that they should be filled to the brim already. Is that an unreasonable expectation? The curly fries are acceptable but nothing special. I wouldn't go out of my way to come to this place but if I'm in the neighborhood - and by that I mean within a block - I may consider eating here. Otherwise, I'll be in search of a cheesesteak that has visibly more steak and cheese. 

My 7" cheesesteak with mushrooms - they got the order wrong and I ended up with peppers - and a small order of curly fries totaled approximately $6.50.
author: Gwen L.

description: I've been known to frequent this place with an IV attached to my arm and an IV stand by my side complete with drip bag hanging down. Supposedly out on a "cigarette break" from my room in the hospital (I don't even smoke cigarettes, lol). I know that I'm supposed to be on a liquid diet and these cheesy, meaty, garlicy morsels are supposed to be absolutely out of the question. But baby if lovin' cheese steaks is wrong, I don't wanna be right.
author: Tommy P.

description:
15" mushroom & spinach cheesesteak with regular steak fries and a diet coke...

eff my diet.
author: Ray R.

description: I came here about more than a year ago to check out this place since my friend and I are adventurous in trying out new things! So we came here on a random day which is pretty cool.  The drive there was horrible especially during rush hour traffic and on a rainy day plus horrible parking! But anyway, I ordered 10" cheesesteak and I forgot what I added onto it but I know there were onions and hot & sweet peppers on it plus I ordered the spinach and mushrooms on the side! It wasn't so bad plus you get those stamp cards and I think after 10 stamps you get a free one from the last time I remember.  But if you come on a Tuesday it is Double Stamp day! =) Anyway, the cheesesteak wasn't bad it was just quite greasy for me and it was a small one.  But I did love the spinach & mushrooms! I wish I ordered more of it cause 6 wasn't enough for me to enjoy it all! I still give it a 3 star because it wasn't so amazing to me but not bad compared to other places. Will I ever eat here again? Maybe, I am just not in it for the drive or the parking around the area.
author: Sharjah M.

description:
The Best Part:
The Cheese Steaks. Obvi.

AMAZING CHEESE STEAK
         I lived in Philly for a summer and pretty much developed my cheese steak addiction there. After reading reviews of this place on yelp, I had to check it out. So I did, and am I happy I did. This place serves some of the greatest cheese steaks I have ever tasted. Let me elaborate:
The Bread was perfectly toasted, soft on the inside, crispy on the outside with the perfect amount of flakiness. 
The meat was so good I forgot that I usually like California-style cheese steaks and didn't even miss the lettuce and tomatoes. 
The Hot Peppers were the perfect complement to everything. Delicious.

Experience:
         I felt very rushed here. I also didn't like the signs with a cell phone crossed out. It made me feel uncomfortable as if though a friend was not allowed to come in with me.
author: Franc S.

description: oh man! im a big guy who has never had a good steak sandwich...but after visiting this place, since i have had plenty of great steak sandwiches here!! great place and good service! It's all about the Pizza Steak sandwich with extra cheese and mushrooms!!
author: Juan C. T.

description: How this place could get less than 5 stars is crazy, this is as real as cheese-steaks get in Philly. Oh my Gosh, I love those tasty treats. I treat myself to one or two a year other wise i would be fat as a house. best hangover food. I admit the place is a greasy dive, but the product that comes out, is worth every bite!!!!! ummmmm.... my mouth is watering just thinking about it.
author: Rachel L.

description: Magically delicious.  The meat is really chopped which makes all the flavors blend so well together.  Yes!
author: T-Bone L.

description:
for whatever reason, i didn't want to like this place. i found it, i ordered, i waited 30 MINUTES FOR MY FOOD, i got my food, i looked at how small the 7" is (order the 10" if you're hungry, the 7" is smaller than it sounds), i looked at how unappetizing it looked, i ate it, ......and it was damn good. 

i'm a little torn as to whether i like jersey joe's better down in san carlos or this little place.

i ordered the 7" mushroom & cheese with onions, hot & sweet peppers. the hot peppers here stand out with more of a pickled flavor than a hot flavor, but it worked well with the sandwich. 

white american is my preference on cheesesteaks and that's what they use. (the flavor is more pronounced than with provolone). the meat was tender, as it should be, and the roll was soft and light.

now if we could just do something about the 30 min wait....
author: Trogdor B.

description: Best tasting PCS in the city. Stick with the basics.
author: Sam F.

description: Best cheese steak ive ever had in my live. Never had real philly cheesesteak..born and raised here
author: Raymond S.

description:
I've been to so many disappointing cheesesteak shops who can't get it right.  Stale buns, tough meat, Kraft cheese..I've run the gamut of bad cheesesteaks.  Enter The Cheesesteak Shop on Divisadero (not to be confused with the one in Sunnyvale, which is by far inferior).

On your first bite (mine was in 2001), you will taste what a Philly cheesesteak should taste like.  Soft Amoroso bun mixed with the melted cheese and the thinly sliced steak will bring visions of Rocky and the miserable east coast weather.  

My standard order consists of 
-10 inch Philly Original with Provelone and hot and sweet peppers
-Twisty fries

I never feel a 10 inch philly cheesesteak would be enough, and it never is.  I am full, but not stuffed.  One day, I will try the 15 inch steak.

One knock against this place is that the tables and chairs are pretty old and dirty.  But perhaps this gives an inkling as to why Philadelphians are so crusty and jaded at the world.  Oh well.  I'll just take it to go next time.
author: Pick S.

description: This place is abseloutely delicious.  The taste is unbelievable.  The prices are a little high for the minute amont of meat they give you and the service isn't exactly with a smile :(.  The atmosphere also leaves something to be desired but the food makes up for it.  Best to take-out.
author: Patrick C.

description: I never knew there was one in SF . Hm .. now that I know that there's one closer to my house , I might be eating philly cheese steak sandwiches everyday for the next two weeks haha ! I love their philly cheese steak sandwiches .. they're the best !! ( in SF at least ) The curly fries ( aka twister fries ) taste alright . They have a frequent buyer card . Tuesdays are double stamp days & they have special deals on Wednesdays . The cashier that I ordered from was super friendly . Btw , get at least a 10 inch because the 7 inch won't fill you up .. it's really small & more like a snack .
author: Eileen L.

description: I love the cheese steaks here because they are the closest tasting to philly I have ever had! why not give 5 stars? The Cheese steak shop does not give as much meat and cheese as they should. these sandwiches are missing enough filling. On the other side they have tasty kakes here, and since I am a true philly boy I cannot resist!
author: Marshall B.

description: I don't care how they make cheesesteak in Philly, this is the only cheesesteak I want to eat. It's meaty. cheesy perfection between a nice soft roll. I give them four stars because since I've been coming here (more than 10 years) I think they've reduced the sizes of the sandwiches and up prices. I know they're not the first business-- nor will they be the last to use this tactic-- but that doesn't make it less annoying. Oh yeah, apparently Robin Williams eats here too!
author: Sharifa R.

description: abbsolutely bomb. im from the east coast and struggled to find a dece spot for a cheesesteak thiis is it
author: Dan V.

description: I grew up in New Joisey, so the only cheese steak I have encountered prior to The Cheese Steak Shop is the White House in Atlantic City which I would give 10 stars if Yelp-ably possible.  However, this place doesn't completely disappoint.  They do a bang-up job with quality meat, cheese and sweet and spicy peppers.  The curly fries aren't so bad either.  For some reason, I feel like this place should have milkshakes but they don't.  7-inch chicken philly sub, small fries, small strawberry shake.  Yummmm.  Something to consider maybe?
author: Michelle L.

description: Hands Down the best Philly in town--I order the chicken cheese hoagie with grilled onions so I can kid myself that it truly is the healthy option. I know that others will argue over who has the best--similar to the Geno's and Pat's rivalry in South Philly--but I love this place. Word of advice, call in your order and save yourself some time.
author: Deborah S.

description: Hands down the BEST cheese steak I have ever eaten! I don't come here as often as I'd like. I guess that is a good thing cuz they're a lil' greasy. Oh but soooooooo goooodddd!!!!!

My mouth is watering as I write this review. The food is so delicious here the only reason I don't frequent it often is because its too far away! Otherwise I'd be there all day everyday. I am addicted to the classic beef with sweet and hot peppers w/ onions. SIde of curly fries is a great choice.  Yumm-o!
author: Cid T.

description: their phillies are quite tasty loaded w/ cheese!  however, it's so rare i ever crave for this.
author: Kae B.

description:
if i could design a yelp site, I would make it have 6 stars.  why? because then it would be louder.  because it would have 6 stars instead of 5.  and then I would crank it up to 6 stars for the cheesesteak shop on Divis.  I spent 4 years in philly and fell in lust for places like the steak out, billybob's, pat's, abners and any place even remotely connected to the olivieri famiy (cheesesteak, gobble, gobble. cheesesteak).  this place may be the ONLY place on the west coast that can truly represent the cheesesteak.  as many have pointed out, it's all about the amoroso.  I get annoyed when I come across these poser cheesesteak shops that serve grilled steak on french bread and call it a cheesesteak.  Someone should start a cheesesteak lobby to get our congressmen to put an end to that crap.  it's just wrong and it hurts.

POST SCRIPT ADDED FOR FULL & FAIR DISCLOSURE: One could question the authenticity of the cheesesteak shop in that the service here is comparatively friendly.  In philly, you really get the sense that the person working behind the counter truly dislikes you to your core, even though that person does not know you and will not look you in the eye at any point during the transaction.  It's not a bad thing or a good thing.  I just call that local flavor.
author: Chris S.

description: Al-righty Yelpers. Here you go. If you've been to Philly and know what a cheese steak sandwich should be, then this is your spot in S.F. I've seen my fair share of impostor cheese steaks, sh!tty roll, meat not chopped up,etc., but this place is  pretty legit except for the fact that they don't have cheese whiz. You might want to get an order of extra meat. Not that it needs it, but might as well make sure your sandwich is served up nice and proper. They got the sweet and hot peppers so handle it as you like. Their meat is chopped up real fine, cheese nice and melted, and the best rolls. They have a chicken version of the sandwich too. They make a vegetarian sandwich for those folk, which kinda makes me laugh cuz why would a veggie go to a place with steak in the name? Oh well! I'm glad someone is eating those pesky legumes!
author: santiago g.

description: I went to another Cheese Steak place on the peninsula because it was so highly recommend and after the first bite I knew I made a mistake. I will never stray away from perfection of the cheese steak sandwiches that are made at The Cheese Steak Shop ever again. It's The Cheese Steak Shop or nothing for me from now on.
author: Mario O.

description:
maybe it's me. but then again... i doubt that.

how can you even compare the cheese steak sandwiches here with the one's in philly? i've been to philly... and oh... the cheese steak sandwiches there are orgasmic. the ones here, unfortunately, are not. 

we waited almost 30mins for 3 cheese steaks and it wasn't even the lunch or dinner rush hour. there was a strong odor in the restaurant that made me nauseous.

on top of everything, it gave me a bad stomach. i spent 30minutes in the toilet after leaving this place

the only reason i go back is because for some reason my cousin and boyfriend are in love with this place. but then again, they're not too picky bout their food (i walk the extra block to grab some mexican instead).

personal fave: er...

beware of the long wait
author: Mei N.

description: Extremely average... I had been looking forward to trying this place for some time... I finally did and came out completely underwhelmed.  Not sure what the fuss is about here, the meat didn't seem to be of very high quality.  It's a cheesesteak, nothing fancy here.
author: Jonathan K.

description:
While waiting to order, my very wise friend from Philly  told me "  Nance, Your first real Cheese Steak is like the first great kiss" and boy was he right. . . I was immediately and completely smitten. =)  They are absolutely habit forming, I find just about every excuse to go to the cheese steak shop. It didn't take long for my yellow frequent buyer card to get completely punched out and receive my free philly cheese steak sandwich. Tasty Cakes are Delish!

My order is the 7 " cheese steak sandwich with extra gooey cheese, onions and both hot and sweet peppers. .  You can most defiantly have my curly fries, but get your hands off my coke. ; )
author: Gina F.

description: If you are from Philly (or for that matter, anywhere back east) this may not impress you, but if you miss a real Philly Cheesesteak this is the best I've found in the City. If you know of a better one - please let me know!
author: Ranger A.

description: Right in my 'hood. Thank goodness I only live a short 5 minute walk away. Great cheesesteak sandwiches. You get choice of onions or sweet peppers to add.  And the best part are those frequent buyer cards!
author: Beth W.

description: I am amazed at the high praised reviews for the Cheese Steak Shop on Divis and wonder if I went on an off night or if others have a lower standard for cheese steak.   The cheese steak was average, a small portion, and did not fill me up.  It just tasted generic to me, nothing special compared to the great cheese steak places I have been to in Philadelphia.
author: Josh K.

description: I first went to the one in Oakland by Lake Merrit and loved it.  The one is SF is just as good and if I lived closer I would go once a week cause any more than that and I'd be fat.  Thank You
author: Corey V.

description: A solid 3.5, but I bump it to a 4 because when you crave a cheesesteak this place hits the spot.  I'll admit that some days it seems to taste batter than others, but it is packed with flavor.  I try not to collect my frequency cards otherwise I will gain too much weight from this place. =)
author: Joe O.

description:
Sometimes I really don't get SF.

Sometimes this city seems like a bunch of people who have cut out their tastebuds and given in to reckless hyperbole.

Has anyone who has written these reviews ever really eaten a bona fide philly cheesesteak.?

Judging by all the positive reviews, I would assume not.

In philly, the steaks are freshly cooked, juicy chopped sirloin, topped with onions cooked with the meat and a healthy slathering of whiz. Yes, that's cheese whiz, NOT american, provolone, or swiss.

Offerings like bacon and ranch would be very much frowned upon.

The steaks here are tiny, unfulfilling and poorly made.

One star just because the guy at the counter was very friendly.

Everyone do yourself a favor and go to Jim's on South Streetin Philly  and order a wiz wit' and then decide if the Cheese Steak Shop is really worth your praise.
author: Saikat P.

description: Unfortunately, I was a little disappointed with this place. I've had better, just another fast food chain restaurant, nothing impressing. In addition, I actually thought it was a bit ghetto and felt uncomfortable eating my sandwich there. Probably won't be going back to this particular location, maybe I'll just stick with the east bay locations.
author: Joanna N.

description: I love the cheesesteaks here.  I usually get the regular philly cheesesteak with peppers and a side of curly fries.  Absolutely delicious.  They are usually pretty busy so be prepared to wait some time.
author: Allison T.

description: Great standard sandwiches, I have only gotten take out here and am glad for that!  Not the most pleasant environment here and kind of a weird smell!  But the food was delicious.  I split a Philly cheese steak and Philly chicken with a friend and was impressed with both!  The fries were good as well, especially for take out!  They were still crispy by the time we got to eat them!
author: ELIZABETH W.

description:
OK, I woud normally not admit that I eat here every now and then except that they deserve the recognition.... Thy are officially my once-in-a-blue-moon indulgence.
No need to get too complicated 7" (OK 10" if hungry) philly cheese steak sandwich with peppers and onions (yes, get the peppers and onions, they make it!). Any one of their deep fried sides makes a great accompaniment depending on your preference. Wait anxiously till they call your name and grub on!
Note: Don't be afraid to bring a vegetarian friend along if they'll step a foot in the place, their veggie sandwich is an awesome mix of sauteed mushrooms, spinach and other veggies with garlic, etc,, topped over melted cheese, yum!
author: Emily J.

description:
i wish they gave you bigger sides.  i like to take a bit of my sandiwich and eat a onion ring.  i cant do that that here. 

other than that, thumbs up.
author: David F.

description: I went here on the recommendation of a friend originally from Philly.  He said no one west of Philly gets cheese steaks as close to the original as this place.  They are quite delicious and I believe they actually import the rolls from the 215 direct!  They also have a generous frequent buyer program that gets you a free 10" pretty darn quick.  This is one of the places I would go out of my way to go to.
author: Don O.

description: Cheese steaks are my specialty.  This is what keeps me going.  I was hoping to find a great hoagie shop in the city and I finally found it!  It is what it is.  Mouth-watering juicy bites of sandwich heaven.  It compares with the Philly's Best franchise in southern california.
author: Louie N.

description: The idea of eating one of these sandwiches once a week makes me run for my sweat pants and flip-flops. Talk about ass expansion! There are a handful of tasty little jems on Davisadero and this is certainly one of them. The rolls are fresh, meat is perfect for the taste and consistency of the sandwich, and last but not least the peppers and oozing yummy cheese. Oh, if only I was a teenager! I would eat two sandwiches a day. Oh, the curly fries are great too!
author: Charise B.

description: Absolutely gross. The moment I walk in, the STRONG aroma of Mr. Clean permeates and almost destroys any philly cheesesteak craving I had. I still ordered one to go, and found myself with a pretty small sandwich.
author: L R.

description: Not terrible not great.  But I have high cheesesteak standards.  If you call this sandwich a Philly or a Philly cheasesteak  you will probably enjoy the sandwich as you are probably not from Philly, no offense intended.
author: Colin F.

description: Pretty good cheesesteaks from this Philly native.  Long lines and they sometimes screw up your order are the only negatives. Amaroso rolls are a must and that really separates this place and Jakes. Most others in SF just suck.
author: MEK O.

description: Seven inches of philly steak, cheese, onion, garlic, and all the bell peppers you want for roughly a dollar an inch was worth the fifteen minute cooking time, but once I was at my desk and eating I almost regretted my purchase - "where's the cheese"? I couldn't taste my cheese at all; however, just like a chick flick there was the predictable "happiness" to follow these lowly feelings, for within my seventh bite I finally had my cheese! I suggest eating your sandwich as soon as you get it otherwise your cheese will melt and gather into one part of the bread. Still, despite my hiding cheese, the overall taste of the philly sandwich was phenomenal and I suggest coming after the lunch rush so you can sit and enjoy your meal!
author: Selina L.

description: Yum!  These are delicious.  The bread is perfect and the meat and peppers (I get hot and sweet) are great.  Comes w/ provolone but we like to get a side of whiz because we like 'em to taste like Pat's if they can (wit whiz).  They won't cook with the whiz which is not a show stopper for me...delicious!
author: Janet L.

description: Worst cheese steaks I've ever had. Not the taste but the size and amount of steak they use. Seriously, I was served two 10 inchers and one 7 inch.
