Other friends ordered their largest size (14?). What was on it was pickings of meat, about the thickness of two slices of sandwich packed meat. There really wasn't all that much on it. Taste was good, but I get cheesesteaks for their abundance of meat and melted cheese... This was the opposite. Were they low on meat for the day or something? I've had better sandwiches at Jays and Jersey Joes. Not going here again, and if I ever do... I'll still be hungry when I leave. Sorry guys.
author: David S.

description: I am a cheesesteak connoisseur  and this place is not just SF good it is Philadelphia good. I prefer Pat's to Geno's and this place is comparable with Pat's. I know I know!! Sacrilege! Trust me, I go back to Philly every year with my pop and eat nothing but cheesesteaks. This place is the real deal. they also have a bar area where the sports pages, movie listings, TV listings, and funnies are up against the wall behind plastic so you can keep both hands on your food while reading. Genius!! Kudos also for the fact that they have a 15" cheesesteak. That with a drink for $12.24 and two stamps on tuesday is a deal bro!
author: chris b.

description: This place is off the hook....kind of like when you are talking to your best friend about some juicy gossip and your ear is fixed to your phone....the same phenomena happens when you eat a cheese steak....mouth to sandwich....weird!  The rolls are soft and just seem to conform into the shape of your mouth making it an easy transfer, the cheese is yummily gooey, and the sweet peppers completes the whole masterpiece.  They have all types of sandwiches from vegatarian to meatarian....but if you are on a strict workout or diet to get cut up for the summer....then put those bandages for your cuts away because frequenting this addicting place will do nothing for your figure....instead it will leave you trying to figure out what happenend to your perky butt, tight body and where did the inflatable tube around your waste came from....GO FIGURE!
author: Te R.

description: "My first and subsequent cheesesteak experiences occurred, appropriately, in Philadelphia, PA.  Ever sInce then, my friends and I have spent more than a decade combing the Bay Area for the most authentic Philly cheesesteak.  My findings: visit 'The Shop' on Divisadero, or on University Ave in Berkeley. Buns imported from PA, Tasty Cakes at the counter.  By far the best in the west; nothing else comes close. Stay away from 'Jay's Cheese Steak' [sic] and any other shameless imposters."
author: Noah Plays Bass M.

description: Well, I have never been to Philadelphia but I can definitely say that these are by far the best cheesesteaks in the Bay Area.  I love the regular cheesesteak with grilled onions and a side of sweet & hot peppers and curly fries.  I could eat one every day but my doctor would be pissed so I settle for once a month.
author: Jake A.

description: Every time I go into the Cheesesteak Shop with my little "frequent buyer" stamped card to claim my free sandwich, I look up at the sign that reads, "CAUTION: may be habit forming" and think to myself, "man...  I wonder how many law suits that has saved this place from because that phrase is so true"...
author: Benjamin G.

description: If I can be honest with you I hate the movie somethings gotta give and I like this place. The philly cheese steak sandwiches are good and the curly fries are excellent. But its one of those sandwiches where if you pick it up that's it you have to hold it till you finish because it'll fall to pieces. You feel a little cruddy after eating it all because its a ton of grease. You know it can't be good for you when you pick it up and stuff is running down your arm.
author: Mike L.

description: This place does cheese steaks and they do them well.  I'd go for a plain one... steak, cheese, maybe onions, peppers and shrooms.  Keep the sauces and mayo to yourself, thanks.  Don't go for the ambiance or even the friendly staff.  They're gone for the day.  And they'll be out sick tomorrow, too.  Funny how that works.
author: ben y.

description: After working in the east  bay for a while the Pleasanton location became one of my weekly lunch haunts. Today I visited the Divis one, and after circling a few times found a spot to park for a late lunch. Note to self: next time just walk there and avoid the post cheese steak food coma. Had my usual 15"  mushroom cheese steak and after a painstakingly long wait when they weren't even that busy, received my two plates of heart clogging grease including curly fries, going with the side of cheese sauce also wasn't the best idea in hindsight. Like Andy R. says at least the hospital is across the street.
author: Rob H.

description: I love the cheese steaks here.  I normally request beef with the peppers and mushrooms and with that melted cheese and soft bread ... MMMMMM!  Damn, I want one right now ...
author: Mira B.

description: Holy friggers!  This place is the bomb.  Soft bread like clouds, creamy gooey and melty cheese, greazzy steak, with the perfect grilled onion and sweet/hot peppers to top it all off.  The steak fries are great too.  I'm kinda pissed I found this place and that it's only 5 mins from my house because now I'm going to become a fatty.
author: Jen S.

description:
best cheesesteak i've ever had .. sure beats Pat's in Philly ..
got the regular 10" with sweet and hot peppers .. my friends questioned whether i could possibly handle a 10".. and man, a 10" was nothing .. i think i can even handle the 15" (that's what she said) .. the steak is chopped fine ... provolone is saucy ... twisties (curly fries) are good .. ask for extra peppers .. no wonder there's such a long line here .. save yourself some time and call-in your order ... you're still going to have to wait awhile after you get there to pick up and pay.

oh yeah, eat it there .. it won't taste as good if you take it home .. man, we didn't wash our hands afterwards so that we could continue to sniff the sweet aroma of the cheesesteak on our fingers for the rest of the day .. mmmm.
author: Anvy A.

description: It's not in my DNA, I guess for me it should be finding perfect Italian food in San Francisco (which by the way is not that difficult). I don't get the hype then. It was good, nothing to say, somehow heavy but good.
author: Dario B.

description:
the best cheese steak i ever had. trust me, i consider myself to be a cheese steak connoisseur, if you will, and i've tried them all! from the great steak escape to denny's version, they're all POSERS!

all thanks to clyde... i've discovered one of my favorite things to eat, regardless if it's fatty or not, i don't care.
author: T V.

description: I love this place, although my stomach often does not. it's worth it, though. so blows away pretenders like Jay's --- anyplace that automatically puts lettuce and tomato on a cheesesteak (as Jay's does) need not apply. a (supposedly true) and related anecdote about John Kerry: on the campaign trail in '04 he was in Philly and stopped in a cheesesteak place. they asked him what kind of cheese he wanted and he said, "Do you have havarti?" any wonder he is not president?
author: Erica W.

description: I used to go to this place as a kid.  It was always one of my favorites.  I no longer eat meat, but I had thought about giving up vegetarianism for this place.  Instead I overlook the fact that they use the same grill and tools and order their spinach cheese 'steak'.  It's really good.  Oh, those peppers!  I don't care what size I order, i always eat the whole thing.
author: angela k.

description: Its hard to walk passed this place, even after lunch.  Just glue the hoagie to my thighs and we'll call it a day.
author: Inbal R.

description: Def. my favorite CheeseSteak in SF. The Chicken BBQ and the Xtra Cheese, and Three Play are probably the best. Right amount of everything on them. Addictive!!!!
author: edgar s.

description: I remember eating here when I was like, 10, with some Russian kids after the Russian festival down the street. I completely forgot about it until a couple years ago when a friend randomly dragged me in. Suddenly, I was a kid again eating cheese steak for the first time again. Pardon my drool.
author: Thom M.

description: Holy shit, I would punch a nun in the face if it got me one of their cheese steaks.  Truly amazing!
author: doug b.

description: I shared a 15 inch mushroom and cheese beef cheese steak. This place has a lot of options like chicken and beef. I think I would have preferred to order the normal cheese steak. If you "King It" they put a little more meat and cheese.
author: Ginny M.

description: The CRACK of cheese steaks.  I just had one and I want more, I even had the double cheese and double meat, and I am still craving more, I think I am shaking from withdrawls already.  The sweet pepers that were found on my sandwich were a perfect compliment to the gooey cheese and the finley shreded beaf.  I just found a reason to live in that neighborhood, so I can be closer to the best damn cheese steak in SF.  I love you cheese steak shop.
author: brian m.

description: I've gone through so many, and I mean tons, of those little yellow cards.
author: SF N.

description: Get the 10" sammy with chicken, spinach and mushrooms, hot and sweet peppers, twister fries, piles of catsup.. and dig in! It's most def the best cheese steak I've ever had, unfortunately the people that work there are rude or maybe it's because I was high...
author: Janice K.

description:
Good solid option for a cheese steak just better ones in town 

Pros: The meat is nicely chopped and the onions are soft and sweet, and the sweet and hot peppers are plentiful. The grilled bun is crispy but not hard and the have good curly fries. They are a little slow but that is okay because they make them to order and don't have a mound of precooked meat getting dry. 

Cons: A weird thing is that they have whiz but won't put it on the sandwich. You can get a side order of it for .99 extra I added it on top but it is not the same. Old tables and chairs but I thought it looked clean
author: Brad G.

description: I like philly cheese steak.. and my hubby is crazy about it. So, one day when we were craving for one, we YELP it and found out that many people love this place. Since the place is very close by to my work, we went here for dinner.. We ordered the mushroom and  garlic ( so we ordered two and both with provolone cheese). The order came pretty quick actually because it was only like 5:30 pm, so.. yoohoo! then, we tried them with a great anticipation...  aaahhh!!!  I'd rather go to Charley's!! It is far more tastier than this place. Sorry! but, I love their pickled peppers though!
author: Daisy S.

description: We love the Cheese Steak shop.  Recently we were in Philly and went out twice to well known and very good Cheese Steak places.......but both my hubby and I agreed they have nothing on The Cheese Steak shop!
author: Lana A.

description: I wish that i lived a little closer to this place, because i could easily see myself eating here all the time.  Their cheesesteaks are as good as any i have had (i am no philly native, but i have had many steaks in my day).  They are quick to get your food out, and fairly reasonably priced.  And man, it feels so good when you fill out that cheesesteak card and you get a free one!
author: Robert R.

description: My family and I have been coming here for years! We love this place!! The sandwiches are simple, but have such great flavor.  Make sure to add the hot peppers.  They are a must!
author: D A.

description: As close to the real thing that I've ever found on the W. Coast.  Too bad they don't serve it with wiz....I think that's the missing ingredient.
author: Mark D.

description: Been going here since I was a kid.  When Will Smith said in the 1st season of Fresh Prince that a real cheesesteak has enough grease to soak the paper bag, this is what he was talking about.  They don't do the Cheese Whiz stuff here (for that go to Jake's).  All of their varieties are good for the most part but I always get the pizza steak (not the one w/ pepperoni though).  The deluxe is essentially the same thing, only with mushrooms.  Tuesdays are double stamp days - fill up a whole card with them and you get a free cheesesteak.  Avoid this place during lunch time.  The wait gets long especially if there's an ignorant Kaiser/UCSF employee ordering for 10 without phoning in ahead of time.
author: O'Shea J.

description: It's probably a good thing that these don't exist near Davis or closer to my SF home in the Excelsior.  I'd probably would've died from a heart attack a lot earlier. From looking at their website, one is supposedly opening soon in Vallejo. If I'm really craving it I'd probably make the drive.  Apparently they are a franchise - SOMEONE MAKE ONE in Davis/Sac/Vacaville and I'm there!  The last time I had one was actually at the San Leandro/Bayfair Mall location - I had the one with the whole cloves of garlic. You gotta get it with the onions and the peppers, too.  Good stuff.
author: Alice C.

description: If you're looking for a real Philly cheesesteak, this is not your place. Those places are about 2900 miles away. If you're looking for an OK sandwich that happens to have shredded beef, a little cheese, peppers, and onions, then this is your place. Oh, the twister fries are pretty good, and don't forget to get your frequent card.
author: Michael G.

description: They have some bomb ass cheese steak. I would say this is the best in the city.  The only problem I have with tia place is that there's no parking.
author: Cedric F.

description: There's not much I can say about the cheesesteaks here besides that it is FABULOUS.  Yes, it' is extremely juicy, oily, and bad for you....but it is utterly delicious.  I love the mushroom swiss one!
author: Angie K.

description: This is the Mecca of Cheese Steak in San Francisco!!! Their motto is 100% accurate: "CAUTION: May be habit forming". I've been coming to this place since I was real young and have been addicted to this place ever since. It's not to say that I don't have an occasional cheese steak sandwich elsewhere, it's just that when I do, it always makes me wish I had a cheese steak sandwich at this place. The place to go for authentic Philly cheese steaks.
author: Rommel N.

description: after eating their cheesesteak, I wanted to take a nap. It was good but, it'd be better if they put more meat, there was more bread than meat cheese peppers combined. The 7' sandwich went for about $7. The fried mushrooms were okay, not something I would go out of my way for.
author: Robin L.

description:
great cheesesteaks, especially for san francisco. i'm from south jersey so i know a thing or two about these things. they import their bread from amoroso's, which means they're legit. though it's not quite as good as the "real thing," it's pretty good -- and a hell of a lot better than a lot of other cheesesteaks in this town. 

the curly fries are good, and i love that they sell tastycakes behind the counter! how f'n cool is that?!
author: Sidney B.

description:
One word...YUMMY!  

This place offers the best philly cheese "anything."  You HAVE to remember to have them include the sweet peppers.  Their onion rings are the best that I have ever had.  Price isn't too bad for what they have to offer.  SO good!!!

Some people would be a little turned off by the neighborhood, or the dirtiness of the surroundings of the building...but it is so worth it.  They have other establishments all around, so if the surroundings whet your appetite, try another one of their locations...but my opinion is that you must try it at least once!  (They have a vegetarian sandwich that is awesome!)
author: Jenny Y.

description: One of the better cheese steaks in the area.  It's got everything you need, cheese, steak, bread, onion.  They add cherry peppers too, which I don't recall having at Tony Luke's or Rick's but they're tastey.  Oh yeah, greasy too.  The paper will be clear by the time you finish half your steak.
author: Bruce B.

description: This place is just grubbin'.  Cheese steak with onions and hot peppers is my favorite.  The fries are super hot.  I prefer the curly fries but that's because I love crispy fries.  I was in Philly last week and it's not quite as good as Pat's but it's a pretty good substitute on the west coast.  it's my favorite in SF.  Reasonable too $7.45 for a full meal.
author: Gina T.

description: Best cheesesteak! I've never been to the east coast to taste the real deal, but this is the best cheesesteak I've had, not only in the city, but ever! The cheese just melts in your mouth as you anticipate every bite of that steak. Love this joint! I keep coming back. Check it out. However, public transportation is recommended. Parking can drive you nuts. I recommend phoning in your order to avoid the long lunch hour lines.
author: Zell C.

description: I'm from Philly...lived there my first 26 years.  The Cheese Steak Shop is like going home again, with their pics of Philly on the walls and the Amoroso rolls.  It only gets 4 because NO WHIZ!  Why go 90% by flying in the rolls and not go all way?  I gotta talk to the owner so I can get my 'whiz wit'.
author: Scott F.

description: Oh Hell YES! .. this place.. IS THE PLACE.. man i'm at a loss for words.. can i get a 10 inch mushroom cheesesteak with extra peppers please? ... even though i'm in LA now i still dream (well my stomach does ) about this palce everynow and then.. go there on a empty stomach..nothing like a messy hot cheesy cheesesteak with curly fries... oh man i'm definately making this palce my next stop next week going home.. YOU find me a better Cheesesteak in california do it i dare ya..
author: Timothy W.

description: Seriously , the best cheesesteak in the city. Seven , ten or fifteen inches of goodness. (sandwhich size).
author: Jerry M.

description: pretty good! ... I've been going to the Cheese Steak Shop for over 15 years - I started in Fremont and when I moved back to the city, I kept going. I'm glad they've kept their consistency in quality and it still tastes great!
author: Alton Y.

description: Very good cheese steaks. I still have a free cheese steak card burning a hole in my pocket and I gotta make it out there. The sweet peppers are really good and I can easily eat two 10" in one sitting.
author: D J.

description: I ignored the warning of the sandwiches being habit forming, and now I fear I will regret it.
author: Ashly M.

description: The last time I was forced to consume a Philly Cheese Steak I nearly lost my lunch.  That was in 1989 and according to my 'native' source it was one of the best sandwiches in SF.  I think that place is in little italy, I forgot!  Anyway, back to the story... our kids were pestering me to go to the place that daddy likes, so I caved.  The smell was exactly as I remembered (that nasty greasy grill smell,) but after some serious hazing from my kiddos, I reluctantly ordered a PCS with onions and peppers.  hmmm, needs catsup... ok, I'm sold!  Not at all what I remembered.  A good little hole-in-the-wall on Divis.  Because it's next to UC, street parking is a pain. I would not go out of my way to visit this place because of it's location, but if I was in the neighborhood, I would definitely grab one.  The restaurant is small and very dated, but for those who are craving that cheese steak flavor, this is a good little spot.  Bring your cholesterol meds!
author: Erin M.

description: Love these cheese steaks. Always a pretty long wait for your order, but worth it.
author: Kimberlee L.

description: after reading many reviews on this place I figured it had to at least be decent.  Let's face it, this place is a chain so you can't really expect too much from them.  I tried a regular Philly and though it had a good flavor, didn't come close to what a Philly cheese steak should taste like.  hardly any meat in the sandwich, and given the price I'm not too surprised.  But seriously, if you have to jack up the price a buck or two in order to produce a real sandwich then do it!  3 stars because i wasn't disgusted by it and I would go again if they were the only place I could get to when I was craving a cheese steak.
author: James C.

description: When I walked in to the cheesesteak shop, I felt like I was back in philly goin to one of my favorite cheesesteak joints(not pats or ginos). the menu though was not what I hoped for. I'm glad they didnt offer cheese wiz, but where was the provolone? so I got a 10", and it tasted ok, but was seriously underfilled, cali sized, not philly sized and overstuffed. had I known i guess I would have paid the extra $2 for the double beef and cheese, but I guess I expect my cheesesteak to be overfilled and messy, not unfilled and clean to eat. next time I will get the double, or just go to jake's as its closer to home
author: Rich B.

description: The awning nails it right on the head...eating here is definately habit-forming. I dunno if it's a good thing or not, but I haven't even come close to finishing the punchcard they give you that you can earn a free cheesesteak with. Still - a 10-incher with a side of curly fries is more than enough to keep ya happy. The guy that yells out your name when your order's up is kinda funny too...
author: Justin H.

description: Thin-sliced beef done to perfection.  Only didn't give 5 because of the long wait. I guess sometimes the best things come to those who wait!  Proper cheesesteak...ummm think my mouth is watering.  Yes, pardon me while I wipe the drool away.
author: Amy H.

description: Crazy Crazy Good. You know the feeling you get when you eat McDonalds. The heart slows down and you feel like you are going to die and you just say to yourself, "Why the hell did I eat that??". Well this place gives that same feeling, but you instead say, "Screw it, Seconds". You know its good when you pick it up, all that steak juice drips all over your clothes and you think to yourself....its not worth it to put down the sandwich just yet. Lines are crazy and parking is rough, but its an hour long adventure worth pursuing.
author: Ray H.

description: I can't go anywhere near this place without popping in for a philly cheese steak -- mild and hot peppers.  omg.  My mouth is watering just thinking about it.
author: Valerie P.

description:
Love this joint, joined yelp just to review it:

Got a Bacon Cheese last week at The Cheese Steak Shop, perfect, great beef, great peppers and onions on a great bun. No need for any other condiments.  Was sorry I didn't get the 10" .  In short, the opposite of everything that normally makes me hate (ok, will eat, but try to avoid) cheesesteaks...

No greasy mystery meat cooked till gray and bland, topped with government cheese, garnished with minced onions and peppers and piled onto a semistale semisoggy discount isle bun; ketchup, mayonnaise, mustard required.  A gutbomb and  future heart attack.

By comparison, The Cheese Steak Shop Bacon Cheese  seemed practically healthy... next week I try one of those raw food places. 

(only 4 stars because in the end it's still just a sandwich, but it was really really good)
author: Jeff E.

description: Best Cheese Steak around - I make the trek here from the Peninsula a couple of times a month - whether I need it or not. The sandwiches are top-notch and the staff is friendly - they make eye contact and make you feel like a regular even when they are swamped!
author: Dave N.

description: I have never been to Phili, but after eating here a few years ago I have one less reason to go. They are definitely "Habit Forming". I have been going to these since 1999 and have been to at least 4 locations around the Bay. I discovered the Garlic Cheese Steak with both types of peppers and curly fries about a year ago and I have not ordered anything else since.
author: Keith J.

description:
Wow, Wow, Wow... just thinking of this place makes my mouth water!
Make sure that you eat this sandwich within minutes of cooking or what you will end up with is a soggy philly cheese steak.  Still good, but soggy.  I usually get the spinach cheese steak with half hot and half sweet peppers.  As my 2 year old daughter would say...  "mmmm... momma!"
author: Cherry L.

description:
Sometimes the cheese steaks are great--4 stars.  Other times not so good.  I usually have the beef cheese steak with onions and both peppers, sweet and hot.

Yesterday, I tried the chicken cheese steak.  Wished I hadn't.  They may have served 1 tablespoon of chicken, forgot the onions, and globbed a handful of cold peppers on top.  Needless to say, that sandwich didn't make my day.

Side dishes are sort of typical of fast-food places.  This isn't gourmet.  The price is right, though the place is very noisy and, most of the time, crowded, definitely just a place for take out or a quick bite.
author: Richard C.

description: Best Cheesesteak in San Francisco by a long shot.  This place is so good, they have a sign up warning people not to counterfeit their frequent diner's cards for redemption on free sandwiches.  I highly reccommend one with hot peppers and whole roasted garlic cloves.  Stay away from anything that will be flavored predominantly by a sauce such as a pizza steak or bbq steak.  You will be much happier tasting other ingrediants.
author: matthew w.

description: I must agree with most of the other reviewers that this place is the best for authentic cheese steaks in this city.  They also have really good steak fries!  Fortunately for my arteries I no longer live just around the corner from here.
author: Derek D.

description: When they say "caution:may be habit forming", they don't lie.  I brought a group of friends here and they're all hooked!  Simply delicious and mouth watering.  People may complain of environment but c'mon let's be serious here...who comes here for atmosphere?  Only thing keeping me from giving this place 5 is the wait.  But it's oh so worth it considering they import their ingredients from Philadelphia.
author: Doogie H.

description: Well.  It was a good cheesesteak.  But then again I don't really like cheesesteaks.  So how do I rate this?  Fine.  Compared to all the cheesesteaks I have had, this is definitely one of the better ones.
author: Puchu ..

description: Great Garlic Cheesesteak.  Whole roasted cloves in with the peppers and meat.  Not your traditional from Philly cheesesteak.  No cheesewhiz.  But before I knew what a real PhillyCheese was, I thought this was the best.  I call these SuckaFreeCheese steaks.  Why cause they are unique to SF, tha Sucka Free.  They really should make one with the whiz though, just in case some Philadelphians ever drop by.  Damn now Im getting hungry.
author: Hen A.

description:
this place has amazing AMAZING cheesesteaks...i am practically drooling just thinking about them...
normally this place is busy, especially around lunch time so if your in a rush, call in your order!  it is ready when you get there and you can just grub down!
i strongly suggest the mushroom cheesesteak, extra cheese, and onions and peppers...
author: erin f.

description:
i am hungry just thinking about it.
oh sooooooo good. i wish they were open 24 hours though. i mean think about the drunken possibilities!!
also i wish they opened a second location. they are kinda in a wierd spot of town.
i had a craving for one the other night. and even though i was sick with strep throat, i still force fed myself one. it was painful but oh so worth it.
author: Ryan B.

description: Best cheesesteaks in the city. Nuff said.
author: Derek B.

description: The sign says "caution may be habit forming"..... And it is! Being a west coaster my whole life i guess i don't know what a real "Philly" tastes like but I don't see i getting much better than this. I get tha bacon philly and its the best thing EVER it seriously melts in your mouth! No Joke!
author: Jason B.

description: The cheesesteak is ok here. I mean if you are anywhere in the area, then this is the spot for you. I would not eat in there because your clothes will reek grease/oil smell.
author: DVS A.

description: "Caution may Be Habit Forming "  (on  the awning ) Ya, no shit . I come from the east coast so certain things are different out here , chicken wings , Pizza , and cheese steaks . But these guys got it right . Greasy meat , greasy cheese and cooked peppers ! Doesn't get any better than that .
author: Keyser S.

description: The most legit spot ever.  Neighborhood atmosphere with hardcore authentic food.  Ingredients are flown in from Philly.  So over done with staying real that you have to give them props.
author: Eric L.

description: I'm not really a cheesesteak eater. When I'm in Philly I go to Tony Luke's and have the pork with broccoli rabe. If I'm in Atlantic City I'll go to the White House and have a hoagie. But every once in a while I need to git my Philly on, or I'm having cancer treatment at UCSF down the street and need a bit of pick me up I'll stop in and check this place out. It's pretty good. I give it an extra star because the people who work there are really good. (full this disclosure- I used to hoop with some of these guys. Rick ((aka Rico, the manager, I think, gave me one of my you're getting old and soft moments when I blocked his shot, but ended up going higher, with my hand still on the ball then ended up on my ass, and his shot went in- I subsequently moved on to the geezer court)) Wow, my first Yelp use of double parentheses! I must be in digression mode! Good food, hoagies with oil vinegar oregano stuff. Yeah!
author: James T.

description: It's a little hole in the wall-e but worth it.  I love the fact that they toast the buns.  The curly fries are crunchy and perfectly seasoned but an order is not big enough to share so make sure to get your own.  Delish!
author: Melody H.

description: this place is awesome!!   i crave their cheese steaks.   also they have the best jalapeno poppers.  i only wish they called the sizes small and large instead of large and extra large because i always order the smaller one by accedent.
author: sarah w.

description: Nothing left to say about this place.  Best Cheesesteaks in the city.  Bravo, Cheese Steak Shop...Bravo.
author: Jon M.

description: This place is DA BOMB!  If you are in the mood for a really really good, authentic cheese steak, I highly recommend this place.  On their yellow awning, it has a warning "Warning, may be habit forming".  Totally true.  I'm so addicted.
author: M S.

description: I've search the bay area for cheesesteaks and nothing, and I mean NOTHING, compares to the Cheese Steak Shop. They weren't kidding when they said habit forming. I've brought many a friend here and they've all loved it. Go now, you won't regret it!
author: Jason H.

description:
hands down the best cheesesteak EVER!  

a repeat customer of the lakeshore location, this divis locale is the next best bet living on this side of the bay.  same set up, same YUMMY philly. 

10 inch philly, onions, sweet and hot peppers (extra on the hot)...  and if im feelin gluttonous.. side of curly fries w/ cheese sauce.  YUM!

no other cheesesteak compares.  NONE.
author: Lady K.

description: MY favorite cheese steak shop in the city. Based on me and my friends nothing compares when you have the urge for something hot, greasy and super tasty. They offer some other great delicacies such as stuffed mushrooms, steak fries (which are like butter, but better), onion rings and curly fries. The people working there are all local and super friendly. They have random specials depending on the day of the week. If you don't feel like cheese steak they have an insane italian hoagie, but you must ask for it hot (else its mediocore at best). I always take people here when we want something filling but cheap. You can't beat a 15 inch sandwich for $10 bucks ^^
author: Mike W.

description: I've never been to Philly before, so I'm definitely no philly cheese steak conniseur. BUT to me, that was one REALLLLLY good sandwich. I got it loaded with extra toppings of mushrooms and grilled onions. Everything was perfect about the sandwich...(I feel like I'm Joey from FRIENDS...maybe not as far to guard the sandwich from a car backfiring though...but close)
author: Carrie W.

description: I would probably trade all human interaction for a lifetime supply of chicken cheese steaks! Seriously.
author: Casey M.

description: This place is unusually good. the meats the breads even the catsup taste good. I have been going there for years and has become the place i compare ALL of the other cheese steak shops to. If anyone knows a better place locally PLEASE let me know. I would LOVE to go somewhere else as this shop isn't close to me. :(
author: Jonathan B.

description: They say this place may be habit forming for good reason. A philly cheese and some curly fries and your in for a good time. The staff is great and double stamp tuesdays make you that much closer to receiving a free a free sandwich with your frequent buyers club. I went there for lunch today and the guy behind the table hooked up some extra stamps on the card because the lady in front of me picking up her order was being a pain to all parties involved.
author: Marcel B.

description: This place is a dump, but the cheese steaks are delicious. The sign outside says, "Caution:  May Be Habit Forming."  It speaks the truth.
author: Neema J.

description: Should be a 4.5 stars, can't quite give it five, parking can be rough sometimes.  Now, with that being said, this place has an awesome cheese steak.  Is it greasy?  Yes, but it's a cheese steak, it's supposed to be.  If I eat there, I get a 10", but if it's to go I'll go for the 15".  My favorite is the bacon cheese steak with mayo (you have to ask for mayo on that one).  Or the pizza cheese steak is good also.  I would say that this is not an everyday place, but once a week for sure.  Oh, and fries are a must.  I know curly fries or regular fries, decisions, decisions.  There's no right answer, it's just preference I guess.  Me, I like the regular steak fries here.  And be sure to get the frequent buyers card, you'd be surprised how quick it can fill up to give you a free 10".
author: Shane Y.

description: I checked out this place because it was pretty hyped up by one of my friends. She hyped it up really good so upon coming here my initial impression was kind of below expectations..was kind of expecting something fancy but it kinda looks like a run down fast food joint. I ordered the steak and mushroom and I'll admit, it didn't look that good at first but then I took a bite and.....DAAAMNNN!! Like, shit is bomb. I didn't even go in there really hungry at first so I just got the 10" but at the end of my meal I really regretted not getting a 15" that my friend across from me had ordered. I also had a side dish of steak fries, good not great but did the job a side dish is supposed to do. I will admit the only thing I have to compare cheesesteak to is the crap they give you at the malls a la Great Steak Escape or whatever but I came away satisfied. The 4 star rating Yelp gives you sums it up nicely "Yay! I'm a fan. "
author: Carlo R.

description:
There is nothing like these on this side of the Mississippi. If I could eat one of these everyday for the rest of my life I wouldn't need anything else. Just me and my cheese steak together in everlasting bliss. That being said let me give you a couple tips to ordering-

1. Always call ahead. Unless you don't have a phone.
2. Don't assume you will like everything on your cheese steak, you have to try different combinations until you find the steak just right for you. Me, I just like sweet peppers. But I had every combo I could imagine before I landed on that one.
3. Get smalls of both fries, curly and steak. They complement each other quite nicely. And only do the onion rings if you are really feeling it.
4. You are going to need at least two ketchups and five napkins. 
5. When i do Tasty Kakes they are peanut butter and the perfect soda is Root Beer. 

And remember, these are all over the Bay area. Each one is as good as previous so spread the love and find your favorite stop.

Now punch my stamp card.
author: Jake S.

description:
i was on a grumpy 2 year quest for a real cheesesteak here and was about to give up...but this place wins it. its not a cheesesteak if its on a french roll, has mayo on it, lettuce i can forgive and if its a real cheesesteak shop they will have cheese whiz somewhere there. gross i know but true and kinda good on a steak.

but this place is it. on an amoroso roll and with tastycakes available. if they only had franks beverages i would be all philly moment. this is why i left philly b.c i woudld eat cheesesteaks twice a week and wake up having to be cut out of my house and airlifted from my bed. a greasy delicious wonder of goodness that will make your belly ache.
author: kelly M.

description: Their slogan "Caution: may be habit forming" doesn't stop me from coming here. This place is awesome, going to school nearby introduces me to a fine establishment such as this one. Even summer break can't stop me from coming to this place to order my favorite cheesesteak (the cheesesteak hoagie). Prices are pretty reasonable, service is pretty good. Though I recommend calling in or ordering online through this website called waiter.com, as you can get your cheesesteak faster without waiting as much as those ordering when they get there.
author: Ethan T.

description:
Could use an extra griddle to get some quicker service, but if you are willing to wait 15-20 minutes for a legit cheesesteak, then this is as good a spot as any to do so.  Curly fries were solid but nothing mermorable.  Make sure you get the peppers as it adds something to it you'd miss by passing on them.

Oh, and for those who think they aren't greasy/meaty enough, order it 'king' size.  Yeah, it's $1.99 more, so what?  Sometimes a craving cannot be satiated.
author: James S.

description: Cheeeeeesesteak!!!!!   Pretty good grub.  Whatever you do, DON'T get the hoagies!!!  They will taste like Quizno's.  Yeah, the place is a bit of a hellhole, but the Cheesesteak, when ordered properly, is worth the visit.
author: Darren V.

description: i was craving fatty food, and what better to fulfill that craving than a 7" cheesesteak with curly fries?  i'm not a cheesesteak connoisseur but it fell a little short of my expectations.  the bread was dry and just a notch above subway bread, and the first few bites of the meat and cheese were good but not outstanding.  however, the service was great, the establishment was clean and the fries were really good because they were freshly fried.  if anything, i might just go back for an order of curly fries!
author: Janet L.

description: Excellent.  Sunnyvale location too.  Amaroso rolls.  Tasty kakes.  Yum.
author: Mary B.

description:
OK listen, don't mess around, get a large Deluxe with sweet and hot peppers and grilled onions ("with"). I cannot emphasize enough how important both the sweet and hot peppers are to the experience. And for the love, no chicken or turkey or anything else. BEEF STEAK. After that, yes there are other tasty things here, but if it's your first time, start with this. Eating hot off the grill is good, but they are also fantastic when taken home and giving the grease time to just slightly congeal, and the flavors to mix. Plus, your car will smell amazing inside for a week.

I've been going to this place for 20 years (University in Berkeley and more recently on Divisidero in SF) and it's remained remarkably consistent. They grill the meat the same way (chop it up on the grill with a pair of spatulas) and use the same authentic ingredients. I asked a woman who works there once about the meat and she said something about they got the meat from the east coast because they wanted yellow fat where I guess meat on the west coast tends to be marbled with white fat. No idea if that's still true but I do know they still get the bread (roll) from Philly, a critical component. I think maybe the cheese too.

Loads of grease? Check. Calories equal to the recommended daily amount for a small village? Check. Gooey cheese and accompanying cholestorol? Check check. This stuff will kill you if you eat it everyday, but wow...so rarely have I gotten cravings so often in the middle of the night for a certain food (this along with Flint's and Zachary's). This is one of the best sandwiches you will ever have in your life and if you don't think so then I think you should just pack it in now.
author: Ben S.

description:
Simply the BEST cheese Steak in ESS-FFF.  Been going here since...the early 90s...dang that was a long time ago.  This was when Mt Zion was just Mt Zion Hospital and not UCSF Mt Zion.  The cheese steaks are still just as good now as they were then.  Altho now theys got more on their menu, I still stick with the regular philly with everything on it.  

I've turned more than a couple o' friends onto this place and when they stray they ALWAYS say  that "Cheese Steak Shop" is soooo much better...
author: T Q.

description: Can't really get cheese steak up Seattle way, so this was a rare treat for me, and it was delicious. I got bacon on it which was an excellent choice. The cheese was incredible, the meat was chopped up grinder style which at first I wasn't sure how I'd feel about but the way it was cooked gave it this almost crusty crunch on the meat that really worked well for that style. Curly fries were way good too and the buttermilk ranch was the perfect dip for those, it was rich and creamy, almost too rich! The place is hole in the wall, reasonably priced. Perhaps there are even better purveyors of cheese steak in town but I was lovin' it. Lovin' it.
author: Sean W.

description: Being from Philadelphia this is the closest you can get to the real deal in SF. I used to live nearby and ate there at least once a week. I left the area but continued to stop in from time to time and the staff still remembers my face and name! I want one right now !
author: Robert M.

description: So good it hurts, Cheese+Meat+Bread never tasted so good. Robin Williams is a fan too; I have proof.
author: Jon R.

description: "Buy 10 get one free" they have a card you can have punched each time you buy a sandwich.  Tuesday's are double-punch days!  Get the 10-footer with mushroom, ask for extra meat, curly fries, bottomless soda.
author: Xavier A.

description:
I definitely do not know what the hype is about.

Ordered:
--15" Philly Cheese steak sandwich
--Large side order of battered mushrooms
--32 oz drink, which I refilled once.

I was not full immediately after the meal, and I was hungry again within 30 minutes.  It's not fair, I suppose, to bring up the hungry card.  At 5' 10" 160 lbs, I eat like a horse, yet maintain a lean body.

Anyway, the food was not that great.  I am not saying that it's bad, but for 15 inches, paying 10 bucks to me is a little steep especially when the sandwich was merely mediocre-tasting and not that filling.  I've tasted better Philly cheese steak before on the boardwalk of Venice Beach.  No joke.  Also, the battered mushrooms were not that great.  I would recommend getting something else.

Taste:  Average (3 stars)
Price:  Too high for portions, imo. (1 star)
author: paul c.

description:
I'm not native Philadelphian.  Golly-gee, never even been there.  So I cannot vouch for it's authenticity as a Philly cheesesteak.  And frankly, I could care less.

The fact remains, this place is f***ing DELICIOUS.  I prefer a 10" philly with sweet peppers and onions, a side of curly fries and a root beer.  It doesn't make me feel too spritely afterwards (mmmm....grease) but once a month is worth it. 

TIP!!! - call in your order in advance.  They give heavy priority to phone orders, and you might need to wait 20+ minutes for your sandwich if you order in the store
author: Green T.

description:
Have you noticed that your cheese steak conversation is always the same? It kinda goes like this:

Person#1 "So, I  tried the new cheese steak place in my neighborhood".
Person#2 "Really"?
Person#1 "Yeah".
Person#2 "Is it as good as Diviz"?
Person#1 "No".
author: Jeff B.

description: been going here for years.  never had a better cheesesteak in my life.  i dont go to PHL so this is as good as it gets out here in cali.  i highly recommend it.  i knew people who drove from the eastbay in traffic here just to eat here.  and even someone who got a off a plane and went straight there.
author: Stan C.

description: mmmm yum. i love their cheesesteaks with sweet peppers and grilled onions. can't go wrong with that and onion rings. me and the bf always get 2 10". i can never finish the whole 10" but thats why the bf is there to gulp it down.
author: Heather S.

description: Ahhhh this is the place that got me to like Philly Cheese Steaks! I would go here every Tuesday, I think, thats the day with the double stamp, and eventually I could get a free sandwich!! They make amazing sandwiches, I love the way they prepare their meat, they chop it into small pieces and its just amazing!!
author: Anna K.

description: omg by far the best cheeses steak sandwich i have ever had.. i have been coing here for years and will never stop.. just wish they stayed open later.. cause i love those sweet cherry peppers!!! and the stamp card is a must have ..i love how its has been the same staff for years.. so i no i wont go home disappointed.. trust you'll use it up quick! love u guys!!
author: Shauna P.

description: Been coming here for years.  Stop by for a snack at least once a month as I'm in the city all the time.  ALWAYS satisfied with my food, not one bad experience out of probably at least 100 since I started coming here.  Quick, easy, tasty, and good price, what more can you ask for.
author: Alex L.

description: best cheese steak spot in SF right now, equal in quality to many in philly, better than jay's, better than all-star donuts.
author: christopher a.

description: Oh Man!  This place is awesome.   So good - I highly recommend the saying "YES!" when they ask you if you want hot peppers.  It's fabulous.  I take away a star because it has taken a little longer than I'd like when I've been there, but that is because they were busy.  Just go. . .you'll see!
author: Laura H.

description: 2 vegetarian options, and I found both to be so-so.  the twisty fries are really good though.  decent value: 7-inch cheesesteak (messy to eat!) + twisty fries = ~$5 out the door, and really filling.
author: George K.

description: as good of a philly cheesteak as you will find in the city. im told they fly all their stuff in from philly everyday. the people who work there do sometimes come across as jerks but im sure i do the same at my job, s who am i to talk. the bbq chicken sandwitch is also great. you can eat there too, plenty of seating. the pictures on the wall of philly are also a nice touch. but make you're ready to wait between 10 and 20 minutes to get your food
author: Andrew D.

description: best cheese steak in SF!  soft bread, delicious finely chopped steak, melting cheese and sweet peppers. i never knew there was one in the city because ive only been to the one in sac. before i found out there was one here Busters on columbus was the next best thing. but the bread at Busters is not quite right and the meat and grilled onion not as tasty. i would give The Cheese Steak Shop 5 stars but they skimp on the meat compared to busters.
author: Jay P.

description: good. drunk food. big sandwiches. good. not much more to say. good.
author: Erin D.

description:
Been to Philly. Went to Pat's and a few other local cheesesteak haunts. Also been all over the Bay Area trying various cheesesteak places out. The only thing that keeps it from being competely authentic is the lack of whiz. But, more importantly, the steaks here are frickin delicious. THE best cheesesteak in the Bay Area. Thank gawd there's more than one! (Berkeley, Walnut Creek and more).
     Poor Doctor L. just doesn't understand. But given that he has about a five word vocabulary and a mind to match, I'm not surprised. Relax my good doctor, and join me for a refreshing sandwich. And after that I'll buy you a fuckin beer, you fucking awesome, angry fool, and we'll berate a walker-fucking-bound grandmother on the fucking street!
     But I digress.
     I got turned on to this place almost 20 years ago at the shop in Walnut Creek when I was in high school. I later kept up appearances at the one in Berkeley while at college. And now the shop on Divis right here in SF commands my gastronomic attention from time to time.
     This place does it right. Comes stock with White American cheese, but you can have provolone etc if you want. Like I said before, tho, no whiz here. You'll need to go to Buster's for that. (And DO go to Busters - Columbus Ave in NB). The bread is a critical part of a good cheesesteak sandwich and this shop has the best. Slightly chewy but substantial, so it doesn't fall apart.  I always get the mushroon steak with grilled onions and sweet peppers (hard to find) and they're the only ones who put the peppers on for you, pre-sliced, instead of giving you 2 or 3 un-sliced whole peppers to deal with yourself. Also, best onion rings in the city. 
     Don't eat here more than once a month or you'll die. But when ya gotta go, this is the place.
author: Paddy T.

description: one of the best cheese steaks i ever had. the only thing is that it takes awhile to get your food, but it's worth the wait! they have many different types of cheese steaks, but my favorite is the mushroom one.
author: Karen H.

description: absolutely bomb. Love getting the 15 inch. Wish it was a little cheaper, but its worth every dollar, my dads from philly and he says this is one of the best places.
author: Jonas h.

description: I think they're overpriced...about $10 for a philly cheesesteak?... But....it's THE BEST cheeseteak I've ever had!
author: Elle B.

description: greasy and satisfying.  really divey so usually better to take out.  call ahead and then pickup is supa fast -- no lines, no waiting!  good curley fries.  get a sandwhich with spinach and mushrooms for an extra .20 or so; still greasy and satisfying, but at least you get your veggies and can pretend you're eating healthy. the marinara sauce doesn't really work.  never been to philly so can't comment on the authenticity, but this is clearly no "cali-cuisine" sandwich.
author: Ari G.

description: Light and fluffy cheese steak the same way krispy kremes are light and airy donuts.  Not greasy at all.  This is great, just remember how light they are when you're ordering, bc the standard 6 in just isn't enough.  Could use more meat.
author: M K.

description: this place is awesome. fries are awesome. hot peppers on hot melty cheesy meat with mushrooms and onions and good bread are awesome. i swear, the only thing i miss about living in the city is all the food. i can't wait to try the location in elk grove. if there really is one that is.
author: Brokester C.

description: The BF and I went to philly this summer and tried 7 cheesesteaks in one day. We did Genos, Pats, Jims,Tonys, Izzys...the whole shebang....and we still both agree that we like cheesesteak shop in SF more. How crazy is that? There's just too much bread in philly....I'm paying for nice greasy beef...not a chewy old roll. Perfect ratio of more meat than bread here! Stick with the original and try not to go too overboard with all the fancy stuff...meat cheese onions and sweet and spicy peppers is more than adequate to curb any cravings. I'm usually one of those girls that only eats half a sandwich at the deli but can finish the whole 10'' here...so prepare accordingly...
author: Emily W.

description:
oh philly. 
it's the amoroso bread that puts this place ahead of all the other "authentic" philly cheese steak places. that and the tastycakes.
author: J K.

description: this place isnt the cleanest which is pretty apparent as soon as you walk in but the food definitely made up for it.  the sandwiches are on a soft and light roll that is topped with meat and cheese along with your choices of mushrooms, onions, bell peppers, etc.  prices are extremely cheap and the sandwiches are prepared well with the meats being tender and not tough at all.  definitely will come back.
author: Landon Y.

description: nice and greasy! that's cheese steak. if you dont like it.... balls! what is this, amateur hour? this place provided one of the first cheese steaks i have ever had in my life.. and everything else has fallen short! maybe it's time to make a trip out to philly. until then, this place second to none in the city
author: geoffrey l.

description: This is the spot. Best cheesesteak in the city! Unfortunately, parking can be brutal. Hang over cure and potential heart stopper. Sooo good!!
author: Kevin K.

description: warriror hungry...cheeseteak hold the sweet peppers, insert into mouth and get the saturated fat high, wash, rinse, repeat.  much better then jay's cheesesteak #2 down the street.
author: Pickle R.

description: let me just say these cheese steaks are freaken great. and ive tried the best of the best out in philly so ya these are right up there. beaware if u live or work near by you'll have to stop yourself from going so often. as a matter of fact  i want one right now!!! Very straight foward place no science to it beef steak on a hoggie roll with cheese wiz sauce.
author: joselyn b.

description: This place is WAY TOO close to my home. And yes, as the sign says, "May be habit forming"... they are correct!! Even makes it worse with the redemption card and working hard for that free 10" cheese steak, LOL! Ok, I always order the same thing, the pure staple, 10" cheese steak w/ grilled onions and hot and sweet peppers. Amazing! A little messing so make sure to grab some napkins, but I would prefer paper towels ;). You may have to wait a while for your sandwich during rush hours like lunch and dinner but the wait is worth it..secondly, they always have the daily papers around so you can catch up on the news as your mouth begins to water in anticipation of your meal. btw - the only thing I have a gripe with is that some of the peppers sometimes still have the stems or top parts attached, just have a glance before eating and pull them off, it is a small thing to ask for an amazingly habit forming sando. Oh, secondly, I have friends on the Peninsula that drive up here to meet me for lunch for they love this place as much as I do. Enjoy!
author: Eric R.

description:
this place is the shit. you dont go there for decor so much as some of the pictures on the walls probably go back to the 80's. no you go there for their excellent and very large cheesesteaks and all around good food. they also have solid friendly service and even the day's newspaper splayed out on the walls for your reading ease. on top of that this place has been around forever and is a favorite spot for many of my fellow locals. that in and of itself speaks volumes.

personal favorite order: 10" BBQ chicken cheesesteak and some curly fries.
author: A G.

description: You don't buy them because they are healthy - you buy them because they taste good.  A bit slow, but worth it.  A masterpiece of food if you know what you are looking for.
author: Inspector G.

description: Best cheesesteak this side of Philly--excellent steak quality.  Wish they delivered!
author: Janet R.

description: This is what i compare any PHILLY cheesesteak i ever have eaten to. I never had an authentic Philly from the Philly. But all the products come from Philly. This would have to be one choice for my last meal on earth. Its piping hot when you get it, i have never been disappointed with the sandwich. Ohhh and the Bacon Philly is on point. A must try at least once if youre visiting the City or as a reguar Frisconian resident.
author: Joao M.

description: Best cheesesteak in town. Stick with the original and get both types of peppers (sweet & hot) with the grilled onions. You can get hot sauce from the dude behing the counter when you pick up your order, but you have to ask for it. Tuesdays are double stamp days. The place gets hella busy during lunch hours so if you expect a long wait call in your order ahead, even if it's only 10 min before you get there.  Then you can skip the long line and save about 20 minutes of waiting.
author: Victor H.

description: This cheesesteak Gave me a mouth orgasm.  It was the best sandwich I have ever eaten in my life.  I can only have them once a month.  But every time I go I feel like I am cheating on my boyfriend.  It is that damn good
author: Michelle J.

description: BEST CHEASE STEAK EVER!!!!  I use to go there all the time, but had to stop because it was so addicting, but I go every once in awhile now and they havent lost it.  Last couple times i was there this dude named Carlos made them for me and MAN can that guy cook.  If you go don't forget to get your card that way you can get a free one later on.
author: Jay S.

description: Been here a bunch of times in my life.  This was the first place I had a cheesesteak at and so far still the best after many other attempts trying other places throughout the years.  Cherry peppers add a great texture and sweetness to this fine sandwich and to me is a must.  I always order my cheesesteak sandwich with provalone and mushrooms. Yummy!  Their fries are actually steak fries which are thick and meaty and go well with the sandwich.  Not the cheapest sandwich shop in town, but unique and good enough that the price you pay seems to be worth it.  This place is in a decent part of town, but the past couple times I've been there I noticed a strong smell of urine, probably from some bum who likes to venture in there a lot , so dining in in not an option unless you like the smell of urine and beef mixed into one.  I now order to go and visit the Starbucks a few doors down to chomp on my jewel of a sandwich.  Good Eats!!
author: Adam G.

description:
wow i don't really understand what all the hype is about.  allow me to analyze.  i got a 10 inch sandwhich and i was not impressed at all.  first of all the amount of cheese in relation to the steak is pathetic.  then the portion of the meat is pathetic as well.  the problem with these cheesesteaks is that there is more bread than meat.  i am really surprised that this chain store has such a high following.  so i guess that the conclusion is that most people who review this place are______.  Either they dont know this is a chain store or they have not had an authentic philly.
the closest thing ive had to a philly is jake's and although they are idiots and cant figure out how to deliver an order jake taught them how to make a cheesesteak before he sold the place.  and it has not changed.  amoroso rolls filled with twice as much meat as this place on divisadero and drowned in cheesewhiz.  forget about it.
I really dont understand why this place gets better reviews that Jakes.  i think the real reason is because Jakes delivers and their delivery staff is absolutley retarded which other yelpers have noticed as well.  as for me i'm not subscribing to the retarded majority on this one.  How can you support a chain as oppsed to an independent business?  I guess i will remain in the monority on this one but i walked in having high hopes and i walked out thinking about Jake's.
this is a true story and i have no connection to jakes.  in fact i am blacklisted from ordering there because i yell and scream when they fuck up my order which they do almost every time.
author: Anthony Y.

description: im officially a habitual. that first bite was heaven. i almost went in and ordered another 7'. but i decided against it, seeing that i only have one hour for lunch, and the wait is about 15 minutes (after you order, that is). and there was no way i was sitting in that place to eat, so i basically walked around the area and my workplace, eating that philly cheesesteak. despite the non-cleanliness (which im usually a huge critic of), im STILL coming back. bravo, cheese steak shop. bravo.
author: Judy L.

description: i can honestly say that the cheese steak place is the best i have ever eaten at any location. nothin compares. just dont eat it everyday or else you will be putting on the pounds fast.
author: Kevin M.

description: best cheesesteak in the city! nuff said
author: brendan w.

description: "double stamp tuesdays!  only 5 tuesdays will bag you a free 10" cheesesteak!  kinda greasy but very tasty."
author: jaron c.
